loans.name: Pedro Claver

texts.es:
Pedro es un luchador incansable que toda su vida ha enfrentado las dificultades con tenacidad, y ha procurado salir adelante frente a la adversidad, y como padre de 5 hijos siempre ha trabajado con esmero para brindarles un mejor futuro, sin embargo las posibilidades económicas son muy pocas, Pedro trabaja como asistente de construcción, lo que le dificulta tener un ingreso fijo.

A sus 46 años de edad, sueña con tener su propio negocio, motivo por el cual hoy solicita un crédito con el cual dar el primer paso, pues ya tiene contactos que le ayudarán a emprender este nuevo reto y con el préstamo comprará el primer surtido para su legumbrería que espera con el tiempo tenga un progreso económico, mejorando así su calidad de vida, y le brinde la oportunidad de que éste sea el legado que pueda dejarle a su familia
texts.en:
Peter is a tireless fighter, who has been persistent in the face of difficulties and made his way through adversity. He is a father of 5 children and has always worked diligently to provide a better future for his family, but there are very few economic opportunities. Peter works as a construction assistant, but this makes it difficult to have a fixed income.

At 46 years old, Peter dreams of owning his own business which is why he has applied for this loan, with which he will take the first step. He already has the contacts he needs help him undertake this new challenge, and with the loan he can buy the best produce for his vegetable stall. With time he hopes to progress financially and improve their quality of life, and this loan gives him the opportunity to build a legacy that he can leave to his family.

loans.use: to purchase produce to stock his vegetable stall

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is a married woman. For the last two years, she has been selling mobile phone airtime cards to earn a living. Previously, she operated a retail shop. In the next 5 years, she wants to become successful in her business. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy mobile phone airtime cards for resale.

loans.use: To buy mobile phone airtime cards.

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is married but doesn't have children yet.  She is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Ailyn is a farmer and specializes in rice production to earn a living.  She has been doing this for 5 years.  Ailyn has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase fertilizer for her rice production.  

Ailyn has been a member of PMPC for 2 year.  She hopes to make her business successful in the near future.

loans.use: buy fertilizer

loans.name: Girasoles Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama girasoles  sus integrantes  decidieron ponerle  así  por que les gusta mucho esa  flor su color y su hermosura.
Una de  sus integrantes es la señora  Adela Regina  de treinta y nueve años de edad  quien se dedica a la venta  de Artesanías sobre tela, generalmente hace ropa, como batas para niñas y señoras y cuellos para bordar.
Esta felizmente casada  con el señor Rodolfo de cuarenta años de edad  con quien tiene un hijo  quien se llama Rodolfo  igual que su padre; cuando doña Adela  no tiene mucho manta (tela) para tejer, va con su  familia  a la  milpa a cortar elotes y a traer elechos para venderlos.
Esta muy contenta con su crédito  ya que lo va invertir el compra de mantas ,hilos ,agujas, cuellos  para bordar y aros para cocer.
Lo que mas le gusta de su negocio es la creatividad que tiene para combinar los clores para tejer sus batas.
Lo que  mas le inspiro a tener su propio negocio  son las tradiciones de su pueblo ya que  cuando las niñas de las escuelas salen en un bailable la contratan para que confeccione los vestidos y le haga bonitos detalles.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son:
Reina- se dedica a la venta de quesos.
Analy Yuridia- se dedica a ala venta de tortillas.
María Adelina: se dedica a la venta de masa  y a moler nixtamal.
María Gregoria – se dedica a la venta de tortillas.
Ricarda- se dedica a la venta de comida.
Rosario – se dedica ala venta  de antojitos mexicanos.
Francisca  Gelasia- se dedica a la venta de  antojitos mexicanos.
Margarita- se  dedica a la venta de ropa.
Audelia – se dedica a la venta  de antojitos mexicanos.
Adela Regina- se dedica a la venta de  ropa.
Socorro- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Le dan las gracias a fundación  por el apoyo que les ha dado para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The Girasoles (sunflowers) group is so-called because the members love the beauty and colour of this flower. One of the members is 39-year old Sra. Adela Regina who earns her living selling crafts made of fabric such as clothing, gowns for little girls and women, and embroidered collars.

Adela is happily married to 40-year old Sr. Rodolfo. They have a son also called Rodolfo like his father. When Adela doesn’t have much embroidery to do, she goes with her family to the fields to cut corn  and bring back ferns to sell. She is very happy to get a loan as it will enable her to buy blankets, thread, collars for embroidering, and rice for cooking. She really likes the opportunities for creativity with colours that her work embroidering gowns provides.
 The other members of the group and their jobs:
Reina -- sells cheese
Analy Yuridia -- sells tortillas
María Adelina -- sells pastry dough and grinds maize dough (used to make tortillas)
María Gregoria -- sells tortillas
Ricarda -- sells food
Rosario -- sells local snacks
Francisca Gelasia -- sells local snacks
Margarita -- sells clothing
Audelia -- sells local snacks
Adela Regina -- sells clothing
Socorro -- sells local snacks

They all wish to say thank you to the Foundation for the support it has given them to secure a better future.

loans.use: para la compra de hilos,ajugas,manta  y cuellos para bordar.

loans.name: Ana Yancy

texts.es:
Ana, vive con su mama y sus hermanos, es soltera, dueña de una tienda, el negocio lo comenzó gracias al apollo de su madre quien siempre se a dedicado al negocio, tiene experiencia en el  y no cuenta con un horario establecido de trabajo.
Ella esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de productos para su tienda como aceite, maíz, arroz y demás, esta compra le ayudara a crecer en el negocio, tener mas clientela y mejorar sus ganancias.
La aspiracion de Ana es tener un negocio mas grande, tener su propia casa y vivir feliz con su familia con mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her mother and siblings.  She’s single and owns a store.  The store began with support from her mother who has always been in business.  She has experience in it and does not have a fixed work schedule.

She’s asking for a loan to buy more products for her store like: corn, oil, rice and others.  This purchase will help her business grow, to have more customers and to improve her profits.  Ana’s hope is to have a bigger business, own her own house and to live happily with her family with better income.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Soulemana

texts.fr:
Soulemana est un homme âgé de 29 ans. Il est célibataire. Il a un enfant
Soulemana travaille comme vendeur depuis 2006. Il vend des produits vétérinaires pour tous clients à domicile. Il achète les produits à Agbalepédo, Agoè et Wuiti. Il travaille seul. 
Soulemana a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits vétérinaires. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité. 
 Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit de se marier.
texts.en:
Soulemana is a 29-year-old man. He is unmarried and has one child.
Soulemana has worked as a retailer since 2006. He sells veterinary products for all types of customers at his home. He buys his products at Agbalepédo, Agoè, and Wuiti. He works by himself.
Soulemana has requested his first loan from WAGES in order to buy veterinary products. He wants to reinvest in his business.
He says that with the profits, he intends to get married.

loans.use: To buy veterinary products.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Mrs. Yen is a 48-year-old married woman who lives in Baray district, Cambodia. To earn a living, Yen sells fresh fish in a local market. She also raises piglets in her backyard - both for slaughter and for offerings. She has four children who are all single and live with her in her thatched house.  

Mrs. Yen is requesting a loan from HKL and Kiva to supplement her capital so she can tile the roof of her house and expand it. The loan will provide her family with a more comfortable standard of living. In the future, she plans to improve her pig-fattening business.

loans.use: to tile the roof of her house and expand it.

loans.name: Mariefel

texts.en:
Mariefel is married with one child. She is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines.
Mariefel is a farmer and raises hogs to earn a living. She has been doing this for one year. She has requested a loan to buy piglets for her hog raising business.
Mariefel has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and become a supplier of pork meat in town.

loans.use: To purchase piglets for her hog raising business.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya, and has been practicing maize farming for eight solid years. Emily says her family of four school-going children fully relies on her farming income for their daily meals and education. 

Emily has requested a loan of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to commence dairy farming by buying and insuring a dairy cow. She wants to diversify her farming business to spread the risks due to challenges of the cereals industry, especially the government, which is the recipient of a majority of maize farmers' supply. She adds that she will soon be keeping poultry as well.

Emily notes the poor road networks and high cost of feeds are among the challenges she faces.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Tito Esau

texts.es:
Tito, tiene un taller de sastrería y venta de desinfectante, vive con su esposa y desde hace tres años está dedicada al negocio, tiene varios clientes que le solicitan sus trabajos de sastre así también sale a vender ambulante el desinfectante por los lugares cercanos.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de material para hacer desinfectantes, también comprara telas de diferentes colores y tipos, esto mejorara su capacidad.
La aspiración de Tito es mejorar su negocio y poder ofrecerle a sus hijos un futuro mas alentador.
texts.en: Tito has a tailor shop and sells disinfectant. He lives with his wife and he's been in this business for three years. He has various customers who come to him for tailoring work, and he also goes out to sell disinfectant in nearby places. At this time he is asking for a loan to buy the materials to make disinfectants, and he will also buy fabric in different colors and types and this will increase his potential. Tito aspires to improve his business and to be able to offer his children a more encouraging future.

loans.use: to buy the materials to make disinfectant, and fabric in different colors.

loans.name: Savy

texts.en:
Savy is 42 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kratie Province, Cambodia. She has been working as a teacher for more than twenty years, earning approximately $4 daily. Her husband sells soy milk. He earns about $25 each day.

Savy is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase timber to build a new house. This money will help her provide better living condition for her family. In future, she would like to run a grocery store at home and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase timber to build a new house

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania is 54 years old and lives in Lobogon, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children. 

Epifania sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 15 years. She has requested a loan to add capital to her business. 

In the future, Epifania hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to add a capital in her business.

loans.name: Diamante Group

texts.es: Adriana es integrante del grupo Diamante, es una mujer casada, de 35 años, tiene 5 hijos, Paola de 15, Brandon de 14, Magaly de 8, Esperanza de 3 y Rodrigo un bebé de 5 meses y se dedica a la venta de lentes y pájaros para la decoración de casas y oficinas, el crédito lo usará para comprar los mismos artículos, ya que tiene muy buenas ventas. Su sueño es progresar para darles un buen estudio a sus hijos, y poder mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Adriana is a member of the group “Diamante”.  She is a 35-year-old woman who is married and has five children:  Paola (age 15), Brandon (age 14), Magaly (age 8), Esperanza (age 3), and Rodrigo (a 5-month old baby).  

Adriana sells glass artifacts and live birds that are used to decorate houses and offices.  Her loan will be used to buy these items since she generates very good sales.  Adriana dreams of making progress so that she can provide a good education for her children and make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to buy glass artifacts and live birds to sell as decorations.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Hello, Kiva lenders! Meet Dorcas, a loving, caring and hardworking mum who is 47 years old. She hails from Eldoret area of Kenya, which is a very fertile place for agriculture and also home to world record holders in athletics. Dorcas is a proud mother of three children whom she really loves and adores. Through hard work and patience, she has practiced farming for the past eight years. She has gained so much experience through those years. Dorcas practices mixed farming and her primary sources of income are from milk, eggs, and crops.

Dorcas enjoys farming a lot. The most enjoyable part for her is dairy farming. She enjoys taking care of her cattle. She has even nicknamed one of her cows “Murgut.”

Although Dorcas enjoys dairy farming, she lacks funds to buy another dairy cow to increase her milk output. She is seeking a loan to buy a dairy cow. Eldoret has a good market for milk, and getting clients will never be a problem. Therefore, Dorcas will be assured of maximum profits. Through these profits, she intends to increase her business and start a dairy shop where she will sell milk both wholesale and retail.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Eufrocina

texts.en: Eufrocina is a rice grower from Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. She finds pleasure in doing her farming activities and earn as well for her family. As a Microfinance member of PMPC, she has seek financial help to purchase rice seeds will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings. In the future, eufrocina wishes to become the supplier of rice grains in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings

loans.name: Maritoña

texts.en:
Mrs. Maritoña is a young woman who is facing life on her own. She is divorced and has two small children who are 4 and 6 years old. After the divorce, and seeing the family expenses grow, she decided to start her own jewelry business which allowed her to generate an income and care for her children at the same time. She hopes to offer them everything they need and most importantly to provide them an education.

Her business and the demand for her products has grown. Therefore, she needs a loan for $250 USD to purchase various products such as necklaces and chains which are in high demand. She knows that with this investment she will be more productive which will help to repay her loan within 3-6 months.

** Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch:

La señora Maritoña G. es una mujer joven que enfrenta la vida sola, ya que esta divorciada y tiene dos hijos pequeños que mantener, de 4 y 6 años respectivamente. Ante esa situación y viendo que los gastos de sus hijos eran cada día mayores, decidió iniciar su negocio de venta de joyería, el cual le permitiría generar ingresos adicionales y a la vez no desatender a sus hijos. Ella espera poder brindarles a sus hijos todo lo necesario y sobre todo poder costearles su educación en un futuro.

Su negocio ha ido creciendo y la demanda por sus productos también, es por ello que solicita un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 250 USD para comprar diversa mercancía como dijes y cadenas que son las que mayor demanda tienen, ella sabe que con esta inversión podrá conseguir mejores utilidades que le ayudaran a que fácilmente pague su préstamo en un plazo de 3-6 meses.

loans.use: Purchase various products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business

loans.name: Ma. Del Rocio

texts.en:
María Del Roció G. already has more than 11 years of experience in the bread baking business. She is a single mother. The bakery is her only income and her only way to move her family ahead. She is applying for a loan to buy a machine with which to beat the dough mixture when preparing bread.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Ma. Del Roció G. tiene ya mas de 11 años en el negocio de panadería ella es madre soltera y es su único ingreso que tiene para sacar adelante a sus hijos ella esta pidiendo un préstamo para la compra de una maquina para batir la mezcla del pan.

loans.use: Purchase of machine to beat together the bread ingredients

loans.name: Juana Luisa

texts.en:
Juana Luisa P. B., 30, learned to sew on a manual sewing machine ten years ago, and managed to buy a treadle machine with help from her father. However, in recent years, she hasn't been able to afford material to make clothes with, so the machine was mouldering in the corner. With this loan through Friendship Bridge, Juana will buy materials to make the delicate blouses with hand embroidery that are beloved by local women. Material for each blouse costs about US$20 and she can sell the blouse for about US$26, for a $6 profit. Juana completed school to  the sixth grade level, and can read and write both Spanish and her mother tongue, Quiché. She wants to make sure that all her three children stay in school, but she also wants to make sure and teach them how to sew so they can join in the family business.  Her husband is also a weaver and they want to pass on that ancient tradition to the children as well, teaching them how to produce the beautiful local fabric which can be sewed into skirts, table covers, bed clothing, and shawls.
Written by Kiva Fellows: Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay

loans.use: Fabric for making blouses

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 30 years old. She is married and has 3 children, two of them in school. She has a small sewing shop in her house. She has applied to get $1200 to purchase a new sewing machine and some new fabric in order to expand her business, develop herself and increase her income.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new sewing machine

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr:
La commune d’arrondissement de Thiaroye sur mer est une commune où sévit encore la pauvreté. Mais la population  très travailleuse lutte chaque jour pour sortir de cette situation. C’est ce contexte de lutte contre la pauvreté que les membres du gie diappo liggueye qui ont pour objectif le progrès socio économique de ses membre en particulier s’est inscrit dans  e projet et sollicite vote appui. Les activités tournent globalement autour du commerce .les cinq bénéficiaires sont déjà actives et compte renforcer leurs activités voir les diversifier.. ce prêt sera divisé entre les cinq bénéficiaire . Nous aurons le groupe de Celles qui ferons de la transformation de produits locaux en jus de fruit. Celles qui feront seront dans le commerce de légumes et des produits halieutiques et produit divers .et celles qui seront dans la teinture et la ventes des tissus teints.

Note: there are five members in this group and only three were available to be photographed at the time the Loan Officer visited.

loans.use: 1ere activité : vente de jus de fruit et de crème glacées ,2eme activité : teinture et vente de tissu ,3eme activité : vente de légumes , produit halieutique et produit divers

loans.name: Mokhy

texts.en: Mokhy F. lives in B.Gafurov, Tajikistan. She is married and has 4 children.  She has been an active client of MicroInvest  since 2002.  She trades in the  bazaar “Samy Rakhmon” where her pharmacy is located. She has a large assortment of products so she has permanent clients. Here one may find medicines at an affordable price. But nevertheless, continued investment is required so Mokhy requests a loan to expand her business and to keep up with her medicine turnover rate.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Doña Martha was born in the interior of the country on the Atlantic Coast of Nicaragua. Due to the lack of employment, eleven years ago she immigrated to the city of Managua, in search of a better life. Martha is a widow, with seven children, and four are males and 3 are females. She works selling clothing as a traveling salesperson. It’s the only means she has to support her family and thanks to street vending she has been able to support her family. Her way of work is based on buying the clothing and then going to the different communities to sell it. She needs a loan so that she will be able to buy more clothing and increase the income that supports her family.

Translated from Spanish by Johnny of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

Doña Martha nació en el interior del país en la Costa Atlántica de Nicaragua, pero debido a la falta de empleo, hace once años emigró a la ciudad de Managua en busca de mejor vida. Doña Martha es viuda y tiene 7 hijos, 4 varones y 3 mujeres. Se dedica a la venta ambulante de ropa. Es el único sostén de su familia y gracias a estas ventas a podido subsistir con su familia. Su forma de trabajar se basa en comprar la ropa y después viajar a los departamentos a colocarla. Necesita el préstamo para comprar más ropa y generar los ingresos que son el sostén de su familia

loans.use: Buy clothes and shoes for her business.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Ms. B. has been earning a living selling meals for over a year. This business -- that she started out when she found herself alone with four children -- is the only source of income for her family. She is asking for a loan in the amount of $1000.00 to purchase more merchandise and utensils to prepare the food as well as some furniture.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Maribel tiene ya más de un año con su negocio de ventas de comida. Este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de mi familia. Empecé con este negocio cuando me quede solo y con mis cuatro hijos, pero nos esta haciendo falta mas mercancía para le elaboración de los platillos y mas inmobiliario. Solicitamos un prestamos de $1,000.00 Dlls para la comprar de mercancía y inmobiliario.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise and furniture

loans.name: Ni Ketut Bentri

texts.id:
As a Hindu Balinese woman, Ni Ketut Bentri owns a trade in the preparation of traditional sweets/snacks often used in performing religious offerings. Everyday Ni Ketut Bentri makes sweets/snacks from morning till evening and after they have been sliced thinly meeting with the measurements, then sunned till dry. Capital used Rp. 500.000.- (about USD55). Price per 100 pieces is Rp. 11.000.- (USD1) and 1,000 pieces Rp. 110.000.- Ni Ketut Bentri is able to make 1,000 pieces per day. Income made amount to Rp. 50.000.- (USD5.50) daily. This income is used to fulfill the needs and for the children’s education in school in SMEA and SMP. Her home is built on her property, a simple building. Her hope that this funding from Dinari, she can purchase more raw ingredients to increase the production of sweets and serve more customers thus increasing her income.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Sebagai seorang wanita Bali yang beragama Hindu, Ni Ketut Bentri mempunyai usaha membuat jajan tradisional yang sering digunakan untuk perlengkapan sesajen. Setiap hari Ni Ketut Bentri membuat jajan dari pagi sampai siang dan setelah jadi jajan diiris tipis-tipis sesuai dengan ukurannya, kemudian dijemur sampai kering. Modal yang dipakai Rp. 500.000.- Harga per 100 biji adalah Rp.11.000.- dan 1.000 biji harganya Rp.110.000.- Ni Ketut Bentri sanggup membuat jajan sampai 1.000 biji per hari. Keuntungan yang diperoleh sebesar Rp. 50.000.- perhari. Keuntungannya ini dipakai untuk memenuhi kebutuhannya dan untuk pendidikan anaknya yang masih sekolah di SMEA dan di SMP . Rumahnya dibangun ditanah sendiri dengan bangunan yang cukup sederhana. Harapannya dengan pinjaman yang diperoleh dari Dinari, ia akan belikan bahan baku lebih banyak lagi sehingga dapat memproduksi jajannya lebih banyak lagi dan melayani pelanggan yang lebih banyak supaya keuntungan yang didapatpun bertambah.

loans.use: Purchase raw ingredients to make cakes until production increase (Membeli bahan baku membuat kue sehingga bisa memproduksi lebih banyak lagi)

loans.name: Lanza 4 Group

texts.es:
Gloria is 34 years old, has two children, and for 8 years has traveled to the city of San Cristobal in order to buy clothing. In the beginning she invested in 30 or 40 pieces of clothing, now with her loan and earnings from sales she will invest in buying various styles and sizes of clothing. She belongs to the group called “Lanza 4” along with Gabriela H. H. (who sells refreshments), Flor de Maria A. Azuna (who sells clothing), Julieta M. L. y Adregonia O. L. (who has a grocery store).

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

DOÑA GLORIA TIENE 34 AÑOS, DOS HIJOS. DESDE HACE OCHO AÑOS VIAJA A LA CIUDAD DE SAN CRISTOBAL O COMITAN A COMPRAR ROPA AL PRINCIPIO INVERTIA EN 30 O 40 PRENDAS, AHORA CON SU PRESTAMO Y CON LAS GANACIAS GENERADAS CON VENTAS ANTERIORES INVERTIRA EN LA COMPRA DE ROPA EN DISTINTOS MODELOS Y TALLAS. PERTENECE LA GRUPO LLAMADO LANZA 4 JUNTO CON DOÑA GABRIELA H. H. (VENTA DE REFRESCOS), FLOR DE MARIA A. AZUNA (VENTA DE ROPA), JULIETA M. L. Y ADREGONIA O. L. (TIENDA DE ABARROTES).

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Since childhood, Cristina has been talented in working with her hands, and this is what she now does to support her family. Her qualities have helped her to teach others these skills, and this is what she does; she teaches many mothers from mothers' clubs, 'glass of milk' commitees etc to make things with their hands, as well as selling her own products. She weaves and crochets, and she enjoys doing this every day as it is her vocation, and she must do it to support her three kids.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Cristina, desde su niñez ha tenido un talento para realizar bellos trabajos de manualidades y esto en la actualidad le está sirviendo para sostener a su familia. Sus cualidades le han servido para transmitir estos conocimientos a otras personas y en esto consiste su trabajo, enseña a numerosas madres en clubes de madres, comités de vaso de leche, etc. a los cuales ofrece sus servicios además de realizar estos trabajos para venderlos. Teje a palito y a crochet, y disfruta de este trabajo diariamente porque es su vocación y además le otorga lo necesario para sostener a sus 3 hijos.

loans.use: An injection of capital to buy more raw material/Inyección de capital para adquirir mayor cantidad de materia prima.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a freezer for his ice making business.

loans.name: Khushmurot

texts.en: K. Khushmurot is 26 years old. He is married with three children. His wife is a housekeeper and takes care of their children. Khushmurot is a farmer. He has 3 years of experience, and he has been able to support his family by learning how to take care of and manage his crops in the short growing season. He is producing crops such as wheat, potatoes, onions, tomatoes, and cucumbers. Each year he is growing the yield sufficient for the family consumption and for selling. The business is the main source of income and generating the stable income at the same time requires considerable funding. Thus, now Khushmurot needs to purchase mineral fertilizer and seeds for planting. For this purpose he requests 3400 Somoni ($1000US) for the term of 12 months. Khushmurot would like to use this loan to buy supplies for the harvest and for improving production, and thus increase the quality of his yield along with his earnings at the time of sale. With your help, this will be possible. He thanks all those who support him and promises to pay the loan in time.

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: But

texts.en:
Mr. But M., 34, is a farmer who lives in Phteah Rung Commune, Pursat Province. He grows rice and earns approximately $1 per day. He lives with mother and is responsible for covering the family’s expenses. He has two oxen to use for his farming business. Now he is facing the difficulty of transporting seedlings of rice and other supporting material. He is asking for a loan of 500,000 KHR ($125) to purchase an ox cart to use for his farming business.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL):

HKL is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To purchase an ox cart to use for his farming business

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto tiene 39 años, vive con su esposa y sus 7 hijos, de los cuales el mayor tiene 18 y el último apenas un añito.
Alberto es ganadero, actividad a la cual se dedica hace 25 años y gracias ello puede solventar los gastos de su numerosa familia, por ello, todas las mañanas sale a pastear con sus animalitos para que puedan comer, los guía con mucho cuidado, ya que en un descuido puede perderlos, porque los zorros están siempre atentos a cualquier  descuido.Le agrada cuidar a sus animalitos, ya gracias a ellos puede llevar un plato de comida a sus hijos, aunque lo más difícil es matarlos para llevar su carne a los mercados de las ciudades cercanas.  
Alberto tiene en su numerosa familia, a sus mayores amores y motivadores de su vida.
El dinero que pide se invertirá en la compra de carneritos, los que le ayuden a mejorar su ganado y  lograra ser el mejor ganadero de su localidad.
texts.en:
Alberto is 39 years of age, and he lives with his wife and 7 children, of which the eldest is 18 years and the youngest is only one year old.

Alberto is a livestock breeder, and has been doing this for 25 years. Thanks to this activity, he can cover the expenses of his sizable family. For this reason, he goes out every morning to graze his little animals so they can eat. He guides them with much care, since he may lose them if he loses sight of them because the foxes are always on the lookout for anyone letting their guard down. He enjoys caring for his animals, being that thanks to this he can take a meal to his children, but the most difficult thing is killing them to take their meat to the markets of nearby cities.

Alberto’s big family is his greatest love, and they are the biggest motivators in his life. The loan he is requesting will be invested in the purchase of young sheep, which will help to improve his livestock and help him become the best breeder in his area.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase young sheep to improve the breed and quality of his livestock.

loans.name: Faaaliga

texts.en:
Faaaliga S. is 49 years old and is married with seven children.  She has three years of experience selling pork buns. She sells to the general public and villagers approximately seven days per week. She has had one previous loan with SPBD.  

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala (approximately 104 USD). SPBD loans are Faaaliga's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. Her loan will be used to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, and onions. Her husband looks after their small taro and banana plantation which supports her business in economically weak times.

loans.use: To purchase a sack of flour, sack of sugar, onions, yeast, soya sauce for her pork buns business.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru: Рахматова Дилором, 1972 года рождения, замужем и у них 2 детей. Она торгует детскими игрушками и школьными принадлежностями в магазине Детский мир Гисарского района. В этом бизнесе у нее 5 лет опыта. Ее ассортимент это детские игрущки, машинки, куколки, мячи, школьные карандаши, ручки, тетради и т.д. Покупает свой товар в потовом рынке Корвон и в магазинах Сафар-Центра. Дилором хочет увеличить ассортимент и товарооборот, чтоб получать больше прибыли. Она хочет закупить разновидность машин и кукол с двигающимся механизмом и ей нужны средства в сумме 3000 сомони.
texts.en:
Dilorom R. was born in 1972, she is married and has 2 children. Dilorom sells children’s toys and school supplies at the store Children’s World, in the Gissar region. She has 5 years of experience in this business. Her product assortment includes children’s toys, cars, dolls, balls, school pencils, pens, notebooks, etc. Dilorom purchases her products at the market in Korvon and at the Safar-Center stores. Dilorom would like to increase her product assortment and inventory, in order to increase her profits. She wants to purchase an assortment of cars and dolls with moving mechanisms and she needs to borrow 3000 somoni ($900).

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cars and dolls

loans.name: Dam's Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan for three women who all live in Siem Reap Province. The leader of the group is Mrs. Dam K.. She is 46 years old and makes a living raising pigs from her home. She is the mother of six children: two are married and the rest to go to school. Her husband, Mr. Tem Nhem, 48, is a fisherman. He depends on Beung Tunle Sap Lake, which is the most important place for Cambodia’s fisherman to catch fish. Dam has applied for a loan of $150 to buy more fishing tools for her husband’s work.

The other two group members include Mrs. Toeum R., 33, who is a fisherwoman. She seeks a loan of $150 to buy fishing tools to use for her work. Mrs. Lorn L., 39, makes her living by fishing as well. Lorn is requesting a $150 loan to purchase fishing tools.

loans.use: To buy more fishing tools

loans.name: Ablair Ayolao

texts.fr:
Née à Lomé, la capitale du Togo, Madame V. est une femme de 45 ans qui fabrique les vêtements qui sont prêt a porter.  Elle achète des tissues et pagnes et les utilise pour fabriquer les robes et habits pour les femmes.  Elle a ouvert sa boutique depuis 2007, et elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter les matériaux pour fabriquer les vetements afin de mieux servir ses clients.
Madame V. est marie avec un douanier et ils ont 2 enfants à charge.
texts.en:
Born in Lomé, the capital of Togo, Ms. V. is a 45-year-old woman who makes ready-to-wear clothing. She buys fabrics and 'pagnes' (colorful West African cloth) and uses them to make dresses and outfits for women. She opened her shop in 2007 and is requesting this initial loan to buy supplies to make clothing in order to serve her customers better. Ms. V. is married to a customs agent, and they have two children to look after.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics and 'pagnes'

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert H. is just 23. He is married and has one child who is one month old. He could not express well, the feeling of how it is to be a father. He knows that he has to work hard for the future of his family. Her wife has been very supportive of him and he, the head of the family feels like he has a big responsibility to meet.

His raises pigs because he finds it a profitable business. The profits he gets from selling hogs is what he uses to feed his family. He believes that he has a big future in this kind of endeavor. Now, he is asking for a loan to help him sustain his business and purchase feed for his pigs.

He started his business with only 1 sow. He sells his pigs to many buyers in their hometown. He wants to expand his business and he could only do this with additional capital. He believes that by requesting a CEVI loan, he will be able to earn larger profits to save money for his child’s education.

CEVI helps Albert sustain his business. Because we wanted him to grow his business, he now enjoys available credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage services that we give to our clients.

loans.use: To purchase feed for the pigs

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Djekafo sont toutes mariées et ont une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et de 5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans de familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec les sœurs, frères, enfants, époux et belles mères dans le village de Coni sous préfecture de Fana, région de Koulikoro république du Mali. Unies par des liens social et professionnel, ces femmes exercent les activités d’achat et de vente des sacs de charbon de bois.
 Dans l’objectif de développer leur activité, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur cinquième prêt de groupe. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Ces femmes comptent acheter, 700 sacs de charbon (sac de 100 kg) auprès des paysans producteurs ayant une autorisation dans le village de Coni et environs. Elles effectuent leur vente généralement au comptant en détail et en gros  aux grossistes venant de Fana et d’autres grandes villes. Leur clientèle est composée des hommes aussi bien que des femmes. 
Elles comptent obtenir un bénéfice de 15 000 FCFA  chacune à la fin du cycle. Le bénéfice sera utilisé pour la prise en charge des enfants.
texts.en:
The women of the group Djekafo are all married and average 36 years of age and five children. They live in traditional extended conjugal families with sisters, brothers, children, spouses, and mothers-in-law in the village of Coni (Fana subprefecture) in the Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali. United by social and professional ties, they do work involving the buying and selling sacks of charcoal.

With the goal of developing their business, they have become members of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are on their fifth group loan. All the preceding loans have been correctly repaid. The women plan to buy 700 sacks of charcoal (100 kg each) from rural producers authorized in and around the village of Coni. They make their sales general in cash, retail and wholesale, to wholesalers from Fana and other large cities. Their customers are composed of men as well as women.

They each intend to obtain a profit of 15,000 francs CFA at the end of the cycle. The profits will be used to care for the children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Rayza Gull Group

texts.en:
Rayza Gull is the group leader of Rayza Gull group. There are four members in this group. Each of them would like to receive money for his/her business.

Rayza Gull and Fareyda  want to take a loan for their husbands' book stores to add to the materials in stock. Kamalah   wants to take a loan for his  business of fruit car;  he  wants to buy necessary materials for his  business. Ahmad Faryad  wants to take a loan for his book store  to expand his  business inventory. They all want to make their  businesses larger with this loan of 40,000 Afghani with a term of 8 months.

They are very happy with this loan process in Afghanistan. They want to thank AFSG and Kiva and all lenders around the world.

loans.use: they each want to make his/her business larger

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga A. de 59 años de edad reside en la colonia San Juan, vive junto a su madre. Olga posee una pequeña tienda en la cual vende golosinas y bebidas, ella tiene 42 años de poseer su negocio, el cuál es su principal fuente de ingresos para su hogar. Ella posee una muy buena reputación por ser una mujer muy amigable, responsable y trabajadora, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en calle principal, factor que le beneficia en gran manera. 
Ella ha solicitado un préstamo con el fin de poder comprar otros tipos de bebidas y golosinas, ya que desea aumentar sus ventas y estos son los productos que más demanda poseen. Ella desea poder incrementar su negocio, con el fin de poder ayudar a su madre con los gastos del hogar, de manera que puedan obtener una vida más feliz juntas teniendo todo lo necesario para el hogar.
texts.en:
Olga A. is 59 years old, and lives in the San Juan colony along with her mother. Olga has a small store where she sells snacks and beverages. She has had her business for 42 years, and it is the primary means of income for her household. She has a very good reputation for being a woman who is friendly, responsible, and hard-working. The business is located on a major street, a fact that is of great benefit to her. She has requested a loan with the aim of buying other types of beverages and snacks since she would like to increase her sales, and these are the types of products that are in most demand. She wants to grow her business in order to help her mother with the household expenses, so they can live a happier life together having all the necessities for the home.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more snacks.

loans.name: Raxmon

texts.ru: Рахмон мужчина 39 лет, женат и имеет 4 детей. Работает в колхозе простым рабочим. За работу кроме наличных денег получает продуктами питания, а также во время сезона запасается сеном. Это помогает ему при его занятии дополнительным бизнесом – куплей продажей скота. По выходным он выходит на местные рынки и при возможности покупает там скот по дешевке. Если получится, продает, если нет, то привозит домой и через неделю выводит на следующий базар. Это его дополнительный источник семейного бюджета. Рахмон подал заявку на КИВА и собирается расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Raxmon is a 39-year-old man, married and has four children. He works as a laborer on a collective farm. In addition to cash, he receives food in exchange for his labor. Seasonally he also receives hay in payment that helps him with his second job, which is buying and selling cattle. On weekends he goes out to the local markets and, when possible, buys inexpensive cattle there. If it all works out, he sells them right away, but if not takes them home and tries the next market a week later. This is his additional source of income to support his family. Raxmon applied to Kiva for a loan and is planning to expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
casada con tres hijos. 

Comenzo con su negocio hace 2 años, haciendo demostraciones de productos para el hogar.
ella pide su colaboracion para comprar mas productos y poder hacer estas demostraciones, y seguir con las ventas, ya que es parte fundamental de los ingresos en su hogar, junto con el apoyo de su esposo, para brindarun  mejor futuro a sus hijos.

la señora es buena en las ventas y le han estado demandando mas productos, pero no le alcanza para la compra de estos.

apoyemos este caso emprendedor.
texts.en:
Rosa Maria is married with three children. She began this business two years ago, giving demonstrations for home products. She requests your collaboration to buy more products and to be able to give these demonstrations, which will allow her to continue with her sales. These sales are a fundamental part of her household income. Together with the support of her husband, they want to offer a better future to their children. Rosa Maria is good at sales and has requested more products, but she does not have enough money to make the purchases of these items. Let's support this enterprising person.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY GOODS

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Primer préstamo:
http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=86426&_tpos=2&_tpg=1
María es socia del Bancomunal los Viñedos
A María le gusta la cocina y se vio en la necesidad de dar menús, como le gusta lo hace con gusto, ella reparte menús todos los días a las obras constructoras  que hay por su casa.
María  necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, para  hacer dos cuartos en su casa y poderlos alquilar
Desde que María esta en Finca aprendió a ser más responsable, con los prestamos que recibe y  aprendió a compartir entre las socias. 
El sueño de María es poner un restaurante.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Los Viñedos (The Vineyards) Communal Bank. María likes to cook and she finds herself in need of preparing meals. She likes to cook up a storm and she delivers her meals every day to the construction workers nearby her house. María needs a loan of 2,000 Sols to build two rooms in her house so that she can rent them out. Since María has been working with FINCA Peru she has learned to be more responsible with the loans that she receives. She has also learned to share with the other members. María dreams of having a restaurant. Click HERE to see her First Loan.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build two rooms for rentals.

loans.name: Safiro Group

texts.es: La mayor parte de las personas que componen este grupo son de escasos recursos teniendo como ingreso solo sus pequeños negocios de venta de mercadería como frustras y verduras, artesanías, pan, ropa y al servicio de cerrajería, elaboración de prendas de vestir y al servicio publico de pasajeros. Los miembros que componen del grupo "Safiro" tienen experiencia en los negocios a los cuales se dedican por lo que la competencia latente en el mercado forma parte del diario vivir de cada uno de los socios. La mayoría de los miembros del grupo tienen como destino de su financiamiento el incremento de su capital de trabajo ya que sin el no se puede mejora la calidad de los productos para una mejor competitividad en el mercado. Su presidenta la señora Leonarda y los 13 miembros del grupo cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios gracias a su participación en entidades similares a la Fundación Agrocapital de modo que conocen la responsabilidad y cumplimiento con sus obligaciones así como el manejo de los fondos otorgados.
texts.en:
The majority of people who form this group have scarce economic resources and have only their small businesses as sources of income. They sell merchandise like fruits and vegetables, crafts, bread, and clothing, and offer services as a locksmith, seamstresses, or public transportation. The members of the group, "Safiro," are experienced in the businesses they run, but the latent competition in the market is a part of their daily lives. The majority of the members will use their financing to increase their working capital since without it they can't improve the quality of their products to be more competitive. The group's president, Leornarda, and the thirteen members of the group have experience in suppot groups thanks to their participation in similar groups like Fundación Agrocapital. So they know their responsibilities and comply with their obligations like managing the funds that they are lent.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix M. is from the village of Danao. He is 57 years old. Felix is widowed and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Felix owns and operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Felix has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Felix joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felix has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. Felix is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Felix from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Shaiq

texts.en: Shaiq S. is 22 years old and full of energy and enthusiasm. Shaiq has been in the business of selling cows for over three years. He buys cows from villagers and from people in the nearby province to raise and resell to abattoirs and farmers. Shaiq is requesting a loan of $2000 USD to purchase additional cows to raise for resale. This young man counts on your help.

loans.use: To purchase four cattle

loans.name: Husna

texts.en:
Husna is a member of the Mgodi center borrower group in Kinyanambo, Iringa. She is a 39-year-old woman, married, and the mother of three children. Her children are aged 21, 18, and 11 years.

Husna started her own clothing business selling kitenge and kanga (fabric) one year ago. She works 6 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 60,000 Tanzania Shillings.

This is Husna’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 200,000 TSH in order to buy more kanga, and vitenge (fabric). With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Husna hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.es: Ninfa tiene 37 años, vive con sus 3 hijos: Jean Pierre de 17 años, Coni de 13 años y Grecia de 3 años de edad, en su casa propia. Desde hace 8 años se dedica a la venta de verduras, negocio en el cual incursionó al poseer chacras donde siembra chala (maíz), apio, poro, entre otros vegetales, vendiéndolos  en el mercado “Huamantanga”, uno de los más conocidos de su localidad. Ninfa vende al por mayor, pues trae la mercadería en grande cantidades, ofreciéndola desde las 5 de la mañana, que es la hora cuando los comerciantes minoristas se abastecen, por lo que termina sus ventas a 10 de la mañana y regresa a su domicilio a preparar el almuerzo para sus hijos. Por la tarde, vuelve a reunir los vegetales para repetir el mismo procedimiento al día siguiente. Ninfa se encuentra muy feliz porque ve que poco a poco va progresado su negocio, y esto le da una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Este es su primer préstamo individual con MFP y siempre ha sido muy responsable a la hora de realizar sus pagos cuando trabajaba en grupo, lo cual es un buen precedente. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería para hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Ninfa is 37 years old and has 3 children: Jean Pierre (17), Coni (13), and Grecia (3). They live in their own home. Ninfa has been selling vegetables for 8 years. She travels to various farms to acquire corn, celery, leeks, and other vegetables and sells them in the Huamantanga market, the best known market in the area. She buys in large quantities so that she can sell her products wholesale.

Ninfa begins selling vegetables at 5am, the time when most merchants receive their inventory. Her sales end around 10am, which gives her time to return home and prepare lunch for her children. In the afternoons, she collects her next supply of vegetables so that she can repeat the same routine the following day. She is happy with her business because she can see how it slowly progressed over time and how her family’s quality of life improved.

Ninfa is receiving her first individual loan from MFP. When she worked with a group, she was always responsible in making her payments. She will use the money to purchase vegetables in greater quantities in order to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her supply of vegetables

loans.name: Keji

texts.en:
Keji M. is living in Gudele town next to Gudele primary school. Keji is  a mother of three children who all go to school, she is married to a driver and agging to 28 years.

Keji currently sells beer at the bar and is requesting a loan from Kiva through Brac southern Sudan in order to purchase and stock more beers, wines, whiskies and many others to sell.

With the extra profits from her loan, Keji wants to support her family by building a parmanent house for settlement.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase wines, beers, whiskies etc to sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia sells vegetables. She is married to Perfecto Sr., a tricycle driver who also manages their small farm. This couple is grateful because they have been blessed with four children: the eldest is Perfecto Jr. - 30 years old, high school graduate; then Jorelito - 26 years old, high school undergraduate; Ferdinand - 25 years old, and the youngest is Cristine Joy -16 years old, currently a high school student.

Virginia is 43 years old, yet still very strong and determined to develop her business and improve their poor living situation. She hopes to buy more vegetables to retail so that her vending income will increase. In this regard, Virginia has requested additional business capital of 4,000 PHP from Kiva lenders to further improve her business. The loan is also for the maintenance of their motor vehicle for its transportation service.

loans.use: Additional business capital

loans.name: Mrs. Srey Touch Cheng Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Srey Touch C. is the village bank president of a group of nine people who all live in Smaong village in Takeo province. All the members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Srey Touch is a pig breeder. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it S. she decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding.  She will use the rest of the loan to buy more pig food for her pigs. Her husband, Mr. Saes Thida, is a cow breeder. Mrs. Srey Touch is 31 and the mother of three children, two of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is 4 and is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
La señora Cecilia tiene 63 años y está casada hace 30 años. Ella y su marido trabajan en la producción de leche cruda  y en la agricultura cultivando maíz, papa, cebolla, alfa alfa y zanahoria. Ellos empezaron con 2 cabezas de  ganado  lechero  y actualmente cuentan con 6 cabezas de ganados lechero. 

La señora Cecilia tiene 2 hijos de 20 y 25 años, ellos estudian  carreras técnicas, el hijo mayor 
estudia veterinaria para que en el futuro pueda ayudar a sus padres en el cuidado de su ganado,  el  hijo menor estudia técnico superior en mecánico. Entre sus sueños  y metas de doña Cecilia es ver profesional  a  sus hijos para que puedan tener un mejor nivel de vida. 

El  préstamo será destinado para la compra de una ordeñadora, esto  disminuirá el trabajo manual  y aumentara los litros de leche producidos. Este es el cuarto  crédito que otorga nuestra institución  a la señora Cecilia con los cuales  logro construir su casa, aumentar su ganado lechero y  los más importante  hacer  que los dos hijos sigan estudiando.
texts.en:
Cecilia is 63 years old and has been married for 30 years. She and her husband work in raw milk production and farming corn, potatoes, onion, alfalfa and carrots. They began with two head of dairy cattle and now have six .Cecilia has two sons, 20 and 25 years old, who are studying technical careers. The eldest studies veterinary science so that in the future he can help his parents care for their cattle. The younger son is studying to be a mechanic. Among Cecilia's dreams is to see her sons become professionals so that they may have a better quality of life. The funds requested will be used to buy a milking machine which will reduce the manual labor and increase the quantity of milk produced. This is the fourth loan our institution has granted Cecilia. With past loans she managed to build her house, increase the number of cows and, most importantly, allow her sons to continue their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a milking machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Carmen Alicia

texts.es: La señora  Carmen Alicia S. O., tiene 25 años,  se dedica a la venta de comida, helados de frutas naturales y carnitas de marrano. Iniciò su negocio hace 7 años  únicamente con la venta de carnitas, tuvo la oportunidad en adquirir un local en el mercado  de San Juan Sacatepequez, de ahí surgió la idea de engrandecer su negocio con un comedor al cual llamò  la  Bendición. Ella solicita este crèdito ya que necesita para poder incrementar sus ventas en el comedor y aprovechar para poder invertir tambien en la venta de ropa ya que esta venta la tomò recientemente y necesita mucho capital para poder surtirlo. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora ya que después de haberse dedicado la mañana y tarde a su comedor elabora los helados que vende ya que entrega por cantidades grandes. Entre sus sueños es terminar la construcción  de su casa, y poder brindarle una buen formación escolar a  su niña quien tiene 2 años de edad. Ella se esfuerza para mantener bien su negocio ya que esto le ayuda a ella a mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Carmen Alicia S. O. is 25 years old. She sells food, natural fruit ice cream, and pork carnitas. She started her business 7 years ago selling carnitas, but she had the opportunity to acquire a vending space at the San Juan Sacatepequez Market. At that point, she had the idea to enlarge her business by adding a diner she named “La Bendición” (The Blessing).

Carmen is requesting this loan because she wants to increase the sales of her diner. She also sells clothing, but needs additional capital to acquire more inventory. Carmen is a hardworking woman, having to spend the mornings and afternoons cooking at her diner and then afterwards make large batches of ice cream for delivery. Her dreams include finishing the construction of her house and finding a good nursery school for her 2 year old child. She strives to maintain her business since this helps improve her living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables and food for her diner

loans.name: Hacia Al Futuro 1 & 7 Group

texts.en:
Anna, 25, is a borrower who lives near San Pedro de Macorís, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Hacia Al Futuro (Toward the Future), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in her group. 

Anna lives with her husband in Boca Chica, a small town west of San Pedro. They have a nice home by Dominican standards, with cement floors and walls and a metal roof. Life in Boca Chica can be difficult, without access to potable water or reliable electricity. Despite any hardships, Anna runs a small business from her home, selling clothing and shoes. With this loan, her third with Esperanza International, she will be purchasing the latest styles to sell to her friends and neighbors for a small markup.

Anna is very thankful for her new access to credit. She had taken out loans before coming to Esperanza, but switched because the rates were better and a loan came with free health services. Anna said that her loans have helped her business very much, and that she and the members of her group have all learned to be better businesspeople. Thank you for lending to Anna and the Hacia al Futuro group!

loans.use: To buy clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Peace And Unity Group

texts.en:
Safie C. on the right in the photo is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs from the town of Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. These entrepreneurs have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan in order to boost their businesses.

Thirty-nine years old, Safie sells peppers, palm-oil, and used shoes. She has been in this business since 1990. Business has not being developing in the way she wants it to due to the small capital at hand. She and her colleagues have thus formed themselves into a group of five to seek a loan. With this loan, she will invest in her business by buying two bags of peppers and ten gallons of palm-oil.

loans.use: Buy two bags of peppers and ten gallons of palm-oil

loans.name: Ndiawa

texts.fr: Ndiawa D. est mariée, 34 ans et mère d’un enfant. Elle fait de la teinture, de la couture et du tissage de pagne. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour pourvoir augmenter son capital afin de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa familles.
texts.en:
Ndiawa D. is 34 years old, married with one child. She dyes cloth, sews, and weaves cloth.for "pagnes". She is requesting this loan so that she can increase her working capital and better meet the needs of her family.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Dye cloth, sew, and weave "pagne" cloth

loans.name: Paula Elvira

texts.es: Paula Elvira P. es una señora muy trabajadora ella tiene un pequeño establecimiento de de venta y distribución de tropigas (gas butano de dicha marca). Este es el único puesto que existe en el barrio por lo cual tiene varios clientes. Pero además de esto ella se ayuda haciendo reposterías por encargo en cuyo negocio le va muy bien.
texts.en:
Paula Elvira P. is a very hard-working woman. She has a small store where she sells groceries and also distributes Tropigas (a brand of butane). This is the only store in the neighborhood, so she has various clients. But in addition to this, she helps herself by making special-order pastries, and this business is going very well for her.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bulk grains, soap, meat, etc.

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
L. Nguyễn Thị (20203040064) is a 48 year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  L. is the group leader of a 8-member group L. offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual L., they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Đồng Thôn 2 - Nhóm 11 (Nhóm 11).


L. is married and has 1 adult -aged child.  To making a living, L. owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food.  The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling herbs & spices in the local community.  L. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2.500.000 VND a month from these activities.


L. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  L. is now requesting a new L. of 5.152.000 VND which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  The L. will be the 1st L. taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  L. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business improve her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Trương Thị T. (20203040065) is a 28 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND L. to support her business in the services sector operating a tailoring business.


2.  Cao Thị T. (20203040066) is a 33 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND L. to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.


3.  Trương Thị T. (20203040067) is a 29 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND L. to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


4.  Nguyễn Thị Tú (20203040068) is a 42 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND L. to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


5.  Ngô Thị K. (20203040069) is a 35 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND L. to support her business in the food sector operating a restaurant.


6.  Trương V. T. (20203040070) is a 23 year-old male who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND L. to support his business in the services sector operating a service-based business.


7.  Tô Thị H. (20203040071) is a 28 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND L. to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a manufacturing business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this L. was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


L. Nguyễn Thị (20203040064) là 48 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  L. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 8 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Đồng Thôn 2 - Nhóm 11 (Nhóm 11).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các loại thảo mộc & gia vị trong cộng đồng địa phương.  L. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, L. kiếm được khoảng 2.500.000 VND.  L. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  L. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ SEDA.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Trương Thị T. (20203040065) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh may mặc.


2.  Cao Thị T. (20203040066) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


3.  Trương Thị T. (20203040067) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  Nguyễn Thị Tú (20203040068) là 42 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


5.  Ngô Thị K. (20203040069) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh nhà hàng.


6.  Trương V. T. (20203040070) là 23 tuổi nam.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


7.  Tô Thị H. (20203040071) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To improve and expand her herb and spice business

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon A. is a woman of courage to battle challenges in order to achieve her goals in life. She is 53 years old and married to Sancho A., 52, who is a fisherman. She is a caring mother to three children, all of whom have education degrees. She lives in the coastal place of Talim Island, in the town of Binangonan, Rizal Province, in the Philippines.

In 2007, she joined ASHI (Ahon SA Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines, with an opportunity of having start-up funds for generating income. She carefully invested loans from ASHI in her fish-selling business and it gave her a reasonable earnings. Now on her fourth loan, she requests 20,000 PHP for additional working capital for her fish-selling business. Specifically, the amount will be used to purchase tilapia, big heads, milk fish, ayungin, kanduli, and fingerlings.

As a mother, Corazon dreams of funding her grandchildren to go to school and completing their college degrees so they can find jobs for a healthier life. She also enjoys considering that the loan from ASHI and KIVA partner will change their lives and provide her family's needs.

About ASHI: Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the bottom poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Nueva Vida Group

texts.es:
Nueva Vida

Este banco comunal es llamado Nueva Vida, y está conformado por 15 socios pertenecientes a la ciudad de Curicó. Todos ellos se dedican principalmente a la venta de ropa puerta a puerta y a administrar y atender kioscos en distintos colegios de la ciudad.
Jorge tiene 22 años y es el nuevo presidente de este banco, ya que este cargo cambia cada 3 meses. En la foto se encuentra a la izquierda, en 2º fila y viste polerón azul. Él se dedica a la venta de ropa y paños de cocina. Este préstamo lo invertirá en ropa de invierno como por ejemplo camisetas, pantys y calcetas largas entre otras cosas. Hace 7 meses que Jorge trabaja con Fondo Esperanza y nos comenta que ha sido una gran ayuda, ya que él es estudiante y de esta manera puede pagar sus gastos menores y así ayudar a sus padres con los gastos. Jorge se titula este mes de técnico social y su intención es seguir trabajando con Fondo Esperanza, ya que su meta es tener más clientes para de esta manera abrir una tienda en el centro de la ciudad.
Curicó se ubica en la región del Maule, zona centro del país. El clima de Curicó es de tipo mediterráneo y es considerado como uno de los más agradables del país. Se caracteriza además por su cultura en torno al vino y sus alrededores de una belleza mágicamente natural.  A pesar que la fuerza de trabajo se ha  incrementado, esta región sigue siendo, según el último censo, una de las más pobres del país. Si bien esta zona fue dañada por el reciente terremoto que afectó a Chile, este Banco Comunal no sufrió graves efectos por el mismo.
texts.en:
This Communal Bank is called “Nueva Vida” (New Life) and consists of 15 members from the city of Curicó. They are primarily engaged in selling clothing door to door and managing kiosks at schools throughout the city. Jorge is 22 years old and the new president of this Bank, since this position changes every three months. In the photograph, he is standing on the left in the second row and wearing a blue pullover. Jorge sells clothing and kitchen towels. His loan will be invested in winter clothing such as undershirts, thermal underwear, long socks, and other items. Jorge has been working with Fondo Esperanza for seven months and says it has been a great help. He is a student, so this will help him pay for minor expenses as well as help his parents with their expenses. Jorge will receive his degree in social work this month and intends to continue working with Fondo Esperanza. His goal is to have more customers so that he can open a store in the central part of town. Curicó is located in the region of Maule, which is in the central part of the country. The climate in Curicó is similar to that of the Mediterranean and considered one of the nicest in the country. It is also known for its wine culture and the magical natural beauty of the surrounding areas. Even though the workforce has increased, the region has remained steady in its population since the last census because it is one of the poorest in the country. This area experienced damage from the recent earthquake in Chile, but the Communal Bank did not suffer from any serious effects.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase winter clothing

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Flour, meat and oil for a fried food stand

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 28 years old. She sews clothes in different styles, and she also sells sarongs and tailoring materials to schools, individuals, and families based on their orders.

Rosemary currently owns two sewing machines, but with her Kiva loan and her savings, she hopes to purchase one more sewing machine. Since she employs more people to perform sewing, this will vastly improve her business in the future.

Rosemary wants to expand her business. She hopes for a loan of NGN 50,000 to buy one sewing machine and more sarongs to sell. She thanks Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase one sewing machine and more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Juana Rosario

texts.es: La señora Juana Rosario se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Su esposo trabaja como administrador de una pequeña micro empresa y sirve de apoyo para el ingreso de la familia. Algo que ha influido, en el manejo de su crédito, es la buena administración y el buen uso de los recursos. Juana es una mujer muy trabajadora y disfruta de seguir adelante sus recursos. Pues siempre busca la forma de mejorar sus ingresos. El sueño de Juana es tener  un pequeño negocio formal en el mercado. Ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de de materia prima necesaria para su negocio.
texts.en:
Juana Rosario sells assorted merchandise. Her husband manages a small micro enterprise and contributes to family’s income. One of the factors that have been important in the management of her loans is the efficient management and good use of resources. Juana is a hard-working woman who enjoys moving forward with her resources because she is always looking for ways to improve her income. Juana’s dream is to have a small, formal business in the market. She is asking for funds to buy stock merchandise that is needed for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
Maria P. N. nasceu na cidade de Xai xai, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique, tem 45 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 2 filhos de 17 e 14 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez somente 5ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e de vez enquanto envia algum valor monetário para ajudar a mãe em despesas alimentares.
Saiu de Xai xai para Boane com o seu marido em 1980 devido a transferência dos serviços. Actualmente on seu marido trabalha nas minas da África do Sul de vez enquanto envia dinheiro para ajudar nas despesas de casa. Maria é comerciante e dona do seu negocio há mais de 25 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 4.500.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Ja teve empréstimos na cooperativa de credito TCHUMA e decidiu não continuar. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos  e familiares que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar pecas de capulanas, para aumentar a quantidade de seu stock. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 10.000.00mt os dois e todos para a mesma actividade. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. O seu sonho é de ter um estabelecimento comercial condigno para albergar toda a sua mercadoria. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para ampliar ainda mais seu negocio.
texts.en:
Maria P. N. was born in the city of Xai-Xai, Gaza Province in southern Mozambique. She is 45 years old, married, and has two children, ages 17 and 14. Both children go to school. Maria only finished fifth grade and did not continue school because of financial difficulties. She lives in her own house with her family and from time to time sends her mother some money to help with food costs. In 1980, she and her husband left Xai-Xai to go to Boane for a work transfer. Her husband currently works in the mines in South Africa and sometimes sends money to help with household expenses. Maria is a businesswoman and has run her own business for more than 25 years. She has no employees and earns about 4,500 meticais per month. Maria uses the money for household expenses and saves some in her bank account.
