She has taken out loans before from Tchuma Credit Union and decided not to continue with them. She learned about Hluvuku through friends and relatives who are also customers of this institution. This is Maria's third loan. She is asking for 15,000 meticais to buy capulanas (a traditional Mozambican skirt), so she can increase her stock. The earlier loans were both for 10,000 meticais and were used for the same purpose. Maria promises to pay off this loan on time so she can take out other loans. Her dream is to have a nice shop to keep all her merchandise in. In the future she would like to ask for more loans in order to expand her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and resale of capulanas (traditional Mozambican skirts)

loans.name: Kodjovi

texts.en: This 34-year-old borrower is an experienced tailor who sells clothing and accessories in his shop, called Tino Exclusive. He has been working in his shop since 2002. He is married to a hairdresser and has one child. He is also acquainted with Kiva partner, WAGES, and is now requesting his third loan for 450,000 XOF to purchase more material and other accessories.

loans.use: To purchase cloth and other supplies

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
Jalia is a single mother of five children and all of them are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members. 

Jalia operates a charcoal store in her home in Nalukolongo, Lubaga Division, Kampala District.  She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of charcoal. She has been in this business for ten years.  

Besides this charcoal business she also owns rental rooms which bring in additional income to the family. Jalia sells to all categories of people both retail and wholesale. She buys bags of charcoal from the Mubende District and uses public transport to and from Mubende.  She is hoping to own a delivery van in the future. Her customers are the local people around the area. She works seven days a week. 

Jalia joined MCDT because she wanted to get additional capital for her business.  She rents and resides in a one-room house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, school fees and food.  Her business challenges include transportation and the rainy season which hinders her movements in the village.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Mean's Group

texts.en:
This village loan consists of 12 people located in Kanlaeng Khla village in Takeo province. Mrs. Mean T. is the village bank president. She was selected by the members. With the loan, they hope to increase their income to improve their families' standard of living. 

Mrs. Mean T. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice for a living. Her husband, Mr. Tonh K., is a construction worker and he also helps his wife on the farm. In order to increase their income, Mrs. Mean T. decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets to breed. She will use the rest of the loan to pay for farm labor. This couple has two children who are construction workers. 

One of the group members is blocked in the picture.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pay for farm labor

loans.name: Eduard

texts.en:
Eduard J. is from the village of Bitibut, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. He is 34 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Eduard owns and operates a retail store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, bread and soft drinks in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Eduard joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be his first loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: José Alberto

texts.es:
José Alberto vive en la ciudad del Cusco. Antiguamente la ciudad del Cusco fue la capital del Imperio Inca y una de las ciudades más importantes del Virreinato del Perú. La ciudad del Cusco se caracteriza por tener hermosos paisajes y sobre todo del valor histórico. 

José Alberto fue jugador del equipo de futbol “Cienciano” del cusco, él defendía los colares de su equipo en la posición de arquero. Actualmente,  José Alberto es profesor de futbol  en el colegio “Ausangate” que está ubicado en  la urbanización Larapa de la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son 20 años que se dedica a la enseñanza del deporte rey. 

José Alberto hace veinte años atrás abrió un restaurante en su domicilio, donde brindaba pensión como por ejemplo almuerzo y cena a sus clientes. Sus clientes le pagaban adelantado por los platos de comida. Por motivos de viaje José  tuvo que cerrar el restaurante. José Alberto está casado y fruto de este matrimonio tienen cuatro hijos.

Decidido a empezar una nueva vida, Acomodo habitaciones de sus domicilios para alquilar y convertirlo en un hospedaje. Le pueden encontrar en su domicilio, que está equipado con regular necesidades básicas, los 7 días de la semana, desde las 5 de la mañana hasta bastante tarde en la noche. José Alberto desprende una imagen de amabilidad y alegría. Un flujo regular de clientes vistan su hospedaje y el negocio se anima durante los fines de semana o en las fiestas del Cusco. José Alberto  también alquiló su casa a la Asociación Arariwa que está ubicado en la ciudad de Quillabamba.

Con  su próximo préstamo, José Alberto espera recibir $500 USD. Por el momento, su hospedaje esta modestamente equipado de necesidades básicas. Le gustaría emplear el dinero de este préstamo para comprar una lavadora y un televisor. 
       
José Alberto es un hombre emprendedor, responsable y puntual y por ese motivo sus amigos la invitaron a participar del banco comunal “El Amanecer” de la Asociación Arariwa. El sueño del socio es abrir una escuela de futbol de menores en la ciudad de Quillabamba bien equipado y con proyección de mandar jugadores a liga Europea.
texts.en:
José Alberto lives in the city of Cusco. Formerly, the city of Cusco was the capital of the Inca Empire and one of the most important cities of the Perú Viceregency. The city of Cusco is noted for its beautiful scenery but most of all for its historical value. José Alberto was a member of Cusco’s “Cienciano” football team; he was a goalie. Currently, José Alberto teaches football at “Ausangate” school located in the Larapa area of Cusco. He has been teaching this king of sports for 20 years. Twenty years ago José Alberto opened an eatery in his home where he provided meals like breakfasts and lunch to his customers. His customers would pay for the service in advance. However, due to travel needs, José had to close his restaurant. José Alberto is married and has four children. Determined to start a new life, he converted rooms in his home into rental units and opened a boarding house. One can find him in his home, which is equipped to provide regular basic needs, seven days a week from 5am until quite late in the evening. José Alberto comes across as a kind, cheerful person. His boarding house has a regular stream of customers and on weekends or during Cusco’s festivals it becomes quite animated. José Alberto also rented his house to Asociación Arariwa located in the city of Quillabamba. José Alberto expects to receive $500 USD in his next loan. For the moment, his boarding house is modestly equipped with the basic things. He’d like to use this money to buy a washing machine and a television set. José Alberto is an enterprising, responsible and punctual man. For this reason, his friends invited him to participate in Asociación Arariwa’s “El Amanecer” (Dawn) communal bank. His dream is to open a well equipped football school for youngsters in the city of Quillabamba in hopes of producing players for the European League.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a washing machine and a television set.

loans.name: Eureka (Flat) Group

texts.es:
La señora María Jiménez Sánchez vive en tecpatan estado de Chiapas México, fue madre soltera con seis hijos los cuales dos de ellos ya están casadas y cuatro están a su responsabilidad: José Daniel de quince años, le dicen (dani), el otro es Juvencio de catorce años,  Carlos Humberto de once años de edad y la más pequeña María del Carmen de tan solo nueve años le dicen carmelita y es la que apoya a su mama en el negocio.

 Ella se dedica a la venta de antojitos como son: tamales, empanadas, tacos fritos, arroz con leche entre otros, tiene practicando esta actividad desde hace nueve años con una señora la cual era la ayudante pero cuando falleció ocupo el puesto donde lleva tres años, el cual comenta que le ha ido bien en esta actividad ya que ha obtenido buenos ingresos para los gasto de su familia.

  Su inspiración por esta actividad comenzó cuando se quedo sola con sus hijos el cual no tenia de donde sacar para los gastos de su hogar y fue a buscar trabajo y encontró este el  cual le ha gustado mucho y  ya se a acostumbro a esta actividad ya que es muy fácil de hacer y se vende my bien.

 Con las ganancias que obtiene de la veta compra más ingredientes para seguir elaborando su actividad y sus clientes se sientan satisfechos con la atención que les brinda en el negocio y obtenga lo que buscan para comer.
Comenta que su sueño es ahorrar para que construya un local y pueda vender con más comodidad ya que donde vende es rentado, así también apoyar a sus hijos a que estudien y tengan una carrera ya que ella no tuvo la oportunidad de hacerlo.

 Las personas que integran en el grupo Eureka son:

 María Jiménez Sánchez: invierte el préstamo en la venta de antojitos, como son: tamales, empanadas, arroz con leche y pozol.
 Marcelina U. M.: invierte en la venta de antojitos, como son: atol agrio, tamales, empanadas entre otros.
 Ismaelita Díaz Jiménez: invierte en la venta de pollos para venderlo aliñados(destazados).
texts.en:
Mrs. María Jiménez Sánchez lives in Tecpatan, Chiapas, México. She was a single mother to six children two of whom are already married and four still under her care: José Daniel, called Dani, 15, Juvencio, 14, Carlos Humberto, 11, and the youngest, María del Carmen, called Carmelita, who is just 9 and is the one that helps out her mother with the business. She sells fast food items like: tamales, turnovers, fried tacos, rice pudding, among others. She has been in this line of work for 9 years where she started out as a helper to another woman. When she died, however, she took over the stand where she has now been for three years. She comments that she has done well with the work in that she has earned good income to meet family expenses. Her inspiration for this work came about when she was left alone with her children and she had to earn funds to meet household expenses. She went out looking for work and found this which she has enjoyed very much and is now used to this work and she finds it easy to do and sales are good. Profits from sales are used to buy more ingredients in order to continue in her activity and that her customers feel satisfied with the service they get from her and that they find the items they are looking to consume. She comments that her dream is to save up enough to be able to build a locale so that she can sell more comfortably because where she currently sells is a rented location. She also would like to support her children so that they can go to school and have a career since she never had the opportunity to do so. The members of the Eureka group are: María Jiménez Sánchez: will use the funds to buy ingredients for fast food items like: tamales, turnovers, rice pudding and pozol (corn-based drink). Marcelina U. M.: will use the funds to buy ingredients for fast food items like: sour atol (fermented corn-based drink), tamales and turnovers, among others. Ismaelita Díaz Jiménez: to buy chickens to butcher and sell in pieces.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make fast food items like: tamales and rice pudding, among others.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita S. is from the village of Libertad, Sibutad. She is 57 years old, married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Juanita owns and operates a business venture in the food sector in particular selling bananas. Juanita has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Juanita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juanita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Juanita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used for the expansion of the business. This loan will be the fifteenth loan taken out by Juanita from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For expansion of the business

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina T. is from the village of Tabuan, Tukuran Zamboanga Del sur. She is 42 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Gina providing waste management and tricycle transport services. Gina has been in business for over two years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Gina joined GDMPC to access financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Gina is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to repair an existing engine. This loan will her first from GDMPC.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her living conditions. 

-------------------------------------------
About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Repair existing engine.

loans.name: Anne Wanjiku

texts.en:
Anne Wanjiku N., 34, is a hardworking lady. She is married to David N., and they have two children (ages 14 and 12). Anne has sold electrical gadgets for the past 12 years and she earns a monthly income of 12,000 KES.

When Anne learned about KADET LTD, she immediately applied for a loan of 15,000 KES, which she will use to buy bulbs, electrical wires, and fuses. Anne hopes to grow her business and become the leading local investor in her town. 

She wants to provide her children with a good education so they can realize their dreams in life.

loans.use: To buy bulbs, electrical wires, and fuses.

loans.name: Layland

texts.en:
"Layland M. is a single woman who lives in Prk. 1, Culipapa, Hinobaan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures, an Upholstery Shop and a Food Vending businesses. Layland joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 2 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Layland has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 7000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 3rd loan, she is borrowing PHP 10000, which she intends to use to buy refrigerator for her frozen foods  so that she could continue to save up for the future. Layland M. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund the operations of an upholstery business

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia T. is from the city of Santa Cruz, Tangub City. She is 56 years old and widowed, with 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Virgilia  operates motor-transportation services. Virgilia has been engaged in her business for more than 5 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Virgilia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virgilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to repair her existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Virgilia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair her existing vehicle

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily A. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 58 years old and widowed. She has seven children and some of them are already married. She supports her family through farming. She plants and harvests rice for sale. She used to farm with her husband. Now that her husband is deceased, her children help her maintain the rice farm. Emily is eager to improve her farm so she can also earn more.

Emily joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family financially.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Diana Luz

texts.es: Diana Luz tiene 58 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de transporte colectivo. Hace más de 36 años que tiene este negocio, lo inicio con su esposo que anteriormente el brindaba el servicio como transportista y con el esfuerzo de ella fue que compro el vehículo ya que con ciertos ahorros que tenia logro comprarlo para empezar este medio de vida. Tiene 3 hijos pero todos trabajan de manera independiente. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de  llantas y ciertas reparaciones para su vehículo.
texts.en:
Diana Luz is 58 years old, and she provides public transportation service.  She has had this business for over 36 years.  She started with her husband.  He previously provided transportation service.  Through her effort she bought the vehicle.  With some savings that she had, she managed to buy it in order to start this way of life.

She has three children, but they all work in an independent manner.  The reason for the loan is to buy tires and for some repairs on her vehicle.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Kalo (Étoile) Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Kalo sont toutes mariées et ont une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec leurs frères, sœurs, co-épouses, enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident dans le quartier Torakabougou de la ville de BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Ces  femmes se sont connues par des relations de commerce, de parenté et de voisinage. 
Afin de satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles en nette croissance, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur sixième prêt de groupe et tous les cinq prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt AÏSSATOU K., compte acheter, 20 cartons de savons auprès des grossistes de Bamako. Elle effectue sa vente en détail et en gros, au comptant et à crédit au marché de Bougouni. 
Avec ce prêt AÏSSATOU espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 35.000 FCFA  qui sera utilisé pour soutenir les frais de santé des enfants.
texts.en:
The women of the Kalo group are all married and, on average, are 36 years old with 5 children. They live in traditional extended family households with their brothers, sisters, spouses, co-spouses, and children. These women live in the Torakabougou area in the city of Bougouni (3rd Administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women know each other through commercial, neighbourhood, and familial relations.
In order to satisfy the sharply increasing needs of their customers, they decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their sixth group loan, and all five previous loans were repaid properly.
With this new loan, Aïssatou Keïta (one of the members) intends to buy 20 boxes of soap from wholesalers in Bamako. She makes her sales at retail and in bulk, in cash or on credit at the Bougouni market.
With this loan, Aïssatou hopes to realize a monthly profit of 35,000 FCFA, which will be used to pay for her children's health costs.

loans.use: To buy soap

loans.name: Dinora Delmi

texts.es:
Dinora D. 46 años D. edad, resiD. en El Transito departamento D. San Miguel, donD. vive con sus hijos D. 26 y 24 años D. edad, además el esposo D. una hija y dos nietos, se dedica a atender una tienda donD. ofrece productos domésticos, en su casa todos los adultos trabajan para ayudar con los gastos, la tienda Dinora la abre a las 7:00am y cierra a las 6:00pm.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo pues no cuenta con fondos ahorrados para invertir en el negocio, desea comprar mercadería alguna nueva que le solicitan los clientes, como pastas, cremas, pollo y carnes; esta inversión le permitirá ampliar el negocio, mantenerlo en condiciones competentes.
Su principal propósito es manejar bien el préstamo, administrar bien el negocio y atender bien a los clientes para asegurar su satisfacción, además D. aportar para su familia lo necesario.
texts.en:
Dinora is 46 years old and lives in El Transito, in San Miguel department, with her children who are 26 and 24.  She also lives with the husband of one of her daughters and two grandchildren.

Dinora serves in her store where she sells household products.  All of the adults in her house work to help with the family's expenses.  Dinora's store opens at 7.00am and closes at 6.00pm.  She is requesting a loan as she doesn't have enough savings to invest in her business.  She would like to buy some new goods that her customers are requesting such as pasta, creams, chicken and meat.  This investment will enable her to expand her business and keep it competitive.  Her main goals are to handle her loan well, to manage her business well and to serve her customers well in order to ensure their satisfaction.  She also wants to be able to proviD. her family with everything they need.

loans.use: To buy products such as pasta, cream, chicken and meats

loans.name: Trinidad Teresa

texts.es:
Trinidad Teresa A. M. tiene 48 años. Es Soltera, vive con los hijos en el cantón  Ventanas en la Provincia de los ríos.  Tiene 4 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. ESFUERZO Y TRABAJO  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Campos Grandes perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Trinidad Teresa se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz desde hace 3 años. Compra sus productos en Agripac, y  vende en la feria en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, arroz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar una casa.

Le gusta la música.
texts.en:
Trinidad Teresa A. M. is 48. She is single and lives with her children in the Ventanas Canton, Los Rios province. She has 4 children.

The members of the V.R.C. Esfuerzo y Trabajo ["Effort and Work"] are located in the Campos Grandes neighbourhood belonging to the Pueblo Viejo Canton. The members of this bank have long worked in short-cycle agricultural labour, sowing corn and rice.

Trinidad Teresa has worked in agriculture, sowing corn and rice, for three years. She buys her products in Agripac and sells them in the market in the same area.

She is requesting this loan to purchase agricultural tools and fertilizers for cultivating corn and rice. In supporting this loan, you will help her economically to supply her needs. She confronts challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. Her dream is to buy a house.

She enjoys music.

loans.use: the purchase of agricultural inputs and fertilizers

loans.name: Verna

texts.en:
Ms. R. provides home manicure services. She has been a member in the PMPC for three years. She will use the loan to purchase materials for her manicure and spa business, which is very busy. She currently has a lot of customers scheduled each day. 

About PMPC: 
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase manicure sets and as additional capital

loans.name: Amor Y Paz 1 & 3 Group

texts.es:
Albaneli es la coordinadora del grupo Amor y Paz 3, cada uno D. elL. días a días realizan sus actividades D. negocios en la ciudad D. Santiago, la segunda ciudad mas granD. D. Republica Dominicana, donD. el comercio, grandes industrias y el sector D. ganadería y agricultura, son las principales fuentes D. trabajo. Se dedican mayormente a la venta D. Ropa, Calzados, Accesorios, cosméticos, alimentos, entre otros productos misceláneos.

Albaneli posee una familia conformada por sus 3 hijos y su esposo. Mientras su esposo trabaja para suplir las necesidades básica D. su familia, ella se ha dedicado a generar ingresos extra, actualmente con la finalidad D. poder reparar poco a poco su vivienda y poder construir en una estructura fuerte D. block, para garantizar mas seguridad. Su sueño es poder tener su casa terminada, y también tener una gran  compañía, este ultimo es su reto mas importante.

El negocio D. Albaneli es la venta D. calzado, lleva ya alrededor D. 1 año, el cual inicio al recibir su primer préstamo. Esta recibiendo su 3er préstamos con Esperanza Internacional. Gracias a L. prestamos anteriores ha podido crecer su negocio D. zapatos, y ha podido unirse a la venta D. calzados por catalogo D. mayor calidad. Este nuevo préstamo será invertido en la compra D. calzados para mujeres, D. diferentes estiL., colores y tamaños; y reforzar una segunda actividad D. negocio que recién incorporo, es la venta D. salchichas a la parrilla.

Su historia representa a L. demás miembros D. su grupo y a L. clientes D. Esperanza, tanto L. haitianos (quienes en su mayoría ha emigrado hacia la República Dominicana desD. Haití, algunos D. elL. recientemente) y L. dominicanos, quienes por lo general viven en comunidades muy pobres, esta zona, como muchas otras zonas D. escasos recursos en la República Dominicana, carecen D. agua potable y energía eléctrica constante.
texts.en:
Albaneli is the coordinator for the group “Amor y Paz 3” (Love and Peace 3). All of the members conduct their daily business activities in the city of Santiago, the second largest city in the Dominican Republic. The main sources of jobs are traD., large industries, and the livestock and agriculture sectors. These members mostly engage in the sale of clothing, shoes, accessories, cosmetics, food, and other miscellaneous products.

Albaneli’s family consists of her three children and her husband. While her husband works to meet the basic needs of their family, Albaneli spends time earning extra income. At the moment, she wants to complete the gradual repairs to her home and build a structure maD. of solid block that is guaranteed to be secure. Her dreams incluD. finishing her house and having a large business. The latter goal is the most important to her.

Albaneli has been selling shoes for approximately one year and used her first loan to start this business. She is now receiving her third loan from Esperanza International. Thanks to her previous loans, she was able to grow her shoe business and incorporate the sale of higher quality shoes from a catalog. This new loan will be invested in the purchase of women’s shoes in different styles, colors, and sizes. She will also strengthen a second business she recently started, selling grilled sausages.

Albaneli’s story is representative of the other members of her group and clients of Esperanza. They are Haitians (most of whom have emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti, some just recently) and Dominicans who live in the poorest communities of the Dominican Republic that lack potable water and reliable electricity.

loans.use: Purchase women’s shoes in different styles, colors, and sizes

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman who lives in Medellin, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a motorcycle repair shop and a food production sales business. Her husband Nestor, who is 49 years old, works as a Bantay Dagat coast guard to earn his living. They have 10 children who are between 4 and 25 years old. Grace joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Grace has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000 uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000 to buy additional tools and equipment for her shop so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children and expansion of her business. Grace is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To purchase additional tools and equipment for her repair shop

loans.name: The

texts.en:
The T. Phan is 47 years old with one child, who attends high school.  

Being a farmer, her main activities are growing rice and vegetables and raising chickens.  Since a divorce in 2008, she has had to work more in order to provide a good education for her child. 

She has increased the numbers of paddies to grow more kinds of vegetables so she can earn a stable income to support her famiy. Participating in our credit program since 2009, she has been a good re-payer and used loans effectively to develop her farming. 

Currently, she wants a loan of 4,142,000 VND to buy food and fertilizer for chickens and rice.

loans.use: to buy food and fertilizer for chickens and rice.

loans.name: Melinde

texts.en:
42-year-old Melinde is a married woman with four children. Her oldest child is 16 and the youngest is 10. All of her four children go to school.

Melinde is a farmer working in Surallah, South Cotabato. She grows rice that she sells to people in her community. She also raises pigs that she sells as well. Melinde works hard to build her business. She wants to be able to sustain her children's education. She wishes for bright futures for them.

Melinde's loan will be used to purchase fertilizers, seeds and feeds.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and feeds

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman with two children – one attends school while the other is too young for school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is rent bills.
For the past two years, Alice has operated a business selling cooking gas cylinders, both retail and at the market. Alice faces the major challenge of high transport costs and seasonality in her business. In the future, she dreams of establishing a wholesale shop selling cooking gas. With her 30,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase 20 gas cylinders. Alice decided to join Kiva partner, Yehu, to access loans to raise her business standards.

loans.use: to purchase 20 gas cylinders

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: Maria J. es la propietaria de un restaurante ubicado en el barrio Los Andes de la Ciudad de Barranquilla, con este negocio operado con mucha disciplina y mucho trabajo ha logrado sacar adelante a sus dos hijos  en las edades de 21 y 26 años; ella comenzó desde hace 20 años vendiendo con su madre,  pasteles y sancochos  que le encargaban los fines de semanas, debido a su gran acogida, decidieron convertirlo en un restaurante trabajando todos los días  como hasta el momento lo hace. Su clientela es clasificada y fiel aunque en su mayoría realizan ventas de contado también otorgan créditos a sus clientes más rentables.  Este es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará materias primas e insumos al por mayor para preparar sus comidas y lograr  disminuir los costos y también realizará mejoras locativas para lograr un ambiente confortable para sus clientes. Su meta es mejorar su infraestructura y hacer crecer su negocio día a día, por eso cada día se prepara con una oferta de menús que deleitan el paladar de quienes lo consumen y con todo esto impactará integralmente a su clientela real y potencial.
texts.en:
Maria J. owns a restaurant located in the Los Angeles neighborhood of Barranquilla.  This business, run with great discipline, has allowed her to get her two children, ages 21 and 26, ahead.  She began selling cakes and soup with her mother on the weekends 20 years ago.  Because of their success, they decided to open a restaurant, working every day, as they do now.  Her customers are loyal and even though most of their sales are in cash, they extend credit to some of their most profitable customers.

This will be her first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy supplies and ingredients in quantity, so that she can reduce her costs and also provide a better atmosphere for her customers.  Her goal is to improve the infrastructure and grow her business each day.  Each day she prepares a menu that tempts the pallet of those who eat.  This will impact all of her current and future customers.

loans.use: to buy ingredients

loans.name: Israa

texts.en:
Israa is a 39-year-old working mother, married to Mohammad, a 46-year-old driver. They decided to open a small business so they rented a storeroom to start a poultry breeding business.

Israa has applied for more than one loan over the last three years to be able to start up her business and she has succeeded in it. She started by buying a few chicken to get eggs to sell. But since they have some space around their house, Israa thought of building their own poultry breeding place to get rid of the monthly rentA. fees and to expand her business to increase their income. That’s why she applied for this loan.

Since Israa is a conservative woman, her husband Mohammad agreed to have a picture taken of him with her business.

loans.use: To build their own chicken-raising house.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is from the village of Makawa, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old, married, and has four adult children. To make a living, Editha runs a general store in the local community.  She has been engaged in this business for 20 years and earns approximately 5650 PHP a month from these activities. 

Editha joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from PMPC. 

Editha is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, with which she will purchase more products such as dry goods, canned goods, and home supplies for her general store business. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Editha from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: buy more inventory for her general store business

loans.name: Francisco Jose

texts.es: Don Francisco de 46 años de edad, labora como albañil desde hace 25 años, desempeñandose con gran responsabilidad y esmero, este credito lo requiere para construir una habitaciòn para su hijo mayor, cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos ya que todos trabajan y lo ayudan con los gastos del hogar, profesa la religion evangelica, su mayor sueño en la vida es que sus hijos sean hombres y mujeres de bien que le sirvan a la sociedad.
texts.en: Don Francisco is 46 years old. He has been working as a mason for 25 years, fulfilling his duties with great responsibility and painstaking care. He needs this loan to construct a room for his older son. He has the support of his children, since they all work and help him with the household expenses. He professes the evangelical religion. His greatest dream in life is that his children become honest men and women who serve society.

loans.use: to construct a room

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet  lives in  Uganda.  She is single and has three children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her mother).   

Annet has a business selling bananas.  She has been in this business for three years and she works seven days out of every week. Annet sells her products from home, by means of wholesale/retail.    

Annet has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas to sell.  

The main business challenges for Annet include transportation and ever increasing prices of bananas in Uganda.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see her business growing big so that she can get enough profits to buy a delivery van.   Annet lives in a home that she owns but she doesn't have access to electricity or piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medications.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Claire

texts.en: Claire is a 43-year-old married woman with four children and she owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been dealing in coffee for three years and she got her initial capital from her monthly savings as a nurse. Her hardships are machine break down and delayed payment and her vision is to own a coffee store, buying another machine plus an educated family. Claire needs a loan to buy coffee to sell.

loans.use: To buy coffee

loans.name: Denis

texts.es: El señor Denis se dedica a la serigrafía en cuero, fabrica las etiquetas para los pantalones jeans de damas, varones, niños, y vende a los confeccionistas para entregar sus prendas de vestir a las distintas tiendas y mercados de la ciudad, también fabrica cinturones de cuero para comercializar en los distintos mercados de la ciudad, el dinero del credito se utilizara para la compra de cuero, su negocio queda ubicado en su mismo domicilio, el tiene 21 años nacido en santa cruz es un joven emprendedor con ganas de superación agradecido con la institución por el apoyo que  le brindo para que el joven pueda salir adelante.
texts.en:
Sr. Denis makes leather screen prints and manufactures labels used for women’s, men’s, and children’s jeans. His products are sold to apparel manufacturers who deliver their clothes to different stores and markets in the city. Denis also makes leather belts that are sold at the various city markets.

The money from this loan will be used to buy leather. Denis operates his business out of his home. He is 21 years old and was born in Santa Cruz. This young entrepreneur has the drive to succeed and with the support of Emprender he will be able to move forward.

loans.use: to purchase leather for making screen prints, clothing labels, and belts.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a home products business in the Philippines.

Alma requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell. She has been in this business for 19 years now and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

In the future, Alma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace lives in Uganda. She is single and has three children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of an additional family member (mother).

Grace has a business of selling used bras and half slips. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works seven days out of every week. Grace sells her products at the market, by means of retail.  

Grace has requested from MCDT SACCO a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings, which she will use to buy more bales of used bras and half slips. The main business challenges for Grace include transportation and the rainy season. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see her business grow big so that she sells on a wholesale basis only, and also to start importing bras herself. 

Grace lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include paying for electricity, rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of bras and half slips.

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 
Paz has a tailoring shop that makes and sells office and school uniforms.  She also repairs dresses & curtains. She has had this business for 11 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw materials needed for tailoring.
Paz is a member of HSPFI. In the future, Paz hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials needed for tailoring

loans.name: Tamaraneh I Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the "Tamaraneh" group from Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 800,000 for each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Santigie is the leader of this group. The 55-year-old is married to a businesswoman and they have two children. Santigie has been a businessman for 10 years now. He sells cloth (poplins), containers, raincoats, etc. With his share of the loan, he will buy the above-mentioned items art wholesale to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to buy cloth (poplin), containers, raincoats, etc. at wholesale to add to his current stock

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
El comité llamado San Miguel está integrado por 11 mujeres, todas ellas amigas y vecinas D. esa ciudad. Ellas se organizaron con el propósito D. ayudar a sus familias y sus hijos, quieren que ellos tengan un mejor porvenir del que ellas tuvieron, desean darles una vida digna y decorosa.
Una D. las miembros es la señora Nélida, ella tiene una peluquería en la cual diariamente atienD. a muchas personas, lo cual le genera muy buenos ingresos. Comenta que este negocio es lo que la ayuda a generar los ingresos necesarios para poder mantener a su familia, como así también poder paliar los gastos D. la casa.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. tintes, gel, sprays y otros insumos necesarios para la peluquería. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le brinda, pues D. obtener el crédito le será D. mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The communal bank San Miguel is comprised of 11 women who are friends and neighbors in the same city.  They got together to help their families and children since they want them to have a better future than they had, with a dignified, proper lifestyle.

One of the members is Mrs. Nélida who has a beauty salon where she works daily attending to many customers.  She has been able to generate a decent income through the business, which helps her maintain the family and cover household expenses.

She is requesting a loan to buy hair color, gel, sprays and other supplies for her beauty salon.  She is grateful to the Fundación for this opportunity since the loan will be very helpful.

loans.use: To buy hair color, gel, scissors and other beauty salon supplies.

loans.name: Hiyam

texts.en: Hiyam is a 41-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She lives with her husband and three young children who are still attending school. She has been running a clothing store since 2009. She only sells women's and children's clothes but she also sells sportswear, socks, flannel shirts, etc. Her business income is vital for her family; she helps her husband. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to expand her store’s inventory of new winter clothes. She’s certain that the loan will help her diversify her merchandise selection. In the future, she is hoping to also sell men's clothes.

loans.use: to expand her store’s inventory of new winter clothes.

loans.name: Mavelle

texts.en:
As a married parent of 2 children, Mavelle works hard to support her family. She operates a buying and selling of birds nests business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending and raising pigs. 

Mavelle is borrowing PHP 30,000, through NWTF, to purchase more birds nests to sell for her business.

Mavelle has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more birds nests to sell.

loans.name: Digna Floridalba

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Damas Al Poder.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Digna, tiene 49 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos todos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa y uno  estudia en universidad. Su esposo es empleado público.

Ella es propietaria de un disco móvil, se encarga de realizar los contratos los mismos que por lo general son para los días viernes y sabados, su hermano trabaja con ella en las presentaciones, tiene en este negocio más de 5 años y le ha ido bien ya que no le faltan presentaciones.

Este crédito es para comprar un juego de luces para brindar un mejor servicio. Lleva dos años  en el Banco Comunal es la fiscal de pagos del banco y le gusta por la ayuda que le han dado. 

Sus sueños son seguir adelante y gozar de buena salud.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo. the capital of Manabi, known for many years as the city of the Royal Tamarinds, the members of the community bank "Ladies in Power" meet every fifteen days.

In this place we met Mrs. Digna, 49 years old and married.  They have three grown children, two of whom still live at home and one is studying at the university.  Her husband is a public employee.

She is the owner of a music service.  She provides her services on contract which are usually for Fridays and Saturdays.  Her brother works with her.  She has had this business for more than 5 years and it has gone well, she is no longer needing presentations.

This loan is to be able to buy a set of lights which will improve the service that she provides.  She has been with the community bank for 2 years.  She is the payables administrator for the bank.  She is very happy with the help that she has received.

Her dreams are to continue getting ahead and to enjoy good health.

loans.use: to purchase a set of lights for her disco business.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en: Elias is a 44-year-old Lebanese married man who lives with his wife and three school-aged children. He has been working as a home painter for the past 25 years. He works on a freelance basis serving a wide clientele. After finding it hard to cover his children’s educational fees and the other family expenses, he decided to double his efforts and take more projects to gain higher income.  And today, he is asking to borrow $3000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy painting products as he is about to start a new project and must cater to the demands of his customers. In the future, he plans to open a painting shop.

loans.use: To buy painting products as he is about to start a new project and must cater to the demands of his customers.

loans.name: Chrisps Group

texts.en:
Jecinta is the facilitator of the Chrisps group. Jecinta and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Jecinta takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund to obtain One Acre Fund’s best prices and to increase her maize production. In the recent 2011 season, Jecinta had a good maize yield harvesting 12 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Jecinta was only able to harvest eight bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Jecinta and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Jecinta will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Chrisps group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Jecinta is pictured with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Naziran's Group

texts.en:
Naziran, who lives with her husband and daughter, focuses her days on taking care of her family and raising her daughter with great care. Her husband sells groceries, stocking his store with new products as often as possible. Located in an area with many other stores, he tries to compete through quality of service and meeting the needs of every customer.

Naziran is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband to purchase groceries in bulk to sell in his store. She hopes that her husband will further grow the business and improve the quality of services offered after the loan investment.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Naziran.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her husband's grocery store business.

loans.name: Sriani

texts.en:
Sriani is a 53-year-old widow. Her husband passed away in 2001. She has six children, namely:  Fredy, 33, married; Andri 30; Rino 29; Triyanto, 28; Mariana, 27; Yuliastuti, 23; all working and Twistin, 21, studying at a university in Java Island. 

Being a single parent does not make Sri despair; she has taken over the responsibility as the breadwinner for her family and for Twistin’s education fees. To make a living, Sriani sells a traditional snack originally from Java Island, called “rempeyek” - made of chopped peanuts, rice flour, salt and celery. 

Currently, Sriani wants to improve her business. Actually, her children are willing to support her business but she does not want to lean on them. She would like to request a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 4,000,000 to purchase two frying pans and two stoves to support her business. She also plans to buy two goats to be fattened and resold. She hopes TLM will approve her loan application as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase two frying pans, two stoves and two goats to be fattened.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en: Penninah is a 50 year-old mixed crop farmer, married to Joseph with one child aged 22 years. She has been in the farming business for the past ten years with a monthly income of Kes 8,000 which he uses to support her family. She is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing Kadet customer. Penninah will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. With the anticipated profits from the business she will educate her child. Her hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop and improve the living standard of her family

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase wires to connect electricity to her home and pay for connection fees.

loans.name: Teu

texts.en: Mr.Teu is a 30-year-old married man who lives with humble wife and his four lovely children, located in Krong Siem Reap, Cambodia. It's a zone where agribusiness is common; the majority of the region's inhabitants are rice, cattle and fishing business. Nowadays, he is a lovely father who generates a kind of job as rice business. He is a responsible person that always takes care about livelihood, and providing a good education to his children. He is married to his wife who runs a type of business alongside him.Mr.Teu has been involving with this business sector for long time ago, so it is long periods of him related this field. Due to the long time, it is easy way for him to get more experiences and get more outcomes every year. To upgrade a living in a better quality of life, he and his wife would like to purchase a cow but they don’t have enough money yet, so they are seeking for  kind lenders who famous helpers to support their family in time. They are expecting that this loan will make their family meet happiness and prosperity. They are very thanks to all lenders who always help to poor family.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Achol

texts.en:
Achol lives in bor. She sells food staff, and has been in business for two years. She is 28 year old, married, and has four children; two of them are still in school. 

Achol heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase soda, sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees.

loans.use: to purchase soda, sugar for sale.

loans.name: Arkam

texts.en:
Akram is a 43-year-old carpenter from Al Russeifeh, Jordan who supports 5 family members.

He is requesting a loan of 2,000 JOD to buy a new machine for cutting timber as well as extra timber. In doing so, he wants to develop and expand his current business to continue supporting his family.

loans.use: to pay for timber and a new wood cutting machine

loans.name: Naith

texts.es:
Naith es un hombre emprendedor, tiene 46 años de edad, es soltero y vive en San Martín junto a su familia.
Es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos que son su mayor orgullo y por quienes lucha día a día para poder brindarles un futuro mejor.
Desde hace más de 1 año se dedica a la venta de comida, le va muy bien porque es una persona muy responsable, trabajadora, innovadora y sobre todo porque sus platillos son excelentes y siempre brinda un buen servicio a sus clientes.
Naith está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá mesas y sillas para brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes y pueda generar mayores ingresos. Con esto ella seguirá esforzándose para más adelante poder cumplir su gran sueño: "Ver a sus hijos convertirse en grandes profesionales y ampliar su negocio":
texts.en:
Naith is an enterprising man; he is 46 years old, single, and he lives in San Martín with his family. 

She is a single mother; she has two children who are her greatest pride and for whom she works day after day to be able to offer them a better future. 

For over a year she has been selling prepared food.  It is going very well for her because she is a responsible, hardworking, innovative woman and above all because her dishes are excellent and she always provides good service to her customers. 

Naith is thankful to Kiva's lenders because, with the support they have offered her, she will be able to buy tables and chairs to offer her customers better service and thereby generate more income.  With that she will continue to push herself so that in the future she can achieve her greatest dream:  to see her children become great professionals and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to use in her business

loans.name: Sylvestre Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SYLVESTRE est composé de trois personnes qui sont dans le même quartier. C'est la cinquième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Clarisse est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Clarisse a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Clarisse est âgée de 39 ans et vit au Bénin. Clarisse est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Affissou. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Clarisse vend à son domicile depuis quinze ans des vivres. Parallèlement à cette activité, Clarisse vend également de l’huile à moteur. Clarisse s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Clarisse ensemble avec les membres du groupe SYLVESTRE, sollicite un sixième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des vivres et de l'huile à moteur.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 36 years old and married with one child. With her child currently in school, Marites works very hard to provide for them.

Marites runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items such as shampoo, coffee, sugar, detergent soap, canned goods, candies, biscuits, etc. to sell.

Marites has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, coffee, sugar, detergent soap, canned goods, candies, biscuits, etc.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Marites would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items such as shampoo, coffee, sugar, detergent soap, canned goods, candies, biscuits, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Erick Abel

texts.en:
Since he was very young, Erick has stood out for being an enterprising and hard-working man. He is 28 years old and he is single; a few years ago he had take charge of the concrete block production business his parents started, since they could not work anymore due to old age. As time went by, he was able to make the business grow, increasing the number of his clients and his sales.

He is very much interested in improving the quality of his products, and for that reason he needs you support with a loan of $550 USD, to purchase raw material of better quality. This will help him get better products and he knows he\'ll be able to sell his production more easily, allowing him to make his business grow and bringing benefits to his family. The term for him to pay the credit is of 6-12 months.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva Volunteer.

Desde muy joven Erick se ha distinguido por ser un hombre muy emprendedor y trabajador. Tiene 28 años y es soltero, hace algunos años tuvo la necesidad de hacerse cargo del negocio de fabricación de blocks que iniciaron sus padres, pero que por su edad avanzada ya no pudieron seguir atendiendo. Con el paso del tiempo él ha podido hacer crecer el negocio, incrementando el número de clientes que atiende, así como sus ventas.

Él está muy interesado en mejorar la calidad de sus productos, es por eso que necesita que lo apoyes con un préstamo por $550 USD, para comprar materias primas de mejor calidad, lo cual le ayudará a mejorar sus productos, sabe que con eso podrá vender mas fácilmente su producción, haciendo crecer su negocio y trayendo beneficio a su familia. El plazo para pagar el crédito es de 6-12 meses.

loans.use: Improve the quality of his products

loans.name: Vita

texts.en:
Vita and her husband live in Ivano-Frankivsk which is located in the western part of the Ukraine. After high school she began working as a market vendor. However, Vita had a desire to start her own business so she opened a small kiosk selling children’s clothing in the central city market. She has now been in business for 6 years. Vita has a perfect credit history with “Nadiya Ukraine”. She has promptly repaid 18 loans that she has received from the organization. Lending services have promoted the consistent expansion of her small business. Currently, she has about $3,000 in working capital. Her monthly net profit amounts to $1,000. Vita is requesting a loan for $1,200 to increase her inventory of clothing. She is planning to purchase 40 pajamas, 60 t-shirts, and several hundred pairs of socks. Vita believes that a good assortment of clothing items will attract many customers, increasing her sales profits and helping the success of her business. Vita is hoping to invest generated income into the further expansion of her business and eventually open a new vending facility.

Віта та її чоловік живуть в Івано-Франківську, це місто знаходиться в західній частині України. Віта певний час працювала на ринку реалізатором. Однак, вона хотіла почати власний бізнес. Отже, вона відкрила кіоск з продажу дитячого одягу на центральному ринку. Віта займається цим бізнесом вже 6 років. У Віти чудова кредитна історія в „Надії України”. Вона вчасно сплатила усі 18 позик, які отримала від організації. Кредитні послуги сприяли поступовому розвитку її малого бізнесу. Зараз в неї приблизно 3000 робочого капіталу. Її щомісячний прибуток складає приблизно1000 доларів. Віта просить про позику в 1200 доларів для того, щоб збільшити обсяги товару. Вона планує придбати 40 піжам, 60 футболок та декілька сотень пар шкарпеток. Віта вважає, що широкий асортимент одиниць одягу привабить багато покупців, допоможе їй збільшити прибутки та сприятиме успішному зростанню її бізнесу. Віта сподівається вкласти отриманий прибуток в подальший розвиток її бізнесу та врешті-решт відкрити власну крамницю.

loans.use: Increase clothing inventory

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Mrs. Martina has a clothes and cosmetic store in a shop she fixed within her house. She started her business when she was able to save about $500 which she made in her previous job as assistant cook. At the beginning she started offering the products she bought at wholesale prices to neighbors and friends within the area where she lived. With the help of some of her relatives, she is now selling to more people in the area. With this credit Martina expects to be able to purchase more clothing at wholesale prices and deliver it in the provinces and also increase the size of her shop.

Martina is confident that this loan will allow her to grow the business and allow her to continue providing her family with stability. Martina is 32 years old and has 4 children who study. Her house is made of sugar cane and she enjoys of good family stability.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


La señora Martina tiene uan tienda de ropa y cosmeticos en un local que adecuo dentro de su casa. Ella empezo su negocio cuando logro reunir unos ahorros $500 que obuvo de su antuiguo trabajo como ayudante de cocina. Al principio comenzo ofreciendo a los vecinos y amigos de su sector la mercaderia que compreo a precios de mayorista. Actualmente esta atendiendo a más personas de su localidad con la ayuda de sus familiares. Con este credito Martina espera poder comprar más de ropa a precio de mayorista para entregar en provincias y tambien hacer una ampliación de su local Martina confia que con el prestamo podra hacer crecer mas su negoico y poder seguir dando una mejor estabilidad a toda su familia. Martina tiene 32 años, cuatro hijos que estudian.; su casa es de caña y tiene una buena estabilidad familiar.

loans.use: Purchasing clothes at wholesale prices

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia runs a small restaurant with her mother. She began her entrepreneurial ventures as a clothes saleswoman. She decided to open up a restaurant with her mother in downtown Guayaquil. Unfortunately, the rent was too expensive there and she had to move the business to her home. She makes most of her money from the lunches she delivers to companies and at construction sites.

Although Sonia planned to invest in tables and chairs with her previous loan, she chose instead to buy a bigger pot and other new kitchen utensils. Cooking now is much easier and the quality of food has improved. Sonia provides lunches for many more clients now and she uses the help of her mother to deliver the food to the sites. She also has a second source of income selling clothes which she is very experienced doing. She will use her second loan to buy new foods so she can make more dishes. She also hopes she can use the profits to invest in more clothing to sell.

She is a single mother with two children who are in school. Her and her children live with Sonia’s mother who has always lent them a helping hand. Her dream is to own a home of her own.

loans.use: Buy more ingredients for the dishes in her restuarant

loans.name: Yagut

texts.en: Yagut is a low-income person of Beylagan, married, with 3 children. She has been in this business for 5 years. She runs this fruit stand as a family business together with her husband and son. Her husband brings the fruit from Ganja City's wholesale market in his car and she sells it together with her son. Yagut is applying for a loan of US$ 900 to increase their capital and thus the volume of business.

loans.use: to increase volume of working capital

loans.name: Suifua

texts.en: Suifua is a fifty-nine year old lady, married, with six children. She has been running her shop for about five years, and the business has been successful so far. However, Suifua needs financial help for further business expansion. She has joined the SPBD program and hopes to obtain her first loan of US$300, which will be used to re-stock the shop. Suifua is very excited to receive outside help, and thinks she is going to be able to stay in business. Her shop is open seven days a week, and, with the help of the loan, Suifua hopes to make a net profit of 180 Tala (US$72) a day.

loans.use: Purchase of goods to replenish the stock of a shop

loans.name: Makhkam

texts.en: Makhkam A. lives in B.Gafurov, Tajikistan.  He has only been a client of Microinvest this year, but already he has recommended himself as a serious and responsible client. He trades in the Kistakuz bazaar where he trades in dried fruits. He has the rather good assortment. Working in this sphere Makhkam has competitors so now he requires a loan  that will allow him to improve the condition of his business and to expand his assortment of products.

loans.use: To expand his assortment of products

loans.name: Abdulhak

texts.en:
Abdulhak is 41 years old. His wife keeps their house and looks after their three children. The children attend school.

Abdulhak is the only breadwinner in the family. He is very hard working. He has a café where he sells the national cuisine and the foodstuffs. He has had the business for seven years. Abdulhak makes sure to have fresh foodstuffs and tasty meals in his café so that his clients can eat and rest. This also ensures he has a lot of business. His business is stable, which allows him to generate income to provide for his family.

Abdulhak has received several loans from IMON. He has been a member since March 2006. He is very accurate and precise in repaying his loans. Today, Abdulhak requests $500.00 USD to purchase cereals, a glass case, and oil for cooking in his café. Abdulhak plans to repay the loan in 9 months and he thanks everyone for their support.

loans.use: To purchase cereals, a frig glass case, and oil for cooking in his café

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
Leonardo is an electrician and does maintenance work in two buildings in the city of La Paz. This work is his main source of income and lets him support his son and wife. Leonardo lives in Zona de Río Seco in the city of El Alto.

The required credit will be used to purchase a computer which will serve Leonardo as a tool for his work. This is his first credit with Impro. The evaluation done shows that he is approved to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Leonardo es electricista y realiza labores de mantenimiento en dos edificios de la ciudad de La Paz. Este trabajo es su fuente principal de ingreso y le sirve para cubrir la manutención de su hijo y esposa. Leonardo vive en la Zona de Rió Seco de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito requerido será destinado para la compra de una computadora que le servirá como herramienta de trabajo.

Este es su primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada permite aprobar la solicitud del prestatario.

loans.use: Purchase of a tool for his work

loans.name: Le Giang

texts.vi: Mrs. Giang, who is 28 years old, would like T. obtain a $150 Kiva loan T. expand her small street vending business. She likes the Kiva business model of providing microcredit T. people like herself. Mrs. Giang promises T. be a good Kiva business partner. She earns approximately $4.50 USD a day. | Chị Giang, 28 tuổi, vay vốn về để bổ sung cho việc bán hàng tăng thêm mức thu nhập hàng ngày cho gia đình chị. Với thủ tục đơn giản, dễ tiếp cận là những ưu điểm của chương trình tài chính binhminh cdc nên chị đã vay 2006000 đồng. Và chị tin sẽ trả tốt và tham gia thường xuyên với chương trình với mức thu nhập nhỏ lẻ 70000đồng/ngày/

loans.use: Street vending | Bán hàng ăn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in a greater variety of merchandise

loans.name: Saov Sop Group

texts.en: Saov S., a single 26-year-old palm leaf sewer, is the group leader of four members in Kor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Although she usually generates a small income through palm leaf sewing, she is now seeking a loan to start a pig breeding business in order to improve her living standard.

loans.use: To start a pig breeding business in order to improve her living condition.

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.en:
Gulnara G., 38 , is married and has three daughters.She and her family live in a small village in the Saatli region.

Gulnara owns dairy cows and sells milk and yogurt. This is the only source of income for their family. She has decided to expand her business and start raising calves for meat production. Gulnara has applied for a loan to purchase three calves and fodder to speed up the growth process. As summer is high season for weddings, she would like to concentrate on breeding the calves to increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase three calves for meat production

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy T., 29, is married with 3 children and has many years of experience in the taro/plantation business. She sells taro to village communities and her relatives 3 days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD).

Dorothy has 2 previous loans with SPBD. SPBD loans are Dorothy’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks. She will use part of her new loan to replace all tools and chemicals for her busness such as cromozone, sting chemicals, weedkiller sprayer, shovels, bushknives, spades, axes, wheelbarrows and also to support her children at school. Her husband helps with all the farming and has recruited the young men of the village to help out with their plantation.

loans.use: To replace all equipment for her plantation and to pay for new labor on the plantation

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Meas S., 35, sells porridge at the local market each day while her husband, Lim Lim, is a butcher. They live in Sa Ang with their two children who are students in the local public schools. Meas S. typically makes $2.50 each day with her porridge sales, and her husband can generate $5 each day, but they are looking to expand the butcher shop. She has asked for a loan of $600 to purchase more pork for her husband's business. 

The family believes that there is plenty of customer demand, but they lack the capital needed to expand and increase their inventory. With any leftover money or with the extra profits, they would also like to repair their home. With improved living conditions and an expanded business, the family is very optimistic about their investments and look forward to seeing their lives improved. Meas S. was unavailable for a photograph at the time of the interview, so her husband is pictured above.

loans.use: Purchase more pork; Repair home

loans.name: Bei

texts.en:
Bei R., 47, is married and lives in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Since 1979, she has operated a business buying bananas from farms and selling them to earn a profit of approximately US$ 3.30 per day. Her husband, Sok Seang Hun, is a worker who transports fruit from the farm to the market and is able to make US$ 4 in profit each day as well to support the family.

This couple together has two young children. Mrs. Bei is asking for a loan from Kiva via Credit MFI, Kiva's local partner, of US$ 400 to purchase a horse and cart for her husband to use to transport fruit from farm to market. The couple said that they want all their children to get a good education in order to get a good job in the future. They don't want them to be farmers as it takes a lot of labor and energy but makes less to support the family.

loans.use: To purchase a horse and cart to transport fruit from farm to market

loans.name: Tursunoy

texts.en:
Tursunoy Y. is 49 years old. She is married and the mother of four children.

Tursunoy's lack of a stable job and the slow productivity of her husband's business as a teacher didn't leave enough money to pay the expenses of their home and of their little daughter. This was the reason that Tursunoy decided to start her own business 13 years ago. Now she sells the fabrics of the national dresses.

Little by little, she has made her business grow by offering her clients the option to pay for their goods in installments. Now her business is running normally. However, she would like to continue bettering herself and her business so her situation will be stable in the future, in case something bad should happen. She is asking for a loan of 3500 Somoni ($1025 USD) that she will pay back in 4 months. With this money, Tursunoy will be able to buy seasonal fabrics for the national dresses. The power to help her business grow is in your hands.

loans.use: To purchase new fabrics to increase the range of goods for sale

loans.name: Mwatima's Group

texts.en:
Mwatima S. sells charcoal and firewood in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar. She works from 8:00am to 8:00pm every day and earns a profit of approximately $80 each month. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more inventory for her shop and increase her sales and profit.

Mwatima is 42 years old, married, and has six children. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Mtumwa and Time. Each has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood for her business

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Mrs. Ly I., a villager in Trapaing Bei Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, is a 58-year-old widow with two children, one a motorbike taxi driver and the other a garment factory worker. Since her first child’s motorbike is old and in need of costly repairs, Ly is requesting a loan to add to her savings to buy another one for his business.

loans.use: To add to her savings to buy a motorbike for her child's business.

loans.name: 6 De Marzo Group

texts.es:
La asociación denominada “Seis de marzo” pertenece a la familia de  pro-mujer hace más de un año.
