Cada catorce días se reúnen en el centro focal Panamericana, de la ciudad de El Alto a la fecha el grupo  cuenta con quince miembros y que han demostrado ser un grupo organizado en cuanto a sus cuotas de crédito.
Dentro el grupo la mayoría son casadas y con hijos, estos ayudan a sus padres en sus negocios ya que las ganancias solo cubren necesidades básicas y no les alcanza para contratar ayudantes. Existen diferentes negocios  dentro la asociación como ser; la venta de comida, la venta  de ropa, venta de artículos para vehículos, pero la actividad principal es la venta de papa y verduras la comercializan en el mercado de la Ceja (zona central de la ciudad de el Alto) y en otras ferias de la ciudad. La asociación Seis de marzo necesita de  capital  para comprar productos en mayor cantidad, con la seguridad de ampliar sus ganancias para obtener estabilidad económica en sus hogares.
texts.en:
The "March 6th" association has belonged to the Pro-Mujer family for more than year. Every two weeks they meet in the Panamericana neighborhood in the city of El Alto.

The group currently has 15 members and they have proven to be an organized group in terms of their loan payments. The majority of the group members are married with children. The children help their parents with their businesses since the earnings only cover their basic necessities and do not provide enough to hire assistants.

The association includes different businesses such as food sales, clothing sales, and auto parts sales, but the primary business is the sale of vegetables and potatoes, which are sold in the Ceja market (located in the central zone in El Alto) and in other markets around the city. The March 6th association needs capital to buy larger quantities of products to increase their earnings and ensure that their households are economically stable.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase larger quanitities of products.

loans.name: Nak

texts.en:
Mr. Nak N. is a villager in Phao Chu Kiet village in Kampong Cham province. He is a palm juice collector who gathers juice to process into palm sugar or wine. Aside from this business, he is a pig breeder. Since the second business is going well, he wants to expand it so he decided to ask for a loan to buy six more piglets, and he will use the rest of the loan to buy pig feed to feed them.

His wife, Mrs. Chuon Vin, helps him with the business. Mr. Nak N. is 31 years old and the father of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the younger one is too young to work or study because that child is only eight months old. His wife and child are also with him in the picture.

loans.use: to buy six more piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali, 38, lives in Nabatieh, in southern Lebanon. Ali has been working as a car repairer for 15 years. He also paints cars. Ali is requesting a loan of $1000 USD from A. Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his business. This is his fourth loan, and he has always repaid his loans on time. His previous loans allowed him to improve his financiA. situation. Ali is very professionA. in his work. He started this business because he wanted to improve his family's living condition. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his business

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en: Raphael is 46 years old and married with 7 children. He lives in Agbor, Delta state, Nigeria. He sells and repairs motorcycle spare parts. He has been in this business for a long time. He needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more motorcycle spare parts to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more motorcycle spare parts to sell

loans.name: Habibullo

texts.ru: Розиков Хабибулло проживает в Гиссарском районе. Женат Имеет четверых детей. Имеет среднее образование. По профессии шофер. Но работает в сфере бизнеса . Имеет магазин рядом с домом , где торгует продуктами питания. Занимается этим бизнесом уже 25 лет. Его бизнес позволяет населению пользоваться его услугами, так как они живут далеко от центра и им тяжело выезжать за продуктами. В данный момент бизнес является единственным источником дохода его семьи , поэтому получение кредита является единственной возможностью увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Habibullo R. lives in the Gissarkiy region. He is married and has 4 children. He has secondary education. He is a driver by training, but he primarily works in trade. Habibullo owns a grocery store which is located very close to his house. He has been in this business for the past 25 years. His store offers convenience and helps local residents to obtain groceries close to their home without needing to go to the center of the city. Currently, this business is the single source of income for Habibullo's family. For this reason, this loan will significantly help him by giving him the opportunity to increase the inventory. He plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Liany

texts.en:
“If you can’t have the best of what you want, learn to make the best of what you have” said Liany, a 26-year-old woman who is a sari-sari (community-based) store owner.  She is married to a farmer named Marlon. They have three children: Shine Prex who is 8 years old and studies at the elementary level, Charles Paul who is 5 years old, and Lemar who is 3 years old. The family is living happily in the rural village of Tandul in Cabatuan, Isabela. The couple strives to combat life's difficulties by doing well in their business.

Liany is a vegetable vendor and has been a store operator for one year.  She also aims to have a livestock business in the future in order to have another source of income to save and prepare for the education of their children.  She would like a loan that will serve as additional capital to expand her business. She wants to work hard for the future of her children.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Zaida Avelino

texts.pt:
Zaida nasceu em marracuene tem 33 anos de idade, vive maritalmenta estudou ate a 8 classe e mae de 1 filho de 11 anos que vive na africa do sul em casa da sua irma mais velha, e encontra se a estudar.

Zaida sai de marracuene devido a guerra com seus pais a namaacha uma vila na fronteira de swazilandia. Apos sua chegada continua com os estudos mas teve que interroper quando fica gravida e sua irma convida lhe para morar com ela na africa do sul onde ela começa a trabalhar num salao de beleza durante 2 anos. Anos depois  com o fundo que havia colectado enquanto trabalhava inicia o seu proprio negocio de venda de roupas diversas que revendia em marracuene, entao junta se com o seu esposo este que vivia em moçambique e ela muda se mas continuando a praticar o seu negocio. Tem como melhores encomendas e adguiridos a (vasos a 250.00mt, cortinas a 450.00mt, mantas a 500.00mt, lençois e calças a 350.00mt) e revende ao dobro cada encomenda, tem viajado 2 vezes por mês pois os seus clientes fazem os pagamentos em prestaçoes e tem tido um lucro mensal no valor de 3.000.00mt não consegue poupar nenhum valor  porque esta a viver numa casa de  aluguer onde paga um valor de 800.00mt por mês  e esta  a construir a sua propria casa, Para alem do seu filho responsabiliza se pela sua sobrinha que vive com ela em sua casa


Este e o primeiro emprestimo de zaida na hluvuku e kiva, estes 10.000.00mt seram usados para aumentar o volume dos seus stocks e poder satisfazer a necessidade dos seus clientes a tempo e hora. Esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo estipulado e pedir um novo emprestimo para dar continuidade da sua obra pois ela já não aguenta viver numa  casa de aluguer.
texts.en:
Zaida was born in Marracuene and is 33 years old. She is married, went to school until the 8th grade, and is the mother of an 11 year-old son who lives in South Africa with her oldest sister. He is in school. Zaida left Marracuene with her parents due to the war and went to Namaacha, a town on the border of Swaziland. After her arrival she continued with her schooling, but she had to stop when she became pregnant, and her sister invited her to live with her in South Africa. She began working in a beauty salon in Marracuene. She married her husband, who lives in Mozambique, and moved with him but continued practicing her business. Her best orders are vases at 250MT, curtains at 450MT, blankets at 500MT, and sheets and pants at 350MT. She resells for twice the cost each order. She travels 2 times per month since her customers make payments in installments, and she earns 3,000MT monthly. She is unable to save any money because she is living in a rental home and pays 800MT per month, she is constructing her own home, and besides her son she is also responsible for her niece who lives with her in her home. This is Zaida's first loan with Hluvuku and with Kiva. The 10,000MT will be used to increase the volume of her stock to satisfy the demand of her customers on time. She is confident that she will pay off the loan before the stipulated time so she can request another loan to continue her work on her home because she cannot handle living in a rental house anymore.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of various linens

loans.name: Yematon

texts.en: Yematon is 45 years old and married with three children. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells tomatoes and peppers. Yematon hopes for a loan of 100,000 nairas to purchase more tomatoes and pepper to sell.  She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support!

loans.use: To purchase more tomatoes and peppers

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es:
Epifanía es socia del Bancomunal Las Flores
Epifanía  es conviviente tiene 47 años dos hijos de 19 y 17 años que están estudiando en el instituto superior.
Epifanía trabajaba en un mercado atendiendo  en una librería, se independizo y puso en su casa una librería, le esta yendo bien. 
Desde que Epifanía esta en Finca se siente respaldada económicamente, aprendió a ser puntual.  
Epifanía necesita un préstamo 2600 soles, para la compra de abarrotes  y compra de ropa  
El sueño de Epifanía es tener una tienda de ropa  en gamarra.
texts.en:
Epifanía is a member of The Flowers cooperative bank. Epifanía is married, 47 years old, and has two children ages 19 and 17 that are studying. Epifanía worked at a market tending to a bookstore. She went off on her own, and opened a bookstore in her house that is doing well. Since Epifanía has been with Finca, she feels supported economically and has learned how to be punctual. Epifanía needs a loan of 2,600 soles to buy groceries and clothing. Epifanía’s dream is to one day have a clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries and clothing.

loans.name: Oumy

texts.fr: oumy G. est parent beneficiaire dans la communaute de camberene.elle gere une boutique de cosmetiques depuis une dizaine d'annees.elle sollicite un pret de cent milles frs pour repondre aux exigences de la clientele face a la floraison des nouveaux produits.son objectif est aussi d'ameliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Oumy G. is a client parent in the community of Camberene. She has been managing a cosmetics shop for 12 years. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs to respond to customer demands in face of the boom in new products. Her objective is also to improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Pedrito

texts.en:
Pedrito P., 51, is from the village of Lapinig, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte. He is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Pedrito owns and operates a business venture in the clothing sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling clothing in the local community. Pedrito has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns ~3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Pedrito joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pedrito is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Pedrito from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family and to pay his children’s tuition fees.


About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis  Occidental. Its membership composed of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of the Mgodi Center borrower group in Kinyanambo, Iringa. She is a 44-year-old woman, is widowed, and is the mother of one child aged 27 years. She also cares for one other dependent.

Yolanda started her own food business three years ago selling sugar and fruit. She works fifteen hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 100,000 Tanzania Shillings.

This is Yolanda’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more soap, sugar and fruit. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Yolanda hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more fruit, sugar and soap

loans.name: Rosa Cefelmira

texts.es:
La señora ROSA CEFELMIRA P. G. D. O., tiene 65 años, vive en el distrito del Porvenir  , provincia D. Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal SEMILLITAS CREATIVAS 
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5to D. secundaria  , tiene 5 hijos quienes no dependen económicamente D. ella .
ROSA    se dedica a  la fabricación y perfilado D. calzado en un pequeño taller que tiene en su domicilio
El crédito D. 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra D. materiales para la fabricación D. sus zapatos, sandalias, como: cuero, plantas, pbc ,plantilla ,etc.
Este crédito D. 1,500 nuevos soles lo invertirá  en la compra D. mas materiales para la fabricación D. su calzado.
ROSA sueña con exportar su calzado a las diferentes provincias del Perú.

loans.use: lo invertirá  en la compra de mas materiales para la fabricación de su calzado

loans.name: Semilla Group

texts.es:
Olga H. de 26 años vende calzados en la feria 16 de Julio hace 3 años, Nilda C. de 30 años vende vajillas en la misma feria, ambas son integrantes del grupo “Semilla” que a su vez pertenecen al Centro Focal “Allo Lima”,  y necesitan del préstamo para comprar mercadería y ofrecer productos variados a sus clientes. Las demás integrantes del grupo también tienen sus propios negocios como al venta de ropa, elaboración de pan, atención de salón de peinados, taller de chapista y necesitan del préstamo para comprar mercadería (chompas, faldas, deportivos)  o comprar algún activo fijo.
A la cabeza de su presidenta se reúnen para elaborar su reglamento interno.

loans.use: COMPRA DE MERCADERIA Y ACTIVO FIJO

loans.name: Hatem

texts.en: Hatem is a 34-year-old married man and the father of three young children. He has been working in concrete sales since 1998 and has 20 years of experience in this field. Today, Hatem is applying for a loan of $1,000 to buy additional supplies for his work and to satisfy the needs of his customers.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies

loans.name: Awate

texts.en: Awate Y. currently sells at a shop and is requesting a loan to purchase beans and cooking oil. Awate is 35 years old and is married with a husband that is a driver. She has 3 children, and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children. BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs, as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase beans and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Legitimas Group

texts.es:
Legítimas es un grupo de 9 mujeres y un varón y son  alegres y dinámicas, se agruparon recientemente por la necesidad de contar con un capital que les perM. ampliar sus negocios, uno de los integrantes es Williams, él tiene el negocio de venta de ropa, se animó a ingresar a el grupo porque su esposa ya trabaja con Pro Mujer en otro grupo y le va muy bien. Williams desea incrementar su mercadería  comprando nuevos fardos de ropa y para bajar  el costo  él viaja a Oruro (departamento de Bolivia), para lo cual necesita el préstamo, además Williams es padre de 2 niñas.
Las demás integrantes también tienen sus propios negocios que en su mayoría es la confección y venta de ropa y necesitan el préstamo algunas para comprar mercadería y otras para adquirir materia prima.
texts.en:
Legítimas is a group of 9 women and one man who are cheerful and dynamic. They recently came together to raise capital that will allow them to enlarge their businesses. One of the members is Williams who sells clothing. He was encouraged to join the group because his wife already works with Pro Mujer in another group and she does quite well. Williams wants buy new bundles of clothes to increase his inventory . To reduce costs, he travels to Oruro (Bolivia department), for which he needs this loan. Williams is the father of two daughters. The other members of the group also have their own activities which, for the most part, consist in making and selling clothing and some members need the funds to purchase merchandise and others to purchase raw materials.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase stock inventory, supplies and raw materials.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es:
El señor Wilson T. vive en casa de sus padres, en la zona  Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz.
El señor Wilson es empleado en una empresa avícola de esta ciudad, ingresos con los que se mantiene y colabora con sus padres.
El crédito solicitado es para la refacción de los techos de su vivienda que se encuentran deteriorados por su antigüedad.
Esta es la primera vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Mr. Wilson T. lives in his parents' house, in the Llojeta zone of the City of La Paz. He is employed in a bird-raising enterprise in this city. With his income he maintains himself and collaborates with his parents.

The credit he requests is for repairing the roof of their house which, due to age, is currently in a deteriorated state.

This is the first time he has solicited a loan and the socioeconomic analysis carried out qualifies him favorably and gives him access to a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO REPAIR THE ROOF OF THEIR HOUSE

loans.name: Dieynaba

texts.fr: Dieynaba N. est mariée, elle est âgée de 40 ans et mère de 5 enfants dont elle a la charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de MBOUSNAKH. Elle fait de l'embouche Ovine, vend de l'arachide et du mil. Elle participe à la prise ne charge de la santé et de la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Dieynaba N. is married.  She is 40 years old and the mother of five children whom she supports. She is a member of Banc Villageois de MBOUSNAKH.  Dieynaba's work involves fattening sheep and selling peanuts and millet.  She takes part in covering the costs of healthcare and schooling for her children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To augment her ability to self-finance

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John J. is 31 years old and married. He is a businessman who sells different home products. He also sells cereals in Mombasa's Port-Reitz area. John has been selling his products for two years now.

He joined KADET recently and is taking his first loan from KADET to boost his business. With his loan, John plans to increase his stock of household wares and purchase cereals to sell. His main clients are the households around the area.

He hopes to establish a better store to do his business in the future. He wants to improve his standard of living for his family.

loans.use: To buy household wares and cereals to sell.

loans.name: Fidelia

texts.en: Fidelia B. is 37 years old, and married with 3 children. Her children are still dependent on her and they go to school. Fidelia  is a focused, hard working woman. She puts in long hours trying to keep her business sustainable. She is a LAPO client. The Lift Above Poverty Organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. Fidelia is not a hair stylist but she sells hair extensions in the market in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. She hopes for a loan amount to purchase more hair extensions to sell. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Ana Alba

texts.es:
Ana P. de 26 años de edad, tiene una casa de caña con luz y agua como servicios básicos su casa esta ubicada en Paraíso de Guayaquil, es madre soltera tiene 1 hijo de 5 años que esta en una escuela particular.

Ana comenzó con unos pequeños ahorros vendiendo papi-pollo en una carreta así poco a poco incremento más  su negocio con mesas y sillas y así pudo alquilar un lugar y poner un puesto de comidas rápidas. Ahora Ana trabaja de lunes a domingos desde las 12h00 hasta el anochecer. Una de las mayores complicaciones es el traslado de la materia prima hasta el local. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, pollos, chuletas para poder agrandar el negocio, en el futuro quiere poner otra sucursal y así poder arreglar su casa con más seguridad.
texts.en:
Ana P. is 26 years old. She has a house made of sugar cane stalks. She has light and water service. Her house is located in Paraíso de Guayaquil. She is a single mother, and she has a five year old son who is in private school. With a small amount of savings Ana started selling “papi-pollo” (a typical dish with chicken and potatoes) from a cart. Little by little she increased her business and added tables and chairs. That way she was able to rent a place and set up a fast food stand. Now Ana works from Monday to Sunday from twelve until nightfall. One of the biggest problems is transporting the raw materials to her location. She will use the loan to buy rice, chicken, and chops to be able to enlarge her business. In the future she wants to set up another branch and be able to fix her house with more security.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice, chicken, and chops

loans.name: Ursula

texts.en:
Ursula O. is from the village of Owaon. She is 60 years old. Ursula is married and has 9 adult children. To make a living, Ursula plants, harvest, and sells a variety of vegetables. Ursula has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1,700 PHP average a month from these activities.

In 2007, Ursula joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ursula has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Ursula is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, fertilizer, and young crops to raise. This will be Ursula's third loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings, fertilizer, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Mrs. Chantha N. is a villager in Srae Ampil village in Kandal province. She is 22 years old. She farms a small piece of land, cultivating rice to help support her family. Her husband, Mr. Thul Sok, is a laborer who plows the fields in their village. 

The family has some problems because the field Chantha farms has infertile soil, but they don't have enough money to improve it. Thus, Mrs. Chantha N. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, and would also like to buy pesticides. 

She is the mother of two children who are too young to work or study. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Eddy

texts.en:
Eddy worked as a welder for several years before he was able to save the money necessary to start his own auto repair business. Originally a mechanic in Guatemala, Eddy was finally able to return to his preferred profession in 2008 when he opened the automotive shop with two friends.

It has not been an easy process – not long after opening, the economic crisis hit and Eddy and his partners often had conflicting ideas about how to best run the business. As Eddy found himself handling most of the mechanic work and finances on his own, he decided to buy out his friends and run the shop on his own. “It was a challenge to grow the business on my own, and to make sure that everything got done and my workers got paid. But now the business is sustainable and it’s growing!”

Thanks to Eddy’s solid skills as a mechanic and excellent rapport with his customers, his business growth has so far been sustained largely through referrals from existing clients. A $6,000 loan will allow Eddy to expand his inventory of auto parts to serve his clients better and faster, to invest in more marketing efforts to continue to grow business, and to hire a second full-time employee to help manage the growing workload.

In another year and a half Eddie would like to open another shop, and he says his dream is, “to own an auto chain like Speedy!”

Although the recession has affected business, Eddy is optimistic about the future and is proud to be able to provide for his family. Of his children, he says, “If they want to be mechanics and work in the shop it is here for them, but for now it is important that they study. I want them to be able to be whatever they want.”

loans.use: To expand his inventory of automotive parts, pay for a marketing campaign and hire a second employee

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es:
Florentina es una madre de familia de 49 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el sector Choloque del centro poblado menor Tongorrape, una zona agrícola del distrito de Motupe, en la provincia Lambayeque, ubicado a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores agrícolas junto a su esposo desde que eran jóvenes, con mucho esfuerzo pudieron comprarse un terreno agrícola de dos hectáreas en el cual actualmente han sembrado maíz. Ellos se esfuerzan diariamente para sacar adelante su cultivo porque la mayor parte de sus ingresos depende de esta actividad.

Adicionalmente su esposo trabaja como peón agrícola para poder soventar algunos de los gastos familiares. Florentina desea brindarle mantenimiento a su cultivo de maíz, por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de abonos y pesticidas con los cuales pueda lograr su objetivo.

Florentina es una mujer bastante responsable y muy entregada a su familia y a su trabajo. Ella ya ha trabajd anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Florentina is a 49 year old mother who lives with her husband and their children in the Choloque neighborhood of the town of Tongorrape, in the agricultural district of Motupe, in the Lambayeque province, located and hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. She has worked in agriculture with her husband ever since they were young; with a lot of effort they were able to buy 2 hectares of land where they currently grow corn. They work hard every day to care for their crops, since the largest part of their income depends on this activity. In addition, her husband works as a farmhand in order to cover some of the household expenses. Florentina wants to provide maintenance to her corn crops, so she has seen the necessity of requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 2,000 Peruvian soles that she will invest in the purchase of fertilizer and pesticides to achieve this objective. Florentina is a responsible woman who is very dedicated to her family and her work. She has worked with our institution before, and has demonstrated responsibility and punctuality in her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides to maintain her corn crops

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa O. D. R. 54 años D. edad, resiD. en Santiago D. María, ubicado en el departamento D. Usulután, el cual se encuentra en el oriente del país. Vive junto a su hijo el cual trabaja como empleado para una empresa privada. Rosa se dedica a la venta D. papas fritas, las cuales las ofrece con catsup, queso rallado y mayonesa. Su negocio esta ubicado en el punto D. buses del transporte publico los cuales transportan a las personas desD. la capital del país hasta Santiago D. María, ubicación la cual es muy estratégica ya que muchas D.  las personas que viajan a este lugar consumen D. sus productos para poder calmar el hambre provocada por el viaje. D. esta manera Rosa se gana la vida, teniendo cada día la esperanza D. poder ganar un poco más que el día anterior. Ella solicita un préstamo con el deseo D. poder contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en el negocio, comprando papas, queso, salsa D. tomate, aceite y gas, D. manera que pueda contar con mayor cantidad D. materia prima para poder atender a más clientes. Todo esto es con la esperanza D. mejorar su negocio y al mismo tiempo sus ventas, lo cual es primordial para Rosa ya que es esta la única fuente D. ingresos que posee.
texts.en:
Rosa O. D. R., 54 years of age, lives in Santiago D. María of the Usulután region, located in the eastern part of the country. She lives with her son, who is an employee at a private enterprise. Rosa dedicates herself to selling French fries, which she sells with catsup, grated cheese and mayonnaise. Her business is located near a bus station, where people travel from the capital to Santiago D. María. This is a very strategic location since many travelers stop to buy her products, as they are hungry after the trip. This is how Rosa makes a living, hoping each day to earn a little more than the previous day. She is requesting a loan to have funds to invest into her business, to buy items such as potatoes, cheese, tomato sauce, oil, and gas. Having more ingredients and supplies will allow her to better tend to her customers. She does all this with the hopes of improving her business and, simultaneously, her sales. This is a key goal for Rosa, since her business is her sole source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potatoes, cheese, tomato sauce, oil and gas.

location.town: Santiago de María, departamento de Usulután

loans.name: Janeffer

texts.en: Janeffer is a 35-year-old married lady with two children in school. Her husband is a salesperson while she raises poultry to earn a living. She has been a member of Faulu Kenya with the group "Amahesa Women". Her business has expanded since she joined Faulu Kenya and her standard of living has improved. This is because she previously took out a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings from the organization with the group members as guarantors. She has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy chicks, chicken feed and medicine for her broilers. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy chicks, feed and medicine for broilers

loans.name: María Teodora

texts.es:
María Teodora es una madre de familia de 36 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos en el sector Arbolsol del distrito de Mórrope, un distrito de la provincia de Lambayeque caracterizado por poseer a la mayoría de su población agrupada en zonas rurales que distan mucho entre si, la zona se encuentra ubicada a una hora y quince minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace 24 años a la crianza y venta de animales, ella cría aves de corral, cerdos y vacas en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Cuando los animales que cría alcanzan un buen punto de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los diversos negociantes que visitan la zona. El negocio es de mucha utilidad para la economía familiar, ya que las ganancias que percibe complementan los ingresos que percibe su esposo como peón agrícola y ayudan al sostenimiento de la familia.

María desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más cerdos y aves, además también tiene planeado adquirir alimento balanceado para que estos de desarrollen correctamente. Esta acción le permitirá percibir mas ganancias y ayudar a su familia a salir adelante. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a alcazar su meta.

María es una mujer bastante entregada a los suyos y que siempre da lo mejor de si para sacarlos adelante. En la zona donde vive ella es muy estimada, sus vecinos le consideran una persona tranquila y que siempre está dispuesta a ayudar cuando se le necesita.
texts.en:
María Teodora is a mother, 36 years old, who lives with her husband and three children in the Arbosol sction of the Mórrope district, a district in the Lambayeque Province, known for having the majority of the population grouped in rural areas that are distanced from one another. The area is located one hour and 15 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. Since she was 24 years old she's devoted herself to raising and selling animals. She raised ranch birds, pigs, and cows in the backyard of her home. When the animals she raised reach a certain healthy point of development, she sells them to diverse merchants that visit the zone. The business is quite useful for the family's economics, as her earnings complement the income her husband makes as a farm worker, and they help sustain the family. Maria wants to enlarge her business by buying more pigs and birds. In addition she's planning to buy nutritious feed so that her livestock develop in healthy ways. This action will enable her to achieve greater profits and help her family move forward. For this reason, she's come to see the need to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 soles to help her reach her goal. Maria is a rather generous woman who always does her best to move her family forward. In the neighborhood where she lives she is highly regarded and her neighbors consider her a calm person who will help anyone who needs it.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pigs, farm birds and nutritious feed to enlarge her business.

loans.name: Soussi

texts.en:
Soussi is a 53 year old married woman from Lebanon, who has three children. Soussi has a business repairing and making clothing for men and women. She has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase thread and improve her business. Soussi has been working from her house as a sewer for 26 years; therefore she has a broad customer base which includes friends, neighbors, family members and people from her region. Soussi has been a microcredit client for eight years and she paid back her previous loan on time. Soussi's previous loans always allowed her to improve her business. 
Not only is Soussi known for her talented work, she is also very punctual and repairs clothes within 1 or 2 days. When she first started her business, she had some financial issues. Soussi is a very active and has self confidence which encouraged her to start her business.

loans.use: To purchase thread.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia F. is from the village of Salawagan, Quezon Bukidnon. She is 40 years old. Aurelia is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Aurelia owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Aurelia has been engaged in her business for over 18 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2002, Aurelia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Aurelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from HSPFI. Aurelia is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 9th loan taken out by Aurelia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Kuru Masaba Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Kuru Masaba” group. They are small-scale-business women based in Magburaka town in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living.

The leader of this group is Aminata K.. Aminata is age 23; she was born in Magburaka. Her husband is a motorbike driver and her two children are attending primary school.

For four years now, Aminata has sold shoes. With her share of the loan, she will invest in her business by buying shoes wholesale.

loans.use: To buy more shoes wholesale to sell

loans.name: Bernarditha

texts.en:
Bernarditha M. is a 51-year-old woman who supports her family by selling “POSO” (rice wrapped in young coconut leaves), fish vending and tailoring. She lives in Brgy. Tangki, Naga, Cebu City with her husband and their five children who are between 21-25 years old, already with their own families.

A member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007, Bernarditha has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. Bernarditha now earns an average monthly income of Php 15,000.

Bernarditha is now borrowing Php 10,500, her sixth loan from NWTF-Projectto Dungganon, to use as additional working capital. Her previous loan of Php 9,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Bernarditha aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.en:
Shuhrat works very hard, having been a farmer since childhood. Today, as a head of household, he works tirelessly to generate a stable income. He works caring for his animals, getting up very early to gather grasses so he can keep his livestock well-fed. At the same time he has a grocery store near his house. Shuhrat sells the milk they produce, as well as grocery products for his community. He is seeking this current loan for the purchase of one additional cow and foodstuffs for expanding his business. Please help support Shuhrat’s efforts so he can continue to improve his standard of living. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase a cow and foodstuffs in order to expand the business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace B. is from Upper Dulawon, Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 44 years old, married, and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Grace owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling firewood in the local community. Grace has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Grace joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional firewood to sell. She is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be Grace’s 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.



*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Maria Elcira

texts.es:
María Elcira tiene 49 años de edad, es separada y vive junto a sus dos hijos en el sector Nueve de Octubre, una zona urbano marginal situada en los alrededores de la ciudad de Chiclayo, una de las ciudades – eje del comercio en el norte. Es bastante conocida por su movimiento comercial y de transporte.

Se dedica desde hace cinco años a la venta de cerveza en su domicilio. Ella vende esta bebida a sus vecinos los cuales la consumen preferentemente los fines de semana, debido al tiempo que lleva laborando en esta actividad su negocio se ha vuelto conocido y cuenta con una clientela estable. Los ingresos que ella percibe de esta actividad los utiliza en el sostenimiento de su familia.

Debido a la gran acogida con la que cuenta su negocio ella ha pensado ampliar su nivel de ventas adquiriendo mas cerveza, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

María Elcira es una mujer luchadora y trabajadora. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. En la zona sus vecinos y conocidos la quieren y estiman mucho.
texts.en:
María Elcira is 49 years old. She is separated, and she lives with her two children in the Nueve de Octubre neighborhood. It is a marginally urban area on the outskirts of the city of Chiclayo, which is one of the pivotal commercial cities in the north. It is well-known for its commercial movement and for transportation. She has been selling beer in her house for five years. She sells this drink to her neighbors, who consume it preferably on the week-ends. Due to the time that she has spent working in her business, she has become well-known and has a stable customer base. She uses the income that she gets from this activity to support her family. Because her business is so well received, she plans on increasing her level of sales by getting more beer. To achieve this objective she believes it is advisable to request, for the first time, a loan for 1,500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa. María Elcira is a tenacious and hard-working woman. Her greatest desire is to continue growing as a businesswoman in order to be able to give her family a better quality of life. Her neighbors and acquaintances in the area like her and hold her in high esteem.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beer to expand her sales business in her house

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary W. is a 50-year-old widowed lady who is a mother to two children aged 27 and 22 years old. She is in the business of selling second-hand clothes within the open-air market in Bungoma town. 

Mary has applied for her first loan with KADET, which she will use to buy more second-hand clothes for resale. She hopes to make a good profit and plow it back into the business.

In the future, she would like to sell ready-made clothes from her hard work.

loans.use: To buys more bales of second-hand clothes for resale

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena L. is from the village of Eastern, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 60 years old. Nena is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Nena owns & operates a business buying and selling vegetables in the local community. Nena has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional vegetables to sell. Nena is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Nena from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 36-year-old member of Funga Leso group.  She has been operating a grocery shop for seven months where she sells fruits, vegetables, cereals and milk.   Mary is a hardworking mother of two and she hopes to improve her business in the future.  She has learned how to save her money for personal needs.  She thanks Faulu Kenya for the support. 

She has requested 20,000 KES to buy more vegetables, milk and cereals to sell.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables, milk and cereals

loans.name: Franklin Xavier

texts.es: El Sr. Franklin G. es originario del municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón, actualmente se desempeña como maestro de educación primaria desde hace cinco años. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel para la compra de piso, cemento, arena y pago de mano de obra con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda y asi brindarle un mejor nivel de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Franklin G. is originally from the town of Santa Rosa del Peñón and currently works as an elementary school teacher.  He has worked there for five years.  This will be his first loan through Ceprodel and he will use the money to buy flooring, cement, sand, and to pay for labor so that he can make improvements to his home and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: Building materials and labor

loans.name: Florente

texts.en:
Florente R. Jr. is from the village of Agay-ayan, Gingoog City. He is 33 years old. Florente is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Florente owns & operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling firewood in bundles in the local community. Florente has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Florente joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Florente is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional firewood to buy and sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Florente from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional firewood to buy and sell.

loans.name: Meas

texts.en: Meas S., 38, is married and lives with her husband and three children in Takeo province. She is a professional silk weaver, typically making US$ 2 of profit every day. She has been doing this business since 2004, while her husband works at a farm, growing rice and vegetables. He usually makes US$ 1 per day. Three of the children are in school. Meas S. would like to take out a loan of US$ 700 to purchase more silk.

loans.use: To purchase more silk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy soldering irons and drills

loans.name: Mariana De Jesus

texts.es:
Mariana de 49 años, es costurera y confeccionista de ropa por pedido a diferentes personal del sector donde vive en la Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución a las afuera de Guayaquil).

Por la necesidad de trabajar y la falta de oportunidades María comenzó a trabajar hace 20 años como costurera y confeccionista porque era la actividad que más le gustaba realizar. No tiene horario fijo ya que su taller de costura lo tiene ubicado en una parte de su casa. Trabaja haciendo ropa por pedidos. Una de las dificultades al trabajar es que su casa está mal construida y tiene problemas. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar telas y comprar cemento, arena, bloques para arreglar un poco su casa. En el futuro quiere seguir con salud y seguir trabajando para asegurar su vejez.
texts.en:
Mariana is 49 years old.  She is a seamstress and dressmaker.  She makes her products to fill orders from different people from her area of Primavera de Duran (a peri-urban area with a deteriorating ecosystem on the outskirts of Guayaquil).

Through the need to work and the lack of opportunities, María started working as a seamstress and dressmaker 20 years ago because it was the activity that she most liked doing.  She doesn't work regular hours since her dressmaking workshop is located in her own home.  She works making clothes to order.  One of the difficulties she has in working is that her house is badly built and has problems.

She will use this loan to buy fabric and also to buy cement, sand and blocks to fix her house a little.  In the future, she would like to continue enjoying good health and continue working to guarantee her old age.

loans.use: To buy cement and sand

loans.name: Dios Proveera 4, 6, 7 Group

texts.en:
Fela plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling miscellaneous products. She will buy clothing, shoes, cosmetics and household products. 

She is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and expanded her business. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business and save for her children's education. She wants to have an improved business that gives enough support for her family's needs. 

She is the mother of two children and they live together with her long-term partner. She enjoys cooking special food for her family.

Fela is a member of the group called Dios Proveera 4, 6, 7 (God Will Provide). Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Dominican and Haitian clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the economy is dominated by the sugarcane harvest and where running water, none of which is potable, and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy miscellaneous products

loans.name: Maria Isbel

texts.es:
La señora Maria Isabel G. ya ha tenido tres créditos con Kiva los cuales han sido para pagos escolares de sus hijos.
Doña Maria Isabel esta nuevamente solicitando un préstamo para pagar la inscripción de la escuela, ya que no cuenta con el dinero necesario y no le admiten a su niños si no esta pagado. 
 Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo como empleada de una maquiladora en el departamento de producción.
Ya que su esposo el señor Clemente Delgado se encargara de los gastos familiares, de su trabajo como constructor.
texts.en: Señora Maria Isabel G. has had three previous loans with Kiva, which have been to cover school fees for her children. Maria Isabel is now seeking a new loan to cover the enrolment fee, because she doesn't have enough money available and they will not let her children attend until it is paid. She plans to repay the loan with the income she makes from her job as a factory worker. Her husband, Señor Clemente Delgado, takes charge of the other household costs, through his job as a construction worker.

loans.use: School expenses for their children

loans.name: Frevisminda

texts.en:
Frevisminda O. is from the village of Poblacion, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 48 years old. Frevisminda is a widow and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling daily use products such as canned goods, noodles, sugar, milk, candies, pastries, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $445 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Frevisminda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

She is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 5th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Giovannia Maria

texts.es:
Giovannia es una joven de 23 años de edad, casada, madre de un hijo. Su esposo labora como ejecutivo de cartera y cobro en una empresa privada. Siendo su negocio la venta de cosméticos, bisutería, manualidades teniendo cuatro años en las ventas, anteriormente laboraba en una tienda de manualidades, la cual cerró y se ha dedicado completamente al comercio.
Como objetivo es el mejoramiento de su vivienda el cual opto al financiamiento  para lograr esta mejora de un bajarete en frente de su casa, asi como la compra de puertas que están en mal estado.
Comprara materiales como: laminas de zinc, cuartones, clavos, madera, a si como puerta lo que está contenta por la probación que Afodenic está otorgando atreves del crédito. El cual podrá equilibrar sus gastos y poder cumplir sus compromiso de pago.
texts.en:
Giovannia is a young woman who is 23 years of age. She is married and the mother of one child. Her husband works as a billing and collections manager for a private business. Giovannia has a business selling cosmetics, trinkets, and handicrafts that she started four years ago. She previously worked at a crafts store, but the store went out of business, so she decided to become a small businesswoman full-time.

One of Giovannia’s goals is to make improvements to her home, so she has opted to seek financing in order to build a veranda at the front of her house. She will also buy doors to replace the existing ones that are in bad condition, as well as construction materials such as sheets of zinc, beams, nails, and wood. Giovannia is happy that AFODENIC has extended this credit opportunity to her so that she can balance out her expenses while completing her payment obligations.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build a veranda & new doors to replace the ones in bad condition

loans.name: Soksan

texts.en:
Mrs. Soksan P. and her husband, Mr. Chheang Chhum, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  Soksan is a weaver. Her husband has just started a new business, he is a construction worker. 

Soksan hopes to supplement their income by starting a new business raising pigs. She will be able to earn extra income from selling the pigs when they grow big enough. Hence she is applying for a loan of $500 to purchase piglets to raise.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth J. is from the village of Plaridel, Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 49 years old. Elizabeth is separated from her spouse and has nine school-aged children. To make a living, Elizabeth owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling dried fish, bananas & coconuts for copra in the local community. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Elizabeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional green and yellow bananas to sell. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Elizabeth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional green and yellow bananas to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Nelly

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Ma. Nelly is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Nelly is 48 years old. 

Ma. Nelly has an ice cream making business in the Philippines. Ma. Nelly requested a PHP 28,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase materials to make an additional ice cream box and repair a bicycle.

Ma. Nelly has been in this business for 31 years.  In the future, Ma. Nelly would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make an additional ice cream box and repair a bicycle

loans.name: Sadiq

texts.en: Sadiq N. is married, has three children, and makes a living as a businessman in Agsu, Azerbaijan, selling auto accessories and spare parts in a local car market. His business, which is five years old, is flourishing, as more and more people buy vehicles, and the items he sells are always in high demand. To take advantage of this demand, he is applying for a loan for 1000 AZN to buy more items to sell to his customers. His goals are to maintain his leading position in the market and continue to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to increase profit.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.es:
En el estado de Oaxaca existe una comunidad llamada Arroyo de pita la cual se caracteriza por ser la unica comunidad en varios kilometros  que cuanta con un bachillerato, en esta comunidad vive La señora Avelina S. tiene la edad de 55 años, solo estudio la primaria y esta casada con el señor bonifacio el cual se dedica al tranajo del campo.

Doña Abelina nos platica que hace mas de 30 años abrio una pequeña tiendita de abarrotes y con el pasar de los años le fue invirtiendo mas y metio un poco de papeleria, su tienda es una de las mas grandes y mojor surtidas de la comunidad, ademas de tener sus abarrotes ella vende pollo en su casa de lunes a domingo con sus amigos y vecinos, doña avelina es una mujer muy alegre, entusiasta y trabajadora, ella nos dice que inicio atrabajar en su negocio porque deseaba ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y ahora solo desea que su negocio prospere dia a dia para ayudar a sus hijas a dale estudios a sus nietos, 

ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de lapiz, lapiceros, hojas blancas y de colores, resistol, tijeras, cartilinas, papel bond, plastilina, unicel, fomy, cuadernos, libretas, laminas,arroz, frijol, aceite, sopa, jabon, pasta dental, refrescos, dulces, cafe, galletas, jugos, veladoras, crema, queso, tomates, chiles, cebolla y  papel higienico ara resurtir su negocio. ella se encuantra muy contenta por el prestamo otorgado y envia un saludo a la fundacion y mucho agradecimiento ya que con este prestamo hara que su negocio prospere
texts.en:
There is a community in the state of Oaxaca called Arroyo de Pita, which is known for being the only community for miles around that offers the possibility of obtaining a high school diploma. In this community lives Avelina S.. She is 55 years of age, has only studied at primary school and is married to Bonifacio, who works in agriculture.

Avelina tells us that she opened a small grocery store over 30 years ago. With the passing of time she invested more and more into her business, expanding it to include a bit of stationery as well, until it became one of the biggest and best stocked in the community. As well as selling groceries, Avelina also sells chicken in her house to her friends and neighbours, seven days a week. Avelina is a very happy, enthusiastic and hardworking woman. She tells us that she started her business because she wanted to help her husband with living expenses and give her children a better quality of life. Her only wish is that her business prospers day by day to help her daughters provide her grandchildren with an education.

Avelina needs this loan to purchase pens, pencils, white and coloured paper, glue, scissors, paper for posters, bond paper, plasticine, styrofoam, foam rubber, exercise books, notebooks, lamination paper, rice, beans, oil, soup, soap, toothpaste, refreshments, sweets, coffee, biscuits, juice, candles, cream, cheese, tomatoes, chillies, onions and toilet paper to restock her store. Avelina is very happy to receive the loan that has been granted to her and sends her greetings and much gratitude to the foundation for the loan that will make her business prosper.

loans.use: to purchase groceries, stationery and chicken

loans.name: Las Hermanas Group

texts.es:
Este comité inició la Sra. Fátima M. domiciliada en el Barrio Santo Domingo de la Ciudad de Carapeguá. 
El comité denominado “Las Hermanas” es integrado por un grupo de señoras muy responsables y trabajadoras.
Algunas de las integrantes ya contaban con trabajo antes de formar parte del comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y se integraron para lograr mejorar sus emprendimientos, otras sin embargo comenzaron con su primera actividad luego de integrar este grupo.
El comité lo conforman mujeres muy sacrificadas que han luchado toda su vida para llevar adelante a sus familiares a pesar de los obstáculos que siempre existen. 
La Sra. Fátima se dedica hace varios años a la venta de comidas, ella se levanta muy temprano a preparar su comida para salir a vender. La venta lo realiza de forma ambulante y en el recorrido le ayudan sus hijos. 
La Sra Fatima agradece de manera especial a la Fundación por que mediante el apoyo brindado por la misma en periodos anteriores pudo acceder a más capital y así poder agrandar su negocio porque ahora cuenta con mas vendedores de comida.
Nuevamente solicita otro crédito para poder adquirir mayor cantidad de comestibles para la preparación de alimentos y su posterior venta.
texts.en:
Fátima M. began this group in Santo Domingo de la Ciudad de Carapeguá. The “Las Hermanas” group is comprised of several responsable and hard-working women who work to better their family's future.  Some of the members had been part of a group called "Mujeres Emprendedoras" and benefited from this association, while for others this is their first group activity.
Fátima has sold food items for many years, rising early to take her products door to door, and is assisted by her children.  She is grateful to the lending group for credit it has granted her which has allowed her to grow her business.  She seeks this loan to increase her inventory of food items, allowing her to expand sales.

loans.use: To buy materials and basic food items such as pasta, sugar, rice, soft drinks, flour, etc.

loans.name: Kaetua

texts.en: Kaetua is 33 years old, married and has two children. He has been farming his piece of land for the past five years. He has been a good client and this will be his third loan from Kiva partner, KADET. He plans to use the loan to purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizer. He hopes to make a profit and use it to educate his children and expand his farming business. Kaetua dreams of prospering in farming to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Luis Germánico

texts.en:
Luis is a 29-year-old entrepreneur who lives in Otavalo, a market town in the northern region of Ecuador. He is married and has two children aged six and three. To support his family, he works selling and delivering cylinders of natural gas. He runs this business on his own. Luis reports that his business is going well and that he is seeking a loan to expand his inventory through the purchase of 25 cylinders of gas. 

Luis hopes that this loan will "improve his family's standard of living" through the expansion of his business. He hopes to eventually hire co-workers as his business grows.

loans.use: to buy cylinders of natural gas to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah lives in the Ndeeba neighborhood of the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has eight children, five of whom are in school.  

Hadjah has a business selling sweet bananas.  She has been in this business for six years, and she works seven days out of every week. Hadjah sells her products at the market by means of wholesale/retail.    

Hadjah has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of sweet bananas to sell.  The main business challenges for Hadjah include transportation and ever increasing prices of sweet bananas in Uganda.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see her business growing big so that she can get enough profits to buy a delivery van.   Hadjah lives in a home that she owns and she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medications.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of sweet bananas to sell.

loans.name: Sharifah's Group

texts.en:
Sharifah's group is comprised of three hardworking women. Sharifah herself is 21 years old, single and has no children. She lives in the town of Bulenga in Kampala’s western region in Uganda. For a year Sharifah has sold fruits and vegetables.

To help expand her business, Sharifah has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. Her loan will be used to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell. Sharifah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to save money.

With the help of the loan from BRAC, Sharifah hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself by buying new clothes. In the future, Sharifah hopes to own a salon.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Manfredo

texts.es: El sr.  Manfredo vive en la zona Virgen de lujan hace 7 años en su casa propia, convive con la Sra. Casilda y sus 4 hijos, los cuales dos estan a su cargo. Don Manfredo lleva 9 años con la actividad del transporte es socio de la línea y el personalmente lo trabaja su micro ya que así de esta forma mantiene y cuida su herramienta de trabajo que es su micro. El crédito que se le otorgo fue para el mantenimiento de su micro (cambio de balatas, cambio de llantas, y tapizado). “el Sr. esta agradecido por la rapidez en que se le otorgo el crédito y la confianza brindad hacia su persona.
texts.en:
Sr. Manfredo has lived in his own home in the District of Virgen de Lujan for seven years. He is in a common-law relationship with Sra. Casilda and they have four children, two of whom are still under their care. Don Manfredo has been in the transportation business for nine years. He is a member of a travel line network and personally drives a microbus. Manfredo must maintain and take care of his vehicle since it is the main piece of equipment that he uses for work.

This loan will be used for the maintenance of his microbus (purchase brake pads, replace the tires, reupholster). Sr. Manfredo appreciates the quick response to his loan request and the trust being demonstrated to him as a person.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance of his microbus.

loans.name: Ma. Cecilia

texts.en:
Ma. Cecilia is single and, for the past five years, has run a sari-sari (retail) business in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family. 

Ma. Cecilia is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy products to sell such as canned goods, biscuits, bread, and other items. In the future, she would like to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, biscuits, and bread to sell

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is married with two children aged thirteen and ten years. She is a farmer who lives in Kisii, South Rift, Kenya. She has been farming for three years growing carrots, onions and bananas which she takes to the local market. She also runs a retail shop within the local market to supplement her farming income. The lack of organized markets for the farmers and the effect of pests on animals and production in general are her major problems.

Gladys has requested a loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the income derived from this cow will enable her to get a better education for her children by taking them to better schools.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married woman with five children. One of her children attends school and the other four have graduated. Mwanajuma owns a house without electricity or running water and her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. For the past 13 years, she has operated a beauty salon business and her customers are neighbors and passersby. In addition, Mwanajuma also operates a motorcycle transport business that provides another source of income. Her major business challenge is seasonality. Mwanajuma decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.
 
Mwanajuma is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to purchase spare parts to repair her motorcycle. In the future, she dreams of establishing a spare parts shop.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to repair her motorcycle

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is 33 years old and married to Simon Mbugua. They work together in the carpentry business located at Githurai 45. They have three children who are school going. They get a monthly income of 20,000 KES from the business. She has been in the business for the past six years.

This is her first loan from KADET. She intends to use the loan to buy more timber. Anticipated profits will help her expand her business and educate her children. She hopes to develop her business to greater heights.

loans.use: to buy more timber

loans.name: Kware Group

texts.en:
Hellen is the facilitator of the Kware group. Hellen and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Hellen had a very good maize yield harvesting 14 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Hellen was only able to harvest 8 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from the maize sales, Hellen will invest in a cow and later build a house.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Hellen and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

In 2012, the members of Kware group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the picture above, Kware group is joined by their Field Officer (far left) and many children of Kware group farmers.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 70 years old and married. She has four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Salome is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Salome has been raising pigs for 35 years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane and running a sari-sari store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna is a young entrepreneur who is married with one child. Her husband's occupation is farming while she is busy operating her home-based store. She has been managing it for one year and she is able to earn about PHP 1,500 monthly. Edna would like to buy more items for her store to increase her sales and have a greater income but her funds are not enough due to the increase in basic commodities and the credits of her customers. So Edna would like to ask for a loan in the amount of PHP 7,000. With her loan, she can increase her profit and encourage more customers to buy from her store. She believes that her business will allow her to move her family forward and provide them a better quality of life each day.

loans.use: to buy more items for her store

loans.name: Maria Teresa
