texts.es: La Señora Maria Teresa tiene como actividad su pulpería, ella realiza su negocio de lunes a viernes desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche  toda la semana en su vivienda que es donde está ubicado su negocio.Esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso para ella y su familia, es por eso que solicita  el crédito es para la compra de granos básico, detergentes, golosinas, refrescos, pan, sopas y papel higiénico. Esto le permitirá suplir su negocio y al mismo tiempo agrandar su negocio y mejorara sus ingresos.
texts.en: Maria Teresa's business is a grocery store.  She works in her store from Monday to Friday, from 7.00am to 9.00pm.  Her business is located in her home.  This activity is her main source of income for herself and her family.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy basic grains, detergents, candies, soft drinks, bread, soups and toilet paper.  This will allow her to stock her business, enlarge her business and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, detergents, candies, soft drinks, bread, soups and toilet paper

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 400 pounds of beans, 300 pounds of rice, 400 pounds of sugar, 8 gallons of oil, 10 boxes of soap, 12 packs of rinzen, 10 packs of bleach for the store and 200 chickens and 100 pounds of food concentrate, vitamins and medicines for the chickens.

loans.name: Jackie

texts.en:
Jackie is a 24 years old college graduate who helps his parents operate their small farm.  He is actively looking for a better paying job.

Jackie is asking for a loan of P14,000 to purchase seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and farm inputs.  He wants to provide for the needs of their farm to endow it with a lot of profit.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and farm inputs.

loans.name: Ravshanjon

texts.ru: Равшанчон житель города Исфара. Ему 36 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Его жена занимается шитьем национальной верхней мужской одежды (джома). Дети учатся в средней школе. Сам он занимается торговлей сухофруктов. Кроме того он подрабатывает строительными работами по найму. Кредит берет для закупа сухофруктов.
texts.en: Ravshanjon lives in Isfara. He is 36 years old, married and has three children. His children are still attending school. Ravshanjon's wife is a seamstress and makes traditional Tajik men overcoats (djoma) for sale. He himself sells dried fruit at the local market as well as works as a construction worker on the side. Ravshanjon needs this loan to purchase dried fruits wholesale.

loans.use: to purchase dried fruit

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has six children.
 
Nenita has a shop that sells vegetables and flowers during harvest time. She has had this business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy fertilizers for flower and vegetable gardens.

Nenita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Nenita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for flower and vegetable gardens.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 45 years old and married with five children. One of her children is in school. She has had a business selling charcoal in Kator, South Sudan for six years.

Rosa is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a permanent house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Vantha

texts.en: Vantha, 54, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chnang Province. Cambodia. She is a rice farmer. Her husband is a fisherman. Three of her children are employed at the garment factory. Growing rice is the main source of income that supports her family. Therefore, Vantha is requesting a loan of USD 400 to purchase rice seed and fertilizer to grow rice in the dry season. In the future, she would like to renew her house and support her children to study until they get Bachelor degrees.

loans.use: to purchase rice seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Sman

texts.en:
Sman, age 41, and his wife have been operating a fish selling business from a market in Phnom Penh city for more than six years.  Typically, they are able to earn an income of $9.00 per day to satisfy their cost of living.  At present, Sman has only one child who is attending secondary school. 

Sman has applied for a loan from HKL and Kiva to construct a house for his small family.  Previously, they lived in a rented room which resulted in a large monthly expense.  He tells us that this loan will provide him with a family-owned house in which to live.  He is very grateful to all lenders who are helping him.

loans.use: to construct a house for his small family.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida is a 50 year-old woman from Madaba, Jordan who has four family members. She is requesting a loan of 1000 JOD in order to pay for her son's university tuition. Her aspirations are to buy a car and own a home. She always strives to improve her family's socio-economic status. The photo above is of Aida's son.

loans.use: to pay for university education.

loans.name: Mansura

texts.en:
This group is organized by Mansura.She is the chief of this group. She is hard worker. Using the wooden manufactured product and ironmongery she with her group are engaged in production of the caddy wagon hitching.This 41-year-old Mansura is very clever and brave woman. She has been engaged in this business since 2001. With her business background, Mansura was a role model to many women and they were determined to start small businesses. She enjoyes to work in this business.
Mansura is married ,has three children. She 
is Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of  Azerbaijan Kalbajar. She and her family settled in Sumgait shosse.
Having borrowed 2 loans of $400-$800 from Komak Credit Union Mansura bought welding apparatus and expanded the area of her business. She requires loan assistance of $1850 to strengthen the supply with necessary materials: board, accessories, reinforcing steel and etc.

loans.use: To strengthen the supply

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mpato would like to buy 5 steers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Susan would like to buy variety of cloth materials

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria Pelicó P. is a member of a group of women who all rent little plots of land to grow crops for a little bit of supplemental cash. Maria rents her little plot of just a single cuerda for about US$158/year, and grows ornamental flowers like daisies and carnations. She'll invest this loan in seed, fertilizer, and pesticides. Her little business brings in less than 15% of her income, so she also works extensively in the fields of others.

Maria, 23, is married with no children. She never had any schooling, cannot read or write, and speaks only a smattering of Spanish, since day-to-day conversations are carried out in her native Quiché language. Working the fields is her life, and at least now with this plot she can do a bit of it for her own profit.

Women's group: "De la Cruz" in La Estancia de la Cruz, Quetzaltenango

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase seed, fertilizer, and pesticides for flower crop

location.town: La Estancia de la Cruz, Quetzaltenango

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Trần Thị C., 32 years old, lives with her husband and their 2 young children. They are a little happy family. They run a catering business making "bánh quẩy", kind of finger - shaped soufle' batter, to accompany soup or porridge. They supply "bánh quẩy" to the restaurants in the region. They live in the village of Trung giã, Sóc Sơn, Hà Nội. They had built a 2 storey house in 2006 after 10 years of hard work and saving. Their revenue is about 125 USD a month. They have 1 employee who gets paid 40 USD a month. Ms C. is requesting a loan of 950 USD to buy more stock (rice flour), expand her facility and to buy machinery.

Translater from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Chị Trần Thị C. năm nay 32 tuổi đang sống cùng chồng và hai con nhỏ, cuộc sống gia đình họ rất hạnh phúc. Công việc chính của gia đình là chế biến bánh quẩy, một loại thực phẩm thường ăn kèm với phở cháo, phục vụ cho các quán ăn. Họ sống và làm ăn tại xã Trung giã, Sóc Sơn, Hà Nội trong căn nhà 2 tầng mới được xây năm 2006. Đây là thành quả tích lũy được sau 10 năm lao động của 2 anh chị. Thu nhập bình quân của 2 anh chị hiện nay khoảng 125USD/tháng. Ngoài ra 2 chị còn thuê thêm 1 nhân công và trả công 40USD/tháng. Chị đang làm hồ sơ xin vay 950USD để mua thêm nguyên liệu (bột mì) làm quẩy. Trong thời gian tới chị dự định sẽ mở rộng địa điểm sản xuất và mua máy làm quẩy thay cho sản xuất thủ công.

loans.use: buy rice flour to make finger-shaped soufflé

loans.name: Ai

texts.en: Ai K. is 38 years old and married. She sells cooked foods such as noodles, fried snacks, etc., and usually earns $10 per day. Her husband Sugiarto is working at the shop and earns about $10 per week.  Ai is a member of MBK and would like a loan of $75 (IDR 500,000) to buy more goods for the store and pay for her children's education. She is willing to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Farida

texts.en: I am Farida A. Q. from Lahore, a big metropolis. I am 39, married and have five children. All of my children study at a local school. I am determined to support my husband by sharing his financial burden by stitching clothes for my neighborhood clients. My husband is a shoemaker and needs to expand his business. by buying raw materials such as leather, glue and decorative ornaments for his shoemaking business.She urgently needs a loan and is requesting a $500 loan.

loans.use: Expand shoes business

loans.name: Luu Thi

texts.vi:
When TYM fund opened a branch in the village of Hoàng Kim in 2002, Ms Lưu Thị Thơ was one of its first members. Ms Thơ is 45 years old. She started with a loan of 50 USD which was invested in pig breeding. She had success with the breeding, the profit increased and she was able to qualify for bigger loans in later rounds. The last loan that she received, 1200 USD, was used to build new pig pen and develop hydroponic cultivation following VAC model. Her income increased 40%, from 100 USD to 140 USD a month. Her husband operates a carpentry shop out of their home. Together they have a steady income. Their son is attending university and their daughter is in grade 12. Ms Thơ is very well respected by her peers, she is the TYM village leader for the last few years. She was voted as "entrepreneur of the year 2007" by the women group in her village. This time she is requesting a loan of 1200 USD to buy chickens and feed.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Khi Quỹ Tình thương đến với xã Hoàng Kim năm 2002, chị Lưu Thị Thơ, 45 tuổi là một trong những thành viên đầu tiên tham gia vào Quỹ. Với mức vốn vay ban đầu là 50USD chị chăn nuôi lợn nái. Số vốn vay tăng lên cùng với sự phát triển của dự án, vòng vốn vừa qua chị đã mạnh dạn vay 1200USD để xây dựng chuồng trại, tu sửa vườn trên ao dưới theo mô hình VAC. Thu nhập tăng từ 100USD lên 140USD/tháng. Chồng chị làm xưởng mộc tại nhà nên kinh tế rất phát triển, thu nhập rất ổn định. Con trai chị đang học đại học, con gái út đang học lớp 12. Chị Thơ nhiều năm được chị em tín nhiệm bầu làm cụm trưởng, tổng kết năm 2007 chị được hội phụ nữ xã bầu là hội viên làm kinh tế giỏi. Vòng vốn tới chị tiếp tục vay 1200USD để mua gà giống và thức ăn gia cầm.

loans.use: Buy chickens and chicken-feed

loans.name: Lucy Aurora's Group

texts.en:
Lucy, Yolanda, and Luz are members of the community bank “Triunfo II”. Lucy and Luz have been members for over ten years while Yolanda joined one year ago. In that time they have learned responsibility and how to increase their business. They have also learned about health and how to improve their relationships with their husbands.

Lucy is 37 years old. She is married and has five children between the ages of three and twenty-three. Lucy has owned a tailor shop for ten years. She began working out of her home but now rents a store. Before this she raised and butchered animals.

Yolanda is 25 years old. She grows flowers in the nearby small town of Quinua and then sells them at the in Ayacucho. She has had this business for five years. Since joining the community bank Yolanda has been able to open a store where she sells both flowers and food staples such as rice, sugar, and flour.

Luz travels to different markets in the region buying fruits, vegetables, and grains, she then sells them in the city of Ayacucho. On weekends she uses her car to transport passengers between various small towns.

Lucy, Yolanda, and Luz need loans of 400, 1000, and 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use in addition to their savings to buy an industrial sewing machine, a larger car, and to generally increase their level of merchandise.

Their dreams are to be millionaires and failing that to continue to develop their businesses, give their children a better life, own a nice house with two floors, and a car.

loans.use: Lucy, Yolanda, and Luz need loans of 400, 1000, and 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use in addition to their savings to buy an industrial sewing machine, a larger car, and to generally increase their level of merchandise.

loans.name: Nabat

texts.en: Nabat was born in 1960. She is single, and lives in the Khachmaz region. Nabat and her brother (who is pictured) have raised cattle for 6 years. They need a loan of $1200 to buy a cow.

loans.use: to buy  a cow

loans.name: Zarita

texts.es:
Zarita possesses a lot of talent in making wool garments with knitting needles. She works daily within her home without ignoring the development of her small daughter; she always accompanies her and while she attends her daughter's daily classes, she tirelessly knits. She has the noble wish of forming a group of knitters with the goal of networking and making garments on a bigger scale and of a bigger variety. With this purpose in mind, she asks for your support to begin her road towards progress.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Conover, Kiva.org volunteer. Zarita, posee mucho talento para elaborar prendas de lana con palitos de tejer, se desempeña a diario dentro de su hogar sin descuidar el desarrollo escolar de su pequeña; la acompaña siempre y mientras atienda la lectura diaria de su niña teje incansablemente.Tiene el noble deseo de constituir un grupo de tejedoras a fin de asociarse y elaborar prendas en mayor escala y de mayor variedad; con ese propósito en mente solicita vuestro apoyo para iniciar su camino hacia el progreso.

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity of primary material (wool)

loans.name: Murahna

texts.id:
Muranha is now living in a rented room with her husband. All of their children have got married and had their own business. They use the terrace in front of the room to do the business.

Muranha sews bags everyday. Bags that have been ready, then are brought to the nearest art shops that have ordered them. The business is quite hard for Muranha because she has to purchase the raw materials with her own money. Actually, the income she could earn is quite big. It depends on the number of bags she produces, that is why Muranha is hoping so much to earn loan to increase the capital for her business that will enable her to increase the number of bags produced.

Translated form Indonesian by Hestyana, Kiva volunteer.

Muranha saat ini tinggal disebuah rumah sederhana yang hanya memiliki satu kamar yang dipakai sebagai kamar tidur. Dia tinggal bersama suaminya. Semua anaknya sudah menikah dan sudah memiliki usaha sendiri. Rumahnya sekarang juga merupakan romah kontrakan, bukan milik sendiri. Didepan rumahnya ada teras yang dipakai sebagai tempat usaha. Sehari-harinya Murahna bekerja sebagai penjahit tas. Tas yang sudah selesai dijahit kemudian dibawa ke art shop yang sudah memesan terlebih dahulu. Karena bahan untuk membuat tas dan pernak-perniknya dari uangnya sendiri, Murahna merasa sangat keberatan. Padahal keuntungan yang didapat cukup banyk tergantung banyaknya jumlah tas yang dihasilkan. Oleh karena itu, Murahna sanagt mengharapkan bantuan modal untuk bisa melanjutkan usahanya.

loans.use: To increase capital

loans.name: Anatou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Anatou Y. was born January 14th, 1971 in Lomé. She is a retailer of basic goods and is married to Mr. Katchirikou TCHAGODOMOU who is a taxi driver. They have four children who are attending school. On her shelves one can find rice, oil, and tomatoes. This first loan she is seeking will allow her to purchase one bag of rice, two drums of oil, and two cartons of tomatoes.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

Madame Y. Anatou est née le 14 janvier 1971 à Lomé. Elle est revendeuse de produits de premières nécessités et s’est mariée à Monsieur TCHAGODOMOU Katchirikou qui est un chauffeur de taxis. Ils ont 4 enfants qui vont à l’école. Sur son étalage, on peut trouver du riz, d’huile, tomate. Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 1 sac de riz, 2 bidons et 2 cartons de tomates.

loans.use: Purchase of basic goods merchandise

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: Sim V. S., 29, raises pigs in Siem Reap and typically makes US$5 each day in a business he has run for the last 3 years. His wife, Choo Sareth, takes care of their three children at home. They have been looking for ways to expand their business to increase their income. Inflation has been very high over the past year and gas prices have affected many people in Cambodia. Sim V. S. has asked for a loan of US$1000 to purchase a motorbike to use for his business transportation. He would like to have easy access to the local markets, in order that he may reach his customers effectively. Sim believes his income can greatly increase and his standard of living can be improved through this investment. He is grateful for the opportunity that this loan would provide to help support his family and he looks forward to the results.

loans.use: Purchase a motorbike for business transportation

loans.name: Fadila's T.c.a Group

texts.en:
Fadila is a married woman with three children aged between 18 and 28. She also takes care of five other children aged between 16 and 8 years old. She became a food seller in 2003. Every day, she works from 6.30 AM to 9 PM at her business and she can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

Fadila now hopes for a loan to buy more rice, maize flour, meat, vegetables and bananas for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members. One runs a salon and the other is a shopkeeper.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Văn Hai's Group

texts.vi:
anh Nguyễn văn Hải Ms 13050033 năm nay anh 31 tuổi, hiện nay gia đình anh có 2 con nhỏ và đang đi học. Vợ anh ở nhà chăn nuôi, còn anh mở cửa hàng bán phân đạm và thuốc trừ sâu, nên mức thu nhập của gia đình anh cũng khá ổn định từ 180.000 VND đến 200.000 VND / ngày. Anh rất thích tham gia vay vốn của Bình Minh cdc, vì vay hình thức này giúp vợ chồng anh tích luỹ được tiền cho tương lai. Đồng thời vợ chồng anh lại được trả dần, anh đăng ký vay 3.186.000 VND để đầu tư vào cửa hàng phân đạm của gia đình. Trong nhóm anh có các thành viên sau :

  • chị Đào thị Hà Ms 13050032 vay mức 3.186.000 VND để tráng bánh đa nem
  • chị Nguyễn thị Nhàn Ms 13050034 vay mức 2.006.000 VND để bán hàng tại nhà
  • anh Tô văn Hồng Ms 13050035 vay mức 3.186.000 VND để kinh doanh
  • anh Đặng văn Chợ Ms 13050036 vay mức 3.186.000 VND để tráng bánh đa nem
  • anh Trần văn Quế Ms 13050037 vay mức 2.950.000 VND để chăn nuôi .
texts.en:
Mr. Hai Van Nguyen, 31 years old, has two small children who are going to school. His wife stays at home to take care of the children, and he runs a store selling fertilizer and insecticide, so their income is relatively stable at 180,000 VND to 200,000 VND per day. He really enjoys participating in the Binh Minh Fund because this form of funding helps the couple save money for their family's future. At the same time, the fund allows the couple to repay gradually. He is requesting 3,186,000 VND to invest in his fertilizer business. His group also includes the following participants:

  • Mrs. Ha Thi Dao, requesting 3,186,000 VND to make rice wrappers.
  • Mrs. Nhan Thi Nguyen, requesting 2,006,000 VND to do retail sales out of her home.
  • Mr. Hong Van To, requesting 3,186,000 VND to invest in a business.
  • Mr. Cho Van Dang, requesting 3,186,000 VND to make rice wrappers.
  • Mr. Que Van Tran, requesting 2,950,000 VND to raise livestock.

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To create capital for various businesses such as making rice wrappers, fertilizer store, and raising livestock

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en:
Bridget U. sells clothing materials for making suits and school uniforms. She has been selling clothing materials for a long time. Bridget is 49 years old and married with 8 children. During the holidays, her children assist her in the sale of clothing materials. She and her family live in Lagos state. 

Bridget hopes for the loan amount of $850 to purchase more clothing materials so that she can provide supplies to schools for uniform making. "l sell in cash, therefore repayment will not pose a problem to me," says Bridget. She says "thank you" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more clothing materials to sell

loans.name: Mosi's Group

texts.en:
Mosi Shaaban has owned a restaurant in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for three years. She works for 12 hours every day and earns a profit of approximately $155 each month. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food for her restaurant. If this loan helps her expand and improve her business, she intends to use the increased profits to pay for her children's school fees and improve her home.

Mosi is 45 years old, married, and has seven children. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Haiba, who has a small business selling vegetables in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more food for her restaurant

loans.name: Sokhon

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhon C. is a villager in Preak Ta Tin village in Kandal Province. She is 50 years old and the mother of two children; one is a weaver and the other attends the local school. She and her husband, Mr. Mang Sophal, are farmers who own a piece of land where they cultivate vegetables to earn their living. They face some problems because they do not have vegetable seeds to plant, and their field is not sufficiently fertile. In order to solve these problems, Mrs. Sokhon C. decided to ask for a loan to buy vegetable seeds and fertilizers; she will use the rest of the loan to add to her savings to buy a pump to irrigate her field. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seeds, fertilizers, and a pump.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret M. is 28 years old and married. She is the mother of three children; the two older ones are in school and the youngest is still breastfeeding. She lives in the village of Edubiase, a suburb of Obuasi. The area is Ghana's source of minerals such as gold.

Margaret sells doughnuts and fried yams in her village. She fries doughnuts in the morning and yams in the afternoon, selling the fried yams with fish and pepper. Margaret's good taste in food has attracted lots of customers, who buy her food in the afternoon.

Margaret treks to farming communities to buy her stock of yams directly from the farmers. This saves her from middlemen who buy from the farmers and resell the produce at higher prices. She plans to use this loan to buy yams, flour, sugar, and margarine in bulk so she can continue to meet the daily demands of her customers. She hopes to save enough of her income to afford a good education for her children.

Margaret is a member of the community group Obatanpa Trust Group ("Obatanpa" means "good mother"). In this group, members support one another and guarantee each other's loans. She does not sell on group meeting days, so her picture was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, and margarine for her food business

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Mrs. Hong H. lives in Chey Reang village in Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because her field is infertile. In order to deal with this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer to amend the field to make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. But Boeun, is a laborer who gets hired by the villagers to plow their fields. Mrs. Hong H. is 42 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is a pig breeder while the others are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer  to make her crop more productive

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth G. has been selling plastic chairs, carpets, and building materials for about two years now at the Nyankumasi Market near Cape Coast. Elizabeth has received a senior high education. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a baker. Elizabeth is responsible for financially supporting her husband with the rent, utility bills, and the other basic expenses of the family. Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy more plastic chairs, carpets, and building materials. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back for the expansion of her trade items.

loans.use: To buy more plastic chairs, carpets, and building materials to sell

loans.name: Nara

texts.en:
Ms. Rana N. (picture with her mother), 37, is single and lives with her widowed mother. She has six brothers and sisters. The family lives along National Road Number One, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia.

Rana has been a primary school teacher in her village for six years. Besides being a teacher, she is a tailor as well. Her mother is a rice farmer. Rna is requesting her first loan of $700 to purchase a sewing machine to build her tailoring shop.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine to build her tailoring shop.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita M. is a 32 year old mother of two. Her husband drives a tricycle taxi (motorcycle with sidecar). His income alone isn’t enough to support the family, so Julita helps by raising pigs.

Julita is applying for a loan to establish a business buying and reselling palay (rice grains). She wants to increase their income. She dreams of expanding her business in the future into an agricultural supply store with a transport vehicle. She looks forward to building a better house, reclaiming their pawned items, and most of all, sending their children to college.

loans.use: To buy and resell palay (rice grains).

loans.name: Sin

texts.en:
Sin N., 55, is a humble widower with five children, two married and living separately, the other three single and employed. One of Mr. N.'s daughters, Ms. Chanthu, 25, is a goldsmith and provides income to help support the family. The family lives in Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia. 

Sin, a military policeman in the village, is requesting a loan to build a kitchen to make the family's cooking easier. This addition will significantly improve the family’s standard of living. 

Mr. N.'s daughter is shown in the picture.

loans.use: To build a kitchen.

loans.name: Nelsa Abigail

texts.es: La señora Nelsa Abigail M., tiene la edad de 58 años de edad habita en el barrio Esquípulas en la capital de Managua, esta señora es soltera no tiene hijos pero tiene a su cargo a su papá y a un sobrino que su hermana le dejo a su cargo ya que falleció hace mucho tiempo, el joven de 14 años  después que llega de clases le ayuda con el negocio ya que ella le entrega y vende comida desde hace cinco años , los sueños de esta señora es llegar a tener un comedor, este es su segundo ciclo en Afodenic el cual va invertir en  comprar  insumos y granos básicos para hacer mas alimentos ya que ahora la buscaron para entregar comida a la iglesia de Ticuantepe al personal que labora en la tienda, y ella no cuenta con muchos recursos para poder cumplir con sus encargos. Y brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nelsa Abigail M. is 58 years old, lives in the Esquípulas neighborhood in Managua, and is single and without children, but is responsible for her father and a nephew, as her sister passed away a long time ago. Once home from school, the 14 year old boy helps her out with her business of 5 years, which is food sales and delivery. Her dream is to have a dining room. This is her second loan cycle with Afodenic, which she will use to invest in the purchase of supplies and grains to cook more food, as she’s been asked by the church in Ticuantepec to deliver food to the personnel working in the shop and currently doesn’t have the funds to meet the demand and provide her customers with better service.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grains, meats and other supplies to cook delicious meals

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa K. is forty–nine years old and divorced with four children, all of whom are daughters. Some are in senior high while others are in junior high school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. Kofiase is a farming and trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region.

Theresa is a trader. She trades in textiles – printed and designed fabrics. She also deals in children’s wear, dressing bags and ready-made apparel. She hawks to sell and also treks to other towns to sell. Theresa purchases her textiles and clothing products from Dormaa, the district capital. She has been in business for twelve years and wants a loan to buy textiles in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy textiles in bulk

loans.name: Martha Rosa

texts.es: La señora Martha Rosa R. tiene la edad de 47 años, habita en el barrio las Conchitas, junto a su esposo el cual trabaja para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar, ellos tienes siete hijos de los cuales tres ya son casado y cuatros que están a su cargo, los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida, desde hace 8 años doña Martha se dedica a la agricultura la mayor afectación ha sido por las plagas que afectan al cultivo por falta de fertilizantes e insumos. Con el financiamiento obtenido va a comprar los insumos necesarios para tener una mejor producción y vender a mejor precio en el mercado
texts.en:
Ms. Martha is 47 years old and lives in the Conchitas neighborhood with her husband. Her husband works to help her with household costs. They have seven children, of which three are married and four are still supported by them. Their plan for the future is to improve their living conditions.

For the past 8 years, Martha has worked in agriculture. Her worst problem has been with pests affecting her crops because of a lack of fertilizers and agricultural supplies. With this loan she will purchase agricultural supplies to improve production and sell at higher prices in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies and fertilizers for crops

loans.name: Fadiaye

texts.fr: fadiaye S. habite a camberene et est parent beneficiaire.elle est commercante de chaussures de bijoux plaques or et divers autres articles pour femmes.elle a cinq ans d'experiences dans cette activite'et souhaite augmenter le nombre de clientele et conquerir d'autres marches.
texts.en:
Fadiaye S. lives in Camberene and is a client parent. She is a merchant of shoes, gold-plated jewelry, and various other items for women. She has five years of experience in this business and wishes to increase her number of customers and to conquer other markets.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Ni Ketut Sumarti

texts.en: Ni Ketut Sumarti (DNR.M-0575) is a 39-year-old female living in the town of Desa Perancak, Negara. She is married and has two school-aged children. Ni Ketut Sumarti owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately 200,000 IDR a month. In 2008, Ni Ketut Sumarti joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 4,125,000 IDR which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. The loan will be her first from DINARI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About DINARI: The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Ni Ketut Sumarti - (DNR.M-0575) merupakan 39 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Desa Perancak - Negara. Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 2 anak usia sekolah. Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Ketut Sumarti memiliki & menjalankan usaha. Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian. Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak. Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Ni Ketut Sumarti sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 6 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Ketut Sumarti menghasilkan sekitar 200,000 IDR sebulan. Dalam 2008, Ni Ketut Sumarti bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Ketut Sumarti telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya dari DINARI. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 4,125,000 IDR. Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli bibit ternak untuk dibesarkan & dijual di masa mendatang. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. Ni Ketut Sumarti berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis untuk mendukung keuangan anggota keluarga langsung peminjam. Tentang DINARI: Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil. *Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Theopista

texts.en:
Theopista is a member of the Amani East borrower group in Kinyanambo, Iringa. She is a 30-year-old single woman and she cares for one dependent.

Theopista started her own restaurant business selling food two years ago. She works 15 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 100,000 Tanzania Shillings.

This is Theopista’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 150,000 Tsh in order to buy more rice, wheat and sugar to her business. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Theopista hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities

loans.name: Alberto Ramon

texts.es: Alberto Ramón está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 6to crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (Construcción de una habitación), trabaja como docente en la escuela César Augusto Salinas Pinell desde hace 20 años, tiene 2 hijos: la mayor de 14 años estudia 1 er  año de Educación Secundaria y el menor de 10 años estudia 5to grado de Educación primaria, su esposa se encarga  de los quehaceres del hogar,  Alberto es un hombre honesto, trabajador y muy humilde, vive en la zona # 7 de Nueva Guinea donde la población cada dia crece mas, manifiesta que se siente agradecido con AFODENIC ya con los 5 créditos obtenidos por la institución ha mejorado su vivienda y ha comprado electrodomésticos con los cuales ha mejorado las condiciones de vida de el y su familia, su sueño es que sus hijos estudien, tener salud,  estabilidad laboral para así ayudar a su familia.

loans.use: Construccion de una habitacion

loans.name: Aura Elena

texts.es: Aura Elena R. tiene 50 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos y trabajan de manera independiente. La actividad económica a la que se dedicada es a la venta de mercadería en general. Ella  inicia en este rubro siendo una madre abandonada pero que con mucho valor decidió enfrentar su situación e invirtió unos ahorros que tenía. De esta manera pudo hacer clientela quienes le compraban al contado y al crédito, al principio fue un poco difícil, pues sus niños estaban pequeños y ella no tenia clientes fijos por lo que tenía que caminar largos trechos para conseguirlos. Ella nunca opto por dejar a sus hijos, ya que siempre ha sido una madre muy responsable y cuidadosa, gracias a Dios ella ha podido enfrentar todo lo que ha su vida se ha aproximado. Ella desea un financiamiento para invertir en su capital de trabajo donde el inventario de más urgencia que necesita son: zapatos, cosméticos, pantalones, ropa para niños, perfumes, entre otras.
texts.en:
Aura Elena R. is 50 years old, has 3 children, and works independently. She sells general merchandise. She began in this line of work when she was an abandoned mother, but, with much bravery, she decided to face her situation and invested some savings that she had. In this way, she obtained customers who purchased with cash or credit. At the beginning, it was somewhat difficult because her children were young and she did not have steady customers. She had to walk long distances to win customers. She never chose to leave her children. She has always been a very responsible and caring mother. Thanks to God, she has been able to face everything that has come to her. She wants a loan to invest in her business; her most urgent inventory needs are for shoes, cosmetics, pants, children's clothes, and perfumes, among other things.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: business capital

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy N. is 47 years old and a mother of nine children - of which, two are in high school, one is in grade school and the rest are grown. She is married to Reynaldo N., a 52 year-old farmer. Daisy, together with her husband, work hard to earn and provide for the future of her children. The family lives in the village of Sto. Cagay, Brgy. Su-ay, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental.

Daisy joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1991 and testifies that it was through NWTF-Project Dungganon that she has achieved some of her dreams - to be able to send her children to school, have her own business to supplement the income that her husband earns as a farmer, and to have some savings for the future.

She started her business by selling fruits (bananas, etc.), which were delivered by a wholesaler, to their neighbors from a stand set up outside her house. Later, she expanded her product offerings, including groceries and other commodities. Additionally, she raised pigs in her backyard. Her business activities earned about PHP 8,000 per month, which was significant in helping to improve her family's quality of life.

Her previous 8th cycle loan amounting to PHP 14,000. She paid back the loan in full and on-time without any delays in any of the weekly installments. She is now borrowing PHP 16,000 for her 9th cycle loan. She plans to use the money as revolving capital to offer more products in her "sari-sari", also known as a "general store". She intends to use the profits from this loan cycle to pay for her children's tuition and to provide them with their daily allowance.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To have revolving capital for her general store

loans.name: Chhoeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Chhoeurn S. is a villager in Trapaing Chrey village in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder. Since her breeding pigs business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more fifteen piglets and pig food for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Meas Seng, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Chhoeurn S. is 61 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is a track driver while the others are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more fifteen piglets and pig food for breeding.

loans.name: Yinka

texts.en:
Yinka is forty years old and married with three children. She is a tailor and also sells sarongs in the market. She has been in business for the past nine years.

Yinka is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce A., a married mother of three children, has a  junior high school background and has been selling second-hand clothes at Elmina as a hawker  since 2000. Her husband interprets at the court.  Joyce uses her income to support him in the payment of school fees and utility bills and will use the loan to purchase a bale of second-hand clothes for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of second-hand clothes for sale.

loans.name: Maria Asuncion

texts.es:
La señora María Asunción L.  es una socia activa  del banco comunal Nuevo Porvenir desde hace diez años, éste banco está situado en la parroquia Cumbe al suroeste de la ciudad de Cuenca,  este lugar se caracteriza por los finos tejidos que se elaboran ahí,  el nombre original de esta localidad es Cumbipirca que proviene del quechua “Cumbi o Chumbi “que significa tejido fino y “ Pirca” pared,  nuestra socia vive en la comunidad San Capa en la parroquia Cumbe, tiene 64 años está casada y procreó ocho hijos, no recuerda la edad de todos ellos, pero sí que seis de ellos ya son  casados,  su casa es propia y vive con su esposo que está enfermo  y sus dos hijos menores de 18 y 15 años,  debido a su situación económica no pueden estudiar y solo trabajan cuando un conocido les emplea temporalmente. 

María se dedica a la crianza de pollos, cuyes y chanchos que los vende en las ferias de la localidad, también cultiva hortalizas tanto para el consumo en su casa como para la venta a sus vecinas y ferias del sector.

Con el préstamo solicitado a la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR  va a comprar crías de pollos, chanchos y borregos  para incrementar su criadero de animales.

El sueño de María  es incrementar poco a poco su negocio que es su sustento diario.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Asuncion L. has been an active member of the Village Bank "Nuevo Porvenir" for the past ten years. This bank is located in the Cumbe parish in the southeast part of the city of Cuenca. This region is known for the fine textiles made here, its original name was Cumbipirca which is a combination of the Quecha words cumbi or chumbi, meaning beautiful textiles and pirca, meaning wall. Maria lives in the community San Capa in the Cumbe parish, she is 64 years old and married with eight children. She can't remember all of their ages, but six of them are now married. She owns her own home and lives with her ailing husband and their two youngest children, aged 18 and 15. Because of her economic situation they haven't been able to go to school and they can only work when a family friend can hire them temporarily. Maria works raising chickens, guinea pigs, and hogs which she sells in the local markets. She also grows vegetables for home consumption and for sale to neighbours and markets. With the loan requested from Fundacion Espoir, she will buy chicks, guinea pigs and lambs to increase her animal raising business. Her dream is to increase her business little by little in order to better earn her living.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chicks, guinea pigs and lambs

loans.name: Erico

texts.en:
Erico is 29 years old, married, and has one child. He has been working as a vendor since 2005, when he started selling clothing such as shirts, blouses, jeans, shorts, Capri pants and skirts. Erico started with a clientele of only twenty and currently has over three hundred customers.

Erico’s business has a very high turnover rate, so constantly requires further investment in order to grow. He will use this loan to buy shorts and Capri pants, which are currently in very high demand by his customers, as summer is just starting.

After satisfying his customers’ demands, Erico hopes to use the remainder of his stock to open another store in a different part of town.

loans.use: To buy shorts and Capri pants

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing A. sells sarongs in the market in Warri, Delta State. Nigeria. She is a focused, hard working woman who puts in long hours trying to keep her business sustainable.  Blessing is 32 years old and married with a child. She is a LAPO client. The Lift Above Poverty Organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. Blessing has been in this business for a long time. She is requesting  a loan of 80,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
El Sr. Antonio G. es trabajador del centro de insumos para la salud en el departamento de seguridad.
Antonio  va usar el crédito para comprar cemento, arena y piedrín para la construcción de una pared en unos de los cuartos de la casa por lo que antes era cerrado con madera.
Quiere construir esa pared para que los niños puedan tener más seguridad.
El es casado y padre de dos hijos los que a la vez se encuentran en edad escolar.
Este es el segundo crédito que Antonio ha tenido con CEPRODEL. Ha trabajado con ceprodel 2 años.
Antonio dijo que sus créditos con Ceprodel le han ayudado mucho por lo que ha mejorado su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Sr. Antonio G. is a labourer at the centre for health supplies in the Department of Security. He plans to use the loan to buy cement, sand, and stone to build walls for some of the rooms of his house. Formerly they were made of wood. Antonio wants to build the walls to provide greater safety for his children. He is married and has two school-aged children. This is his second loan with Kiva partner CEPRODEL, and he has worked with them for two years. He commented that his loans with Ceprodel have helped him greatly to improve his house.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cement, stone, and sand

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Resupplying her store with beverages

loans.name: Pech

texts.en:
Mrs. Pech R. is 35 years old and lives in Roka village in Kandal province. She is a sewer in the local village and her husband, Mr. Cheang Choeun, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which he cultivates rice to support his family. Besides this he is also a construction laborer.

In the rice field he has some problems because it has infertile soil and they do not have money to support it. Thus, Mrs. Pech R. decided to apply for a loan to buy fertilizer and fuel. With the rest of the loan she wants to buy five piglets to raise.

Mrs. Pech R. is the mother of four children who are attending the local public school. Her husband is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and fuel plus five poglets to raise

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn M. is 39 years old, married, has eight children, and lives in the province of Rizal with her husband Ronnie. To supply additional income for her family, Jocelyn has spent the last five years raising hogs. Her husband is an electrician and works closely with her.

Jocelyn would like to obtain a loan to pay for more piglets, vitamins, and feed. Buying these items, she believes, will allow her to increase her monthly income.  Since 2005, she has been a proud member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines. Jocelyn has been a devoted advocate, regularly attending weekly meetings and making on-time payments for previous loans.

Her long-term goals are to expand her business and educate all eight of her children. She also dreams of enjoying a brighter tomorrow and a higher standard of living. 

About ASHI: Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) is the oldest example of the Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the poorest people in the Philippines.

loans.use: To buy additional piglets, vitamins, and feeds.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia R. runs a sari sari store selling a variety of different products in her community. She is a 39-year-old woman living in the town of Brgy. Narawis, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She is married and has four school-age children. Lucia has been in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2004, Lucia joined NWTF to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Lucia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from NWTF. Lucia is now requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 11th loan from NWTF. Lucia plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of – not just a few – but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day to realities surpassing their dreams. They have learned to live a life which can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To purchase additional product to sell

loans.name: Las Morlaquitas (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Cuenca se unió un grupo de mujeres emprendedoras y decididas a sacar adelante a su familia y fundaron El Banco Comunal Las  Morlaquitas ubicado en la ciudad de Cuenca en la región centro sur del país, gozando de un clima frio propicio para  el cultivo de legumbres, frutas y maíz, también se caracteriza por la variedad de comida típica como las carnes asadas, cuyes y otras delicias propias de la región.En esta ocasión nos acompaña Deysi Ureña la promotora de crédito de éste banco, ella viste de café, tiene lentes y esta detrás  de la socia de rojo.
 
 La señora Silvia Arévalo vive en la casa de su esposo  en el sector Cristo del Consuelo  con sus dos hijos aun pequeños de siete años y 5 meses de nacido, su esposo se radico hace 20 años en el extranjero y como ya  tienen todos los papeles en regla viene cada cuatro meses a ver a su familia, nuestra socia tienen 28 años y es chofer profesional, conduce una camioneta de transporte escolar hace seis años, tiene dos recorridos el uno inicia a las 5 a.m. hasta las 8 a.m. en éste lleva niños de una escuela de la ciudad y el otro  es de 12 a.m. a 1p.m. con jóvenes de un colegio también de su localidad, estas actividades las comparte con los  quehaceres del hogar, el cuidado de sus hijos y los momentos libres teje carteras de nylon arte que aprendió hace diez años gracias a sus habilidades e imaginación.
  
Se encuentra en su segundo ciclo en la fundación motivada por una amiga  miembro del  bankito, con el dinero de su préstamo va a invertir en su auto en la compra de algunos repuestos y llantas y también para comprar nylon para seguir realizando sus carteras. Tiene como  meta comparase un auto pequeño para salir los fines de semana con sus hijos.

 María  Angeles M. es  otra de las socias del banco comunal Las Morlaquitas,  vive con cuatro de los seis hijos que concibió pues dos son casados y viven independientes, las edades oscilan entre los 33 y 14 años, solo su hijo menor aún estudia en un colegio nocturno y la mañana le ayuda en casa, todos sus hijos trabajan y le ayudan a solventar los gastos del hogar ya que ella tiene 51 años y está separada hace quince de su esposo.

Nuestra socia María Angeles labora 31 años en el mercado vendiendo frutas y hortalizas en su puesto  los días miércoles, sábados y domingos y los otros días lo hace en otro mercado recorriendo la P. para vender todo con un  horario de 6 a.m. a 7 p.m. esta actividad le ha permitido salir adelante con toda su familia.  Este es su primer crédito en la fundación y fue invitada por su nuera, con el dinero que obtenga comprará naranjas, naranjillas, melones, papayas, acelga, apio, zanahoria, cebolla, tomate y mas frutas y  hortalizas para surtir su negocio.

Su sueño es llegar a tener su casa propia que aún no la tiene.
texts.en:
In the city of Cuenca a group of enterprising and determined women united to advance their families, founding Las Morlaquitas Comunal Bank. It is located in Cuenca in the central south region of the country, enjoying a cold climate, appropriate for cultivation of vegetables, fruit and corn. It is also characterized by its variety of typical food, such as roast pork, guinea pig, and other delicacies of the region. On this occasion, we were accompanied by Deysi Ureña, the bank's credit promoter. In the photo she is wearing brown, has glasses, and is behind the member in red. Mrs. Silvia lives in her husband's house in the Cristo del Consuelo (Christ of Consolation) sector with her 2 children who are still small (7 years old and 5 months since birth). Her husband has resided abroad for 20 years and, now that he has his papers in order, he visits his family every 4 months. She is 28 years old and is a professional driver, who has been driving a school transport van for 6 years. She has 2 routes, one from 5:00 am until 8:00 am in which she brings young people to a school in the city, and the other from 12:00 am to 1:00 pm, with young people from a school in her locality. These activities she combines with household responsibilities, caring for her children, and in her free time, she makes artistic nylon purses, which she learned how to do 10 years ago, thanks to her abilities and imagination. She is in her 2nd loan cycle with the foundation, motivated by a friend and member of the little bank. With this loan she will invest in her vehicle, buying some replacement parts and tires and, also, buy nylon to continue making purses. Her goal is to buy a small auto to get away with her children on weekends. María Angeles is another member of the Las Morlaquitas bank. She lives with 4 of her 6 children, since 2 are married and living independently. Their ages are between 33 and 14. Only her youngest son still studies at night school and mornings he helps her in the house. All her children work and help to pay household expenses, since she is 51 and separated for 15 years from her husband. María has worked for 31 years in the market selling fruits and vegetables in her stall on Wednesdays, Saturdays, and Sundays. On other days, she does the same in another market, circulating in the P. selling everything between 6:00 am and 7:00 pm. This activity has permitted her family to get ahead. This is her first loan with the institution. She was invited to join by her daughter-in-law. With the funds she will buy citrus, melons, papayas, salt-wort, chicory, carrots, onions, tomatoes, and more fruits and vegetables to resupply her business. Her dream is to have a house which she still lacks.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING TIRES, VEHICLE PARTS, NYLON FOR PURSES, AND FRUITS AND VEGETABLES FOR HER BUSINESS

loans.name: Alaxpacha Group

texts.es:
“Alaxpacha”  es un grupo de 8 señoras  que asisten a sus reuniones en el Centro Focal “Villa Tejada”,  este es su segundo ciclo y se agruparon hace poco por  la necesidad de acceder al préstamo ya que todas necesitan incrementar su capital de trabajo. Todas tienen diversos negocios como la venta de deportivos, jugos, artesanía de caretas de santos, producción de calzados ,confección de ropa de bebe y carnicería.
Un ejemplo claro es Cristina Gregorio P. de 42 años casada, hace un tiempo atrás, con trabajo y esfuerzo  logro instalar en su domicilio una tienda de venta de carne, mejor conocida como  “carnicería”, ella vende todos los días y tiene clientes frecuentes. Cristina necesita el préstamo para comprar su producto “carne”.
texts.en:
Alaxpacha is a group of eight women who have their meetings in the “Villa Focal” regional office of Pro Mujer. This is their second loan cycle, and they got together recently to approve this loan, as all of them need to increase their working capital. The members of Alaxpacha have various businesses such as sales of sports wear, juices, handmade masks of saints, shoemaking, making of baby clothes, and meat sales. An example is Cristina Gregorio P., 42. Some time ago, with much work and effort, she managed to put a meat sales business in her house. She sells every day and has regular customers. She needs this loan to buy meat to sell.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Juan Oswaldo

texts.es:
Oswaldo forma parte del banco comunal “MI PERU”,  tiene 41 años y tiene una hija llamada Marcela. Su principal actividad económica es la transformación agro industria como por ejemplo  yogurt  y la elaboración de dulces de níspero y dulce de durazno, él vende los sábados y domingos en la feria de la plaza “Túpac Amaru” de la ciudad del Cusco, 


Oswaldo es una persona, responsable y emprendedor que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario ayudar a su familia. Oswaldo requiere el préstamo para comprar frutas de los mayoristas y azúcar. El anhelo del socio es elaborar productos a base de Kiwicha y luego exportarlos.    

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente.
texts.en:
Oswaldo is a member of the communal bank "Mi Peru." He's 41 years old and has a daughter named Marcela. His main business activity is agro-business occupation is transformation, as for example making yogurt and the production of rare fruit sweets and peach sweets, which he sells on Saturdays and Sundays in the marketplace in the plaza "Tupac Amaru" in the city of Cusco. Oswaldo is a responsible and enterprising person who is looking every moment for opportunities to move forward, with his daily efforts to help his family. Oswaldo wants a loan to buy wholesale fruits and sugar. His partnership wants to develop products based on Amaranth and then export them. He is very grateful for the opportunity afforded to him this way and he promises to complete payment in full.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wholesale fruits and sugar

loans.name: David

texts.en: David, who is 26 years old, has been selling water for a living for the past three years.  He is also employed in a construction company.  Since he joined a group called Negeu in Faulu Kenya, David has been able to save his money on a weekly basis, a development that has enabled him to increase his stock regularly, thereby improving the business.  He has requested a loan of Kes. 20,000 to buy mineral water for sale, hoping to become a wholesale distributor in the future.  For this reason, he strives to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy mineral water for sale

loans.name: Nangali Mwajuma Kirunda Group

texts.en: Mwajuma K. is a hardworking business woman of fifty years old. She is married and has two children. One child is in schooling. She is looking after five dependents (orphans) who are also in schooling. She has been running a restaurant business for twenty years so far. She is using the loan to purchase a variety of food (bananas, posho, sweet potatoes, beans, meat, chicken, cassava, and so forth) and other requirements, like charcoal and so forth, for her restaurant business. She is an encouraging business woman whose dreams are to purchase a car, educate her children and to construct rental houses.

loans.use: To purchase variety of food and other requirements for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Awadhi

texts.en:
Awadhi is a married woman with a young child. She has been operating her charcoal business for one year and sells at all levels - as wholesale, retail, door to door, and from home to her neighbors and food vendors. With the 30,000 KES she wants to buy five sacks of charcoal. Her husband works as a driver and he supports the family financially.

Awadhi hopes to be the main supplier in the entire market in the future and to have three more branches. Her greatest monthly expense is food. She owns a home with electricity but no piped water. She decided to work with Yehu so as to get a loan and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy five sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Tsend-Ayush

texts.en: Tsend-Ayush L. lives with his wife in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in Hovd province, western Mongolia. He started his welding business in 1995. With his profits from the business, he has purchased a plot of land for his family and has built a house for his son as well. He has gained much experience over the years in this business. In the future, he hopes one day to start his own factory where he can produce a variety of welding items. Tsend-Ayush is a hard-working, neat and open-hearted man who is requesting a 1,700,000 MNT loan to create his own workplace.

loans.use: To create his own workplace

loans.name: Chorn

texts.en: In Serei Duoch village in Takeo province has a person, Mrs. Chorn T. was born in 1946. She is a farmer who owns two-hectare plot land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family while her husband, Mr. Son Svay, is a village chief who gets low salary to support his family. This day she has some problem because her field is infertile soil. So to improve her face production, Mrs. Chorn T. is seeking for a loan to buy fertilizer and rest of the loan she buys forty chickens. Through this activity they support four children, one of whom is a chauffeur, another is a security guard, while the other one is a construction worker, and the other is attending in local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Cecerna

texts.en:
Cecerna R. is from the village of Poblacion, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 49 years old. Cecerna is married and has 8 school-aged children. To make a living, Cecerna owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Cecerna has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Cecerna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cecerna is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Cecerna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Ciciliah

texts.en:
Ciciliah has a mixed farm in Kisii town, Western Kenya, which produces maize, beans, millet, vegetables, bananas, coffee, tea leaves, and milk.  She sells her products to Kenya Tea Development Authority, the Coffee board of Kenya, and at the local market. She also runs a kiosk as her other source of income.

Ciciliah is 40 years old, married and a mother of five children who are all adults. Three of the children attend school. 

Ciciliah recently completed her previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo and has requested this loan of 70,000 Kenyan Shillings to expand her poultry farming and lease more land for vegetable farming. She hopes her business will do well and that she will be able to educate her children through college level and provide for their basic needs with the extra income from this loan.

In five years' time, she plans to expand her farming business and venture into new markets and start a second-hand clothes business. She however faces the challenges of transportation and fluctuating weather patterns that affect her production.  She appreciates and appeals to Juhudi to consider giving them the interest on savings instead of adding to shares.

loans.use: To expand her poultry farming and lease more land for vegetable farming

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with two children of whom one attends school and the other is still too young for school. Her husband is a businessman and he contributes to the family budget. She has been operating her business of selling second-hand clothes for the last seven months, selling to adults from door-to-door. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants start a vegetable stall, to purchase a sack of green vegetables and fruit. Her major challenge in the business is seasonality. She hopes to start a bigger vegetable stall in future. Her major aim in working with Yehu is to get financial assistance and educate her children. She rents a house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

loans.use: To purchase a sack of green vegetables and fruit

loans.name: Sek's Group

texts.en:
Sek S. is the leader of a group loan located in Kaoh Krabei village, Kandal province.  She earns a living by sells Khmer cakes and flour.  Her husband is a farmer.
 
In order to increase their income, to improve their family, Sek decided to ask for a loan to buy more flour to resell.  They have three children: two are seamstresses in a garment factory and the other is a student who also helps staff the businesses.

loans.use: Buy more flour to resell.

loans.name: Viola

texts.en: Viola N. is currently in the business of selling oil, rice and sugar and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of rice and sugar to sell. Viola is 22 years old and is married. Her husband is a business man. She has three children and two of her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a shop.

loans.use: To stock more bags of rice and sugar to sell

loans.name: Dania Del Carmen

texts.es:
El Sra. Denia del Carmen A. Treminio. Es originario de la ciudad de león actualmente se desempeña como maestra de educación primaria en Santa Rosa del Peñón en el colegio Riben Darío donde tiene 4 años de laborar. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel para mejorar su vivienda. El crédito lo solicitó para la compra de Sin y perlin. Con el objetivo de Construir su vivienda.
Esta señor su objetivo es plenamente dedicado a mejorar su hogar.
Esto le permitirá llegar a construir su propia casa de habitación donde mejorara el bien estar de su familia
texts.en:
Mrs. Denia del Carmen A. T.is originally from the city of Leon but now she works as a primary school teacher in Santa Rosa del 
Peñón, in the Riben Darío school. She has worked there for 4 years. 

This is the first loan she has requested from Ceprodel and it is to improve her home. She would like to buy zinc and other materials in order build a home. This way she will be able to build her own home which will improve the well-being of her family.

loans.use: To buy zinc and roofing materials

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina P. is from the village of Looc Proper, Plaridel, in the province of Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old, is married, and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Lina owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of products in the local community. Lina has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2000, Lina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. Lina is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her third loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and have working capital

loans.name: Raya

texts.en:
Raya T. is a single mother of a ten-year-old girl. She was born into a large family of teachers and was always eager to study, but unfortunately, she couldn’t continue her studies because she needed to help her parents to earn a living. Raya started to sell garden stuff at the local market and opened a sales location there. In 1998, in order to find a better place to live, she moved to Belovodskoe village where she continued her business in sales. Raya decided to sell ware and detergents and, owing to her wide experience in this activity, achieved success. With the revenues, she was able to buy a flat which was reconstructed as a grocery store. She bought goods and resold them by herself, without any help. Her shop became known for the good quality of the products and attentive customer service.
Now Raya wants to take a loan of 60,000 KGS to broaden the assortment of goods in her shop. It will allow her to raise floating capital and increase her number of customers. Raya believes that her optimistic spirit and perseverance in her business will help her to improve her family’s lives.

About Bai-Tushum and Partners
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To broaden her assortment of goods

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan Carlos tiene 27 años y reside junto a su esposa con sus 2 hijos. El se dedica a la venta de granos básicos. Allí le pone al alcance de la mano de sus clientes todo tipo de productos de uso diario por los cuales tendrían que dirigirse hacia el pueblo. El negocio goza de muy buena acogida ya que el siempre trata a sus clientes de modo amable y les ofrece productos de buena calidad. Juan  ha creído conveniente solicitar este crédito para la compra de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite y otros productos. Juan es una persona bastante conocida y estimada en donde reside. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una persona tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos, 27, lives with his wife and two children.  He sells basic grains.  He has at his customers’ reach all kinds of daily use items that they otherwise would have to go into town to get.

The business is well received because he always treats his customers kindly and offers good quality products.

Juan has deemed it advisable to request a loan to buy rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil and other products.

Juan is a well known person who is held in high esteem where he lives.  People who know him consider him to be a level headed and responsible person.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil and other products.

loans.name: Cristo El Salvdor Group

texts.es:
CRISTO EL SALVADOR

María tiene 50 años de edad reciente mente viene siendo la presidenta del grupo de alcancía comunal  “CRISTO EL SALVADOR” este nombre lo pusieron por que ahí una iglesia con el mismo nombre en su localidad este grupo lo conforman 8 personas que se juntaron por medio de ser vecinos se pasaron la voz este grupo ya tiene 2 años trabajando con Edaprospo-Prosperidad.
Marìa es madre casada con 2 hijos comenzó trabaja vendiendo productos de belleza pero ahora vende ropa hace 3 años y así trabajando  a podido construir su casa y levantarla y asumir junto a su esposo los gastos del hogar q son agua comida colegio ETC. si María tuviera un capital de trabajo lo invertiría en una bodega instalada en su casa propia
texts.en:
Cristo el Salvador
María is 50 years old.  She has recently become the president of the 'Cristo el Salvador' (Christ the Savior) community bank.  The group members gave the group this name because where there live there is a church with the same name.  The group has 8 members who came together and created this group because they are all neighbors.  They have been working with Edaprospo-Prosperidad for 2 years.

María is a married mother with 2 children.  She started work selling beauty products but she has now been selling clothes for 3 years.  Through her work, she has been able to build her own house and assume responsibility for her household expenses such as water, food, school fees, etc. together with her husband.  If María had working capital, she would invest it in setting up a small grocery store in her home.

loans.use: To acquire supplies (clothes)

loans.name: Giovanna

texts.es: La Sra. Giovana se dedica al comercio de ropa de bebe ya hace aproximadamente 8 años, este negocio nació por la necesidad de  poder aportar en la familia con un negocio ya que el dinero no les alcanzaba y ella quería sobretodo ayudar al esposo quien es chofer de minibús. La cliente necesita el dinero para poder comprar ropa de bebe por docena y así  ampliar su capital en esta época de navidad y poder generara mayor ingreso, es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mrs. Giovana has sold baby clothing for approximately 8 years. This business was born of the necessity to support her family with a business, as they did not have enough money and she wanted above all to help her husband, who is a minibus driver. She needs this money to be able to buy baby clothing by the dozen and thus expand her capital in this Christmas season in order to generate more income. She is a very responsible and hard-working person. She is grateful to the institution for the support offered.

loans.use: the purchase of clothing for babies

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es: La Sra. Matilde es cliente antigua, anteriormente trabajaba con grupo solidario, posteriormente se individualizo, ella tiene la actividad de la venta de refrescos, jugos, cremas, desayunos, etc. en el mercado  de la zona, ella tiene una hija pequeña de unos 6 años que se encuentra en edad escolar, el marido de la Sra. es transportista,  la Sra. Matilde es muy trabajadora ya que se levanta desde muy temprano para preparar sus desayunos y otros preparados que ella vende a sus clientes que son las vendedoras del mercado y los trabajadores de construcción que están por  la zona, el dinero del  crédito lo utilizara en la compra de azúcar y utensilios, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Matilde is a long time client, previously working in a group but she now works independently. She has a canteen from where she sells soft drinks, juices, fresh creams, breakfasts, etc. It is located in her neighborhood market. She has a six-year old daughter and her husband is a public transport driver. Matilde is a very hardworking, starting her day very early in the morning to get the breakfast and other foods ready to sell. She sells to the merchants in the market and to the construction workers in the region. The funds from this loan will be used to purchase sugar and utensils. She is very grateful to the organization for their support.

loans.use: To purchase sugar and utensils.

loans.name: Melany

texts.en: Melany B. is from the village of Brgy. Kirang, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 38 years old. Melany is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Melany raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for breeding. Melany has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2011, Melany joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melany is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the first loan taken out by Melany from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Lilian Del Carmen
