It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Son's Group

texts.en: Son P. is a stable laborer who works in the busy fish market. Also, she is hired by people to help carry their fish. She was born in 1982 and has been married for many years to Mr. Ouk Vuthy, age 27. Her husband is a truck driver in the fish sale location. Together they make $5 per day. This couple has three young children who are enrolled in primary school and dependent on their income. Son P. is taking out her loan to mend/decorate her old house. This group loan has been applied for by four low-income people. Mrs. Son P. has been promoted by the other members of the group to be the leader. The other borrowers are: Seng T., a cake seller, who requests a loan to increase her business capital; Ma R., who is a cleaner and asking for a loan to repair her existing house; and Lem S. is a grocery seller who needs a loan to accumulate the quantity of her inventory.

loans.use: To mend/decorate her old house.

loans.name: Merlabel

texts.en:
Merlabel C. is from the village of Magsaysay, Gingoog City. She is 47 years old. Merlabel is married and has 6 school-aged children. Merlabel owns & operates a store where she sells seafood such as fish and shrimp. Merlabel has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Merlabel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Merlabel is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Merlabel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Gladis Xiomara

texts.es:
la sra. Gladis Xiomara A. M. tiene 16 años de dedicarse al comercio y es notable que durante todo este tiempo a sabido administrar su negocio ya que sus condiciones de vida han mejorado.
Doña Gladis es la propietaria de la caseta que se encuentra ubicada dentro de la Escuela “MANUEL DE ADALID Y GAMERO” misma que se encuentra ubicada en el centro de esta ciudad, aqui se imparten clases en dos jornadas: matutina y vespertina, dicho centro de estudio cuenta con una asistencia de 750 alumnos promedio diarios.
Doña Gladis no cuenta con competencia de negocio dentro de la escuela, ya que es la única cafetería de la escuela y por seguridad de los alumnos tampoco los dejan salir a comprar afuera del centro de estudios.
Doña Gladis esta casada y con su esposo han procreado 3 hijos los cuales dependen de ellos al 100%; su esposo trabaja para el ministerio de salud pública como promotor de salud.
Ella inicio hace 16 años con este negocio por que la situación económica para ellos era bien difícil en aquel entonces, pero con las ganancias que su negocio le a dejado han logrado cubrir varios gastos que se han dado dentro del hogar.

Doña Gladis Invertirá su crédito en la compra de Refrescos, churros, confites, paletas, chicles, galletas, jugos, tortillas de harina, frijoles, pan.
texts.en:
Gladis Xiomara A. M. has been a merchant for 16 years. It is notable that during this time she has known how to administer her business, and her living conditions have improved. Gladis is the proprietor of a stand located in the Manuel de Adalid y Gamero School, which is in the center of the city. Classes are given in two sessions, mornings and evenings. An average of 750 students attends this educational center daily. Gladis does not have any business competition within the school because it is the only café in the school. For security reasons, students are not allowed to leave the educational center to shop elsewhere. Gladis is married. She and her husband have three children who are 100% dependent upon them. Her husband works in the Ministry of Public Health as a health advocate. She started her business 16 years ago because their economic situation was very difficult. With the earnings from her business they have been able to cover various household expenses. Gladis will use the loan to buy soft drinks, churros, candy, lollipops, gum, cookies, juice, flour tortillas, beans, and bread.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tortillas, doughnuts, meat, salsa, soft drinks, churros, candy, lollipops, gum, cookies, juice, flour tortillas, beans, and bread

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David trabaja como mensajero en una oficina, actualmente estudia contabilidad y es el único que solventa todos sus gastos ya que es independiente.
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona Chasquipampa de la ciudad de la Paz en casa de sus padres.
El crédito será destinado para capital educación (pago de matricula e inscripciones en su instituto de contabilidad ).
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro,  con este crédito podrá mejorar sus condiciones laborales.
texts.en:
David works as an office messenger. He is currently studying accounting, and he is the only one who pays all of his expenses because he is independent. He lives in his parents’ house in the Chasquipampa region of the city of La Paz. The loan is for his education (pay for enrollment and registration in the Institute of Accounting). This is the second time he has asked Impro for a loan. With this loan he will be able to improve his working conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for enrollment and registration in the Institute of Accounting that he attends

loans.name: Maria Esmirna

texts.es:
La  Señora. MARIA ESMIRNA P. L., Labora como Auxiliar de Cocina en la Universidad Nacional Autónoma de Nicaragua. 
El tiene un  hijo a su cargo, y este se encuentra en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado dos créditos con CEPRODEL durante dos años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido dos créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción, por lo que comprara  arana, piedra, cemento y piedrin para la construcción de un muro en la parte trasera del patio de su casa de habitación.
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
Alejandro dijo que los préstamos otorgados han sido para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en:
La Señora. MARIA ESMIRNA P. L., Labora como Auxiliar de Cocina en la Universidad Nacional Autónoma de Nicaragua. El tiene un hijo a su cargo, y este se encuentra en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado dos créditos con CEPRODEL durante dos años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido dos créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL, el es un cliente excelente. El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción, por lo que comprara arana, piedra, cemento y piedrin para la construcción de un muro en la parte trasera del patio de su casa de habitación. Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos. Alejandro dijo que los préstamos otorgados han sido para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: MEJORAS DE VIVIENDA Y AMPLIACION

loans.name: Eligio

texts.es:
El señor Eligio, es propietario de una despensa y copetín(venta de comestibles y bebidas) en su propio domicilio, el es una persona muy trabajadora que lucha con toda su familia, para salir adelante de la mejor manera posible.
El negocio que el posee se encuentra bien surtida con todos los productos de consumo familiar, y es atendida generalmente por la esposa ya que el también se dedica a otras actividades como la agricultura.
El negocio se abrió en el 2005 y actualmente cuenta con una clientela formada que la conforman especialmente los vecinos.
Solicita el préstamo para comprar fideos, arroz, harina, lácteos, panificados, aceite,  para surtir mas su negocio y así poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mr. Eligio is proprietor of a store selling provisions, including food and drinks, from his own home. He is a hard-working person who struggles together with his family to get ahead in the best manner possible. Eligio's business is well supplied with all the products a family might consume. It is attended generally by his wife, since he also dedicates himself to other activities, including agriculture. The business opened in 2005 and actually, it can count on a clientèle made up primarily of neighbors. Eligio is requesting a loan to purchase beans, rice, wheat flour, milk products, bakery items, and cooking oil, to better stock his business and thus, satisfy the needs of his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING BEANS, RICE, WHEAT FLOUR, MILK PRODUCTS, FRUIT AND VEGETABLES TO SELL

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda C. is from the village of Salawagan, Quezon Bukidnon. She is 53 years old, married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Rosalinda owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Rosalinda has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP per month for these activities.

In 2007, Rosalinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rosalinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used as working capital and to purchase additional inventory. Rosalinda is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Rosalinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 26 year old single man from Lebanon. Ahmad had been running a painting business for five years now. He is skilled in painting homes. He says that he is very committed to his work and proud of his experience. He says that finding better ways to advertise his business has been a challenge. Ahmad is a hardworking man who does his best to make himself known and satisfy his clients' demands.

He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, Kiva partner. He plans to buy paints and electrical wires for his work. This is his second loan from Al Majmoua. His previous loan allowed him to improve his work. He hopes to further expand his business in the future.

loans.use: To buy paints and also electrical wires for his work.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This entrepreneur is 59 years old. He is married and has four children. He owns a grocery store. He has been working in this field for long time. 

He has taken this loan to develop his shop. With the loan funds, he will buy food and a vertical refrigerator. He has many customers due to the freshness and the good quality of his food. He has a good reputation in the market and that attracts many customers. He treats his customers so nicely that they always come to buy things from him.

loans.use: To buy food and a refrigerator

loans.name: Saroeun's Group

texts.en: This group loan has four members who have been selected Mrs. Saroeun P. is a group leader who is 34-year-old located in Veay Chhneah village in Takeo province. All the members will use portion of their loan for different purposes. Mrs. Saroeun P. is a weaver at her home where she can earn money to support her family while her husband, Mr. Pou K., is a motorbike taxi driver. Her problem is that her husband’s motorbike is too old to use, but she has a little money to buy. So to solve this problem, Mrs. Saroeun P. is finding for a loan to add more money to purchase a new motorbike to instead the old one. She is a mother of two children whom all are studying in local school.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha M. is from the village of Poblacion, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 48 years old and married with four adult children. To make a living, Editha has a sari-sari (variety) shop selling both food, including bananas, and daily-use products. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Editha joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Editha from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more oil, salt, tomatoes, beans, rice, and peppers

loans.name: Joyce Lanoi

texts.en:
Joyce Lanoi L. is 43 years old and her spouse is Samante Oyie. She supports four members of her family. Her spouse is also a farmer and they do the farming together on their own piece of land, which they have been doing for the last seven years.

This will be her second loan, which she is planning to spend on preparing their land for planting potatoes.

She is planning to use the anticipated profits from the expanded business to increase her farm production by ploughing more acres, and also educate her children.

She has been paying back her loan successfully without default. Her hopes and dreams are to expand her farming activity from small scale to large scale and also see her children get to a better school with good learning facilities.

loans.use: To prepare their land for potato planting.

loans.name: Guljan's Group

texts.en:
Guljan U. is 40; she is the leader of the group. Her spouse is a power engineering specialist in glass-works. Together, the couple is bringing up two children; the eldest works as a taxi-driver, the younger one goes to school. Over the course of five years, Guljan has started and continued her own business. She sells vegetables and fruits in the market “Bulak”. Out of profits, she helped to buy a car for her son. Guljan and her husband also breed livestock. With money received from the loan, they want to purchase sheep for breeding. In the future, she wants to obtain a computer.

Burulkan K., 39, is divorced. She has to bring up two children by herself, both of them are school students. As an unwed mother following her neighbor’s advice, she supports her family by selling fruits and vegetables in the market “Bulak”. Her earnngs have given her the possibility to obtain furniture. The loan purpose is to buy livestock animals (sheep). In the future, Burulkan is planning to make house repairs.

Akylai A. is the treasurer of the group. She is 27 and divorced. She has two small children (10 and 3 years old). The young mother has to raise money by working as a junior operator in a petrol station “Gazprom”. Out of her salary, she has managed to put some money aside in order to open her own small shop. For this aim to be achieved, she also needs a loan. In the future, Akylai wants to obtain cattle and to further increase her stock.

Asel K., 28, is married. Together with her spouse, who has a profession of a farmer, she is bringing up three children (all of them are schoolboys). Over the course of two years, the couple has been cultivated sunflower seeds and bred cattle. They want to get a loan in order to purchase more cattle for further fattening and resale. In the future, the family is planning to do house repairs.

Where Did This Loan Come From?

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan.

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is 34 years old and a member of the Jiinuwe Ngando group under Faulu Kenya.  He runs a retail shop and video cinema.  He also has a part-time job where he earns more income.  He has been running his business for three years with two employees.  Simon is a visionary and hardworking man who hopes to expand his shop into a wholesale business. With the loan of 20,000 Kes, he will buy sodas, confectionery, and movies.

loans.use: To buy sodas, confectionery, and movies

loans.name: Florence Nyambura

texts.en:
Florence has been farming in Olkalou town since the year 2001.  She is 58 years old, a widow and the mother of four children.  She has been raising her children alone since her husband died.

She was introduced to KADET  LTD by her friend and this will be her third loan.  She repaid all her previous loans well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy a dairy cow.

In future, Florence hopes to buy more land and practice mixed farming on a large scale.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Srun's Group

texts.en:
This group loan has six members who live in Kaoh Touch village, in Kandal province. Mrs. Srun Y. is a group leader who has been selected by the other members who will each use their loan for different purposes. 

She and her husband, Mr. Pruonh Nhoem, are farmers who own more two-hectare plot of land to grow crops to sell and support their family. This is the growing season but she does not have enough money to support the business. To improve this farming business, Mrs. Srun Y. is asking for a loan to purchase bean seed, pesticide, and gasoline. She has two children, one of whom is attending in school, and the other is too young to work or study. 

The day of the loan disbursement Mrs. Srun Y. was busy working in the field. Her husband, Mr. Pruonh Nhoem, received the loan for her. The photo above is of Mrs. Srun Y.'s husband.

loans.use: To purchase bean seed, pesticide, and gasoline

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn T. is from the town of Palayan, Aloran. She is 33 years old. Evelyn is married and has 2 very young children. To make a living, Evelyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Evelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 45,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This will be the second loan taken out by Evelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to raise for sale

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Don Luis, es un agricultor de experiencia, tiene 48 años de edad, reside en San Rafael Oriente departamento de San Miguel, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos de 26 y 23 años de edad, de estos solo uno depende económicamente de sus ingresos, él se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 35 años ya que desde la edad de 11 años su padre le llevaba a la milpa para que conociera el proceso de la siembra, no tiene horario para hacer sus actividades.
Don Luis está solicitando un préstamo que necesita para comprar maíz, abono, fertilizantes para realizar la siembra de esta temporada que le llaman de regadillo, con la compra de los insumos agrícolas podrá realizar la siembra con todos los cuidados necesarios para obtener una buena cosecha.
Una de sus aspiraciones es convertirse en un gran agricultor y obtener las mejores producciones de maíz, tener los cultivos con todo lo necesario para su crecimiento y velar siempre por el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Don Luis is an experienced farmer.  He is 48 years old and lives in San Rafael Oriente in the department of San Miguel.  He lives with his wife and two children, who are 26 and 23 years old, one of whom still depends on him.  He has been farming for 35 years--since he was 11 years old, when his father gave him a field so he could learn how to cultivate.  He has no fixed hours for his work.

Don Luis is asking for a loan to buy corn, manure, and fertilizer for this season's planting.  These products will allow him to plant with enough care to obtain a good harvest.  One of his goals is to become a big-scale farmer and obtain higher levels of corn production, and he must do everything he can to increase his business and look out for his family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy corn, fertilizer

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Estrellas De Fatima Group

texts.es: Lucia tiene 46 años y vive en la Urb. Fátima D. Morón, ella es conviviente y ha trabajado con Edapropso por 1 año. Forma parte del grupo “Estrella D. Fátima” el cual se conforma por nueve vecinas amigas. Frida  venD. ropa desD. hace 2 meses para ayudar a su esposo que en el mantenimiento D. su hogar, indica que D. tener más capital pondría una tienda D. ropas, pero que lo lograra poco a poco y para esto necesita que Edaprospo le ayuD. con las habilitaciones para su trabajo.
texts.en: Lucia is forty-six years old and lives in the neighbourhood of Fatima D. Moron.  She has worked with Edapropso for one year.  She is a part of the group, "Star of Fatima," which is composed of nine neighbours, whom are also friends.  Two months ago, Frida began selling clothes to help her husband support their household.  She explains that if she were to have more capital, she would open a clothing shop.  She hopes to achieve this little by little and needs Edaprospo's help her construct it.

loans.use: Purchase products and supplies.

loans.name: Fanny Antonia

texts.es: Fanny Antonia labora en su propio negocio, una pulpería en la que ofrece a sus vecinos golosinas, refrescos, pan, granos básicos entre otras cosas así es como recibe mejores ingresos para subsistir diariamente y aportar a su hogar. Desde hace 2 años tomó la decisión de convertirse en microempresaria y aportar con su trabajo a los ingresos del hogar. El financiamiento que actualmente solicita es para la compra de materia prima, ya que se acercan temporadas festivas.
texts.en: Fanny Antonia works in her own business, a convenience store, where she offers her neighbors candy, beverages, bread, basic grains and other things. This is how she receives income to survive daily and support her home. 2 years ago she decided to become a small businesswoman and use her work to support her home. The financing that she seeks today is to buy items as the holiday season is approaching.

loans.use: Working capital for her business

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
Rosa María Pérez es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien tiene un pequeño taller de costura la cual inicio con una docena de camisas hace 40 años en la actualidad elabora desde vestido, uniformes, bléiser etc. Ella gracias a este negocio saco adelante a sus cinco hijos los cuales son mayores de edad y están casados. 

Ella invertirá el crédito en materiales como telas, hilos, botones y mantenimiento a las maquinas.
texts.en:
Rosa María Pérez is a hard-working, courageous, and enterprising woman who has a small sewing workshop that she started 40 years ago with just a dozen shirts.  Now she makes dresses, uniforms, blazers, etc.  Thanks to this business, she was able to help her five children get ahead. They are all grown up and married now.

She will invest this loan in materials like fabric, thread, and buttons, as well as in the maintenance of her sewing machines.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, etc.

loans.name: On

texts.en:
Mrs. On C. (in the photo) and her husband are farmers; they grow vegetables and rice on their land in the village. Besides farming, she also has a new business selling silk fabric. She is asking for a loan of $1,000; she will use $350 to purchase a water pumping machine to spray her farm and another $650 to purchase silk fabrics for resale.

The family lives in a village across the Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: To purchase a water pumping machine and buy silk fabrics for resale.

loans.name: Las Marías De Monte Salas Group

texts.es: Esta foto fue tomada en la casa de Verónica S., un integrante del grupo Las Marías de Monte Salas, que está ubicado en el Estado de Veracruz en México. Ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos que inicio hace 2 años. Solicita el préstamo para invertir en mercancía. Sus clientes la consideran una persona honesta y responsable, en quien se puede confiar. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente satisfecha por poder reinvertir en su negocio. Tiene 31 años, estudio hasta la secundaria, está casada y tiene en total 2 hijos; 1 mujer y 1 varón. Quiere este crédito para incrementar sus ganancias. También espera  poder ahorrar y darle una mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en: This photo was taken in the home of Verónica S., a member of the "Las Marías de Monte Salas" ["The Marías of Monte Salas"] Group, which is located in the state of Veracruz in Mexico. Verónica sells shoes, which she started doing two years ago. She is requesting this loan to invest in merchandise. Her customers consider her to be a very honest and responsible woman in whom they can trust. As she is requesting this loan, she feels happy that she will be able to reinvest in her business. She is 31 years old, studied until secondary school, and is married with two children (one girl and one boy). She would like to use this loan to increase her earnings. She also hopes to be able to save and to provide her children with a better education.

loans.use: to invest in her shoe business

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a married woman who lives in Bataraza, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a fish vending business and a general store. Her husband Rufino, who is 48 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have six children who are between 11 and 28 years old. Imelda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past two loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Imelda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 23,000 uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her third loan, she is borrowing PHP 18,000 to buy a new engine for her fishing boat so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children and house repairs. Imelda is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To buy a new engine for her fishing boat

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam B. is from the village of Namnama,Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 54 years old. Miriam is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Miriam owns & operates a tailoring business providing general tailoring services to local community members. Miriam has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Miriam joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Miriam has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18000 PHP from ASKI.  The previous loan was used to purchase additional cloth, thread, and needles. Miriam is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional tailoring equipment, such as needles & thread. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Miriam from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional tailoring equipment, such as needles & thread

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Mrs. Neang is a married woman who was born in 1977. She and her husband have two children, both of whom are too young to work or attend school. To earn a living, she is a seamstress in a garment factory. Her husband, Mr. Munoeun, is a middleman in the chicken sales business and a pig breeder. In addition, he is a farmer who owns a small piece of land; specifically, he grows rice, some of which he sells to local consumers, and the rest of which he keeps to feed his family.

Because her husband’s business has been doing quite well, she would like to help him expand the business. Therefore, Mrs. Neang is seeking a loan in the amount of $500 to buy more piglets and pig feed, with the remaining balance of the loan proceeds to be used to buy more chickens for re-sale purposes.

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets, pig feed, and chickens

loans.name: Agriphina

texts.en:
Agriphina is a married woman with two school-going children. They live in a rented house that has electricity but no running water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. For the past year, she has operated a beauty salon, where her potential customers are neighbors and friends. 

Agriphina faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding it in the future. With the Kshs 25,000 she is requesting she wants to purchase cosmetics and chemicals for her beauty salon. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and chemicals for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Siempre Adelante Group

texts.es:
Clelia tiene 41 años de edad, casada, con 5 hijos. Pertenece como socia a la alcancìa comunal:"Siempre Adelante".
Clelia trabaja preparando desayunos al paso; vende maca, agua de manzana, leche de soya; y los acompaña con "sanguches", como por ejemplo: pan con queso, aceitunas, paltas, etc.
Clelia trabaja en esta actividad hace 12 años, y tiene su puesto al frente de la Universidad del Centro; tiene gran cantidad de clientes, por ofrecer desayunos econòmicos al alcance de los alumnos.
El prèstamo solicitado es para acondicionar la carretilla donde vende los desayunos.
(En la fotografìa Clelia esta en una de las fotos pequeñas y es la segunda de la izquierda, viste de polo color rosa y chompa color azul; no se encontraba presente al momento de la reuniòn porque llevo a su hijo al hospital)
La socia de la foto pequeña del extremo izquierdo, es Magdalena U. C., no estuvo presente por motivos de trabajo/ no tenìa con quièn dejar su tienda.
La socia de la foto pequeña del extremo derecho, Maria R. B., no estuvo presente por tener trabajos pendientes por entregar/ hace tipeos.
texts.en:
Clelia is 41 years old, married, and has five children.  She is a member of the 'Siempre Adelante' (Always Moving Forwards) community bank.

Cielia works preparing and selling breakfasts to go.  She sells a drink containing maca (a native plant), sweetened apple water and soy milk, and combines these drinks with sandwiches such as bread with cheese, olives, avocado, etc.

Cielia has been in this business for 12 years and her sales location is outside the Universidad del Centro.  She has a large number of customers as she offers cheap breakfasts that are affordable to the students.

Cielia is requesting a loan to equip her small cart from which she sells her breakfasts.

In the photograph, Cielia is in one of the small photos.  She is the second one from the left, wearing a pink top and a blue sweater.  She wasn't present when the meeting took place because she had to take her son to the hospital.

The member in the small photo on the far right is Magdalena U. C. who couldn't attend for work reasons (she didn't have anybody to mind her store).

The member in the small photo on the far left is Maria R. B. who couldn't attend because she had work which she needed to deliver (she types documents for people).

loans.use: to equip her small cart from which she sells breakfasts

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta S. is 56 years old and married. She has seven children, one of whom is in school. Vicenta works very hard to provide for them.

Vicenta runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks and bread.  

She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

In the future Vicenta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 62 years old and is married and blessed with nine children.

He is a mixed farmer and he has been doing this for the last twenty years. His farm is in a productive area which has proven to be good for mixed farming. He learned about KADET Ltd. through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence.

This will be his second loan.  He is planning to buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizer. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to educate his grandchildren.

His hope and dream is to educate his grandchildren to higher levels of education. He is a hardworking man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Veronica Yolanda

texts.es:
Veronica Yolanda tiene 26 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con los dos hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama NARCISA DE JESUS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Temistocles, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Veronica se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz y arroz, desde hace 5 años. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos y la variación del clima. Su sueño es comprar terrenos para seguir sembrando.

Le gusta mucho cocinar.
texts.en:
Veronica Yolanda is 26 years old, is married and lives with her husband and two children.  She lives in the Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos canton.

This communal bank is called Narcisa de Jesus, and is located in the San Temistocles area, belonging to the Ventanas canton.  This communal bank is engaged in short cycle farming such as growing corn and rice.

Veronica has been making a living in farming corn and rice for the last 5 years.  She makes her purchases monthly in Ventanas and sells her products at the market of the same location.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of seeds and fertilizers.  The loan will help her to satisfy her financial needs.  She will better be able to face challenges such as pests and diseases in her crops and the varied climate conditions.  Her dream is to buy land to continue planting.

She very much likes to cook.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, chemical and organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Aly Esmelia

texts.es:
Aly Esmelia es socia del  Banco Comunal “San Miguel Arcángel II”, ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 38 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene tres hijos.  Tiene estudios de secundaria.
La señora es una socia nueva que recientemente se incorpora al Banco Comunal San Miguel Arcángel II  del Movimiento Manuela Ramos, solicita un préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles dinero que invertirá en su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de carne de cordero y alpaca, comprará  tres animales para su respectivo carneo para luego venderlo.
En el negocio le ayuda su esposo quien trabaja en una empresa privada como chofer transportista y brinda servicios de electrificación.
Su sueño es tener más capital y poner otro negocio como venta de zapatillas.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es el ahorro y el préstamo de la cuenta interna.
texts.en:
Aly Esmelia is a member of the “San Miguel Arcángel II” community bank which is located in Ilave district, in El Collao province, in Puno department.  She is 38 years old, lives with her partner, and has three children.  She completed her high school studies.

Aly is a new member who recently joined Movimiento Manuela Ramos' "San Miguel Arcángel II" community bank.  She is requesting a loan for 500 Peruvian soles to invest in her business.  She sells lamb and alpaca meat and will buy three animals for their meat which she will then sell.

Aly's husband works in a private company.  He is a haulage driver and provides electricity services.  He also helps Aly in her business.

Aly's dream is to have more capital and to set up another business selling sneakers.

What Aly likes about her community bank are the savings and the loans from the internal account.

loans.use: to buy three animals for their meat

loans.name: Maria Benita

texts.es:
La señora María es socia del banco comunal las fresitas del Distrito Calleria, Departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 49 años D. edad, está casada y tiene cuatro hijos.
Lleva 25 ciclos en el banco comunal, en los últimos años ha cambiando D. negocio, conla intención D. mejorar sus ingresos, ahora invertirá en la implementación D. un pequeño Kiosco que tiene en su casa donD. venderá productos D. pan llevar (abarrotes).
Con su nuevo préstamo D. S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 5 jabas D. gaseosa, 2 paquetes D. agua, 2 bolsas D. pan, 2 bolsas D. biscocho, 1 paquete D. néctar en cajitas, 2 paquetes D. fideos, 3 paquetes D. papel higiénico, 1 saco D. azúcar,1 saco D. arroz, 1 caja D. aceite, 1 caja D. conservas .
Espera que en este nuevo negocio pueda darle buenos resultados ya que aún tiene un hijo que requiere D. su ayuda económica para cubrir sus estudios.  Su esposo es operador D. maquinaria pesada.
Agradece a Manuela Ramos por darle la oportunidad D. poder ayudar a su hijo que en este momento necesita D. su apoyo económico.
texts.en:
Sra. María is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Fresitas” (The Little Strawberries) which is in the District of Calleria, Department of Ucayali. She is 49 years old, married, and has four children.

María has been with the Communal Bank for 25 loan cycles. In recent years, she has converted her business with the intention of improving her income. Now she will invest in a small kiosk in her house where she plans to sell baked goods and groceries.

With her new loan of 3000 PEN, María will buy five cases of sodas, two packets of water, two bags of bread, two bags of cookies, one packet of nectar in boxes, two packets of noodles, three packets of toilet paper, one sack of sugar, one sack of rice, one case of oil, and one case of preserves.

She hopes that this new business will generate good results. María has a son who needs her financial support to pay for his studies. Her husband is a heavy equipment operator.

María is grateful to Manuela Ramos for giving her the opportunity to help her son who currently needs her financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sodas, water, bread, cookies, nectar, noodles, toilet paper, sugar, rice, oil, and preserves.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a 42-year-old married woman with 5 children aged between 2 and 23 years living in Hioma, Uganda. For 14 years she has been hawking (selling door-to-door) clothes and she started by sewing tablecloths and later saved money to start up her current business.

Amina faces a challenge of seasonal changes but hopes to open up a shop and stop hawking. Amina intends to use the credit facility to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy used clothing

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 31 years old, married and lives with six family members, two of whom are working. Alaa has been an owner of a workshop for repairing auto locks since 2007. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation. He is well known in his area.

Alaa decided to apply for a $1200 loan in order to purchase a locksmith key machine. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can have the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a locksmith key machine.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 27 years old and married with no children. She has a business selling beans in Kator Branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years. She earns additional income from selling alcohol.

Betty requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She will use the extra income for building a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more beans to sell.

loans.name: Isufbeg

texts.ru: Исуфбег проживает в районе Хамадони. Ему 35 лет. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Он имеет высшее образование, педагог. По профессии проработал два года. Сейчас он занимается животноводством. Исуфбег откармливает и продает скот. Кредит берет для закупа скота.
texts.en: Isufbeg lives in the Hamadoni district. He is 35 years old, married and has four children.  He has a higher education, and is a teacher.  He spent two years working in that field.  Currently, he is involved in animal husbandry.  Isufbeg fattens up and sells livestock.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Nelliency

texts.en:
Nelliency is a 35 year old married lady blessed with children. She operates a tailoring business at Malindi. She has been in the business for the past seven years and earns a monthly income of Kshs.10, 000. 


Nelliency has applied for KES 50,000 from KADET LTD, her second loan cycle. With this loan, she intends to buy more material for making dresses. 

She will use the anticipated profit to sustain her business and help look after her family. In future, she hopes to own a tailoring school and a well-stocked boutique.

loans.use: To buy materials for making clothes

loans.name: Sugeyda Arely

texts.es:
La señora Sugeyda Arely tiene 34 años de edad, vive en la colonia 18 de Diciembre de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, Sugeyda es madre  soltera y tiene tres hijos, dos ellos estudian en el colegio. Sugeyda se dedica a la venta de abarroteria, es una mujer trabajadora y gracias a su esfuerzo a logrado salir adelante con sus hijos.
También parte de su tiempo libre lo dedica a estudiar a distancia, ella se quiere graduar de administradora de empresas.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de abarroteria, desea comprar mas productos para así vender mas y obtener mejores ganancias.    

Su meta es tener la mejor pulpería de la zona
texts.en:
Sugeyda Arely is 34 years old. She lives in the 18 de Diciembre neighborhood of the city of San Lorenzo. Sugeyda is a single mother and has three children. Two of them are in high school. Sugeyda sells groceries. She is a hardworking woman and thanks to her efforts she has been able to get ahead with her children. 

She also does distance learning in her free time. She wants to get a degree in business management. She will use the loan to buy groceries. She wants more products To be able to sell more and make more income. Her goal is to have the best store in the area.

loans.use: to buy creams, deodorants, shampoos, conditioners, toothpastes, hair gel, and general groceries.

loans.name: Kunyetta

texts.en:
Kunyetta is a married woman with nine children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a fish selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. Kunyetta dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers' needs in the future. 

With the 40,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Luis

texts.pt:
Nasceu na provincia de Inhambane, sul  de Moçambique, casado e pai de 8 filhos dos quais 3 maiores e 5 ainda frequenta a Escola. Fez a 3ª classe e naõ continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

Saiu da sua terra natal para Boane a procura de emprego, é carpinteiro ha mais de 30 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 8.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construcao  da sua casa (areia, cimento, pedra, ferro, e outros.) para dar continuidade da sua obra. O primeiro emprestimo foi de: 15.000.00mt,para a obra.
No futuro solicitar mais valor para concluir a sua casa  e adiquirir uma viatura, irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Luis was born in the province of Inhambane in the south of Mozambique. He’s married and the father of 8 children, 3 of whom are of age and 5 who still attend School. He completed 3rd grade and didn’t continue his education due to a lack of financial means. He lives in his own house with his family and doesn’t support anyone else.

He left his hometown for Boane looking for a job and has been a carpenter for more than 30 years. He has a monthly salary of 8,000.00 meticals (MZN) which he spends on household expenses and saves in his bank account.

Luis has never had loans from other banks and came to know Hluvuku through friends who are also clients of this institution. This is his second loan at Hluvuku for the value of 20,000.00 MZN with which he intends to purchase construction materials for his house (sand, cement, stone, iron and others) to continue the building work. His first loan was for 15,000.00 MZN, also for the building work.

In future he intends to solicit more loans from Hluvuku to complete the build of his house and purchase a vehicle.

loans.use: purchase construction materials for his house (sand, cement, stone, iron and others)

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto a 30-year-old married man living in Getafe, Bohol.

Alberto runs a tricycle taxi business and has had this business for a year. This business earns 5,000 PHP month.

Alberto is asking for a loan to pay for license renewal and buy spare parts. This will help Alberto continue his business.

In the future, Alberto hopes to have more tricycles and build a new house. He also plans to start a livestock business.

loans.use: to pay for license renewal and buy spare parts.

loans.name: Eley Yamylett

texts.es: Eley Yamileth es una mujer humilde y trabajadora. Ella se dedica a brindar el trabajo como conserje. Y quiere realizar este crédito con el fin de realizar la compra de cemento, arena, bloque entre otros. El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque podrá invertir lo necesario. El sueño de ella es poder obtener un negocio y seguirle proporcionando mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en: Eley Yamileth is a humble and hard working woman. She is dedicated to working as a caretaker. She wants to receive this credit in order to buy cement, sand and block among other things. The credit will be of much help because she will be able to invest in what is necessary. Her dream is to obtain a business and continue to improve her housing.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and block, among other things.

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Group

texts.es:
Virgen del Rosario es denominado el comité de la ciudad de Villa Ygatimi. Todas ellas son muy trabajadoras, luchadoras y muy emprendedoras. El principal sueño de ellas es progresar y salir adelante por medio del trabajo en conjunto. El objetivo de todas es poder mejorar sus ingresos y de esa forma ayudar ayudar a sus hijos y familiares.
Una de ellas es la señora Carmen, quien se dedica a la cría de animales. Comenta que su trabajo es muy cansador y agotador, pero que pese a ello le gusta lo que hace. Este es el medio por el cual ella mantiene a su familia y cubre sus gastos diarios, es por eso que le gustaría seguir invirtiendo en el. Por eso solicita el crédito para la compra de animales pequeños, los cuales criará y venderá. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Virgen del Rosario is the name of the communal bank in the city of Villa Ygatimí.  All of the members are very hard-working and very enterprising fighters.  Their main dream is to progress and get ahead by means of working together.  The goal of all of them is to be able to improve their earnings and in that way help their children and family members.

One of them is Carmen, who works raising animals.  She says her job is tiring and exhausting, but in spite of this she likes what she does.  This is how she supports her family and covers her daily expenses.  This is why she would like to continue investing in it.

For this reason she is requesting the loan to buy small animals that she will raise and sell.

She is grateful to the Fundación and to Kiva for the opportunity the loan is giving her.

loans.use: to buy animals to raise and later sell.

loans.name: Bunthorn

texts.en:
Bunthorn and her husband, Nin, live in a village about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1985 and have two sons and three daughters; one is married and lives in a separate home, one is a garment worker, another one is in school and the other two assist their parents in the business.  

Bunthorn and her husband are farmers. They grow rice and vegetables on their farmland in the village where they live. Bunthorn is asking for a loan in the amount of 1,000 USD to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm.

Photo: Bunthorn is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm

loans.name: Olga

texts.ru:
В прошлом году Ольга использовала кредит КИВА для устройства полива и постройки дополнительной теплицы. Она получила хороший доход, приобрела рядом небольшой участок земли и теперь строит на нем еще две дополнительные теплицы.
В семье и дома у Ольги все без изменений. Старшая дочь в этом году заканчивает школу. 
В этот раз Ольге необходим кредит в 15 000 гривен для того, чтобы установить капельное орошение - 3 000 гривен, закупить семена на 8 500 гривен и удобрения на 3 500 гривен.
В жизни Ольги было немало горя. Когда она потеряла первого муж, через три года она снова вышла замуж во второй раз. С этим мужем она живет в браке уже 14 лет. Муж во всем помогает Ольге с тепличным бизнесом.
texts.en:
Last year Olga used her Kiva loan for a watering system and another greenhouse.  She made a nice income and bought a small piece of land nearby, on which she's now putting up two more greenhouses.  There haven't been any changes to Olga's home or family.  This year her oldest daughter is finishing school.

Olga currently needs a loan of 15,000 UAH, including 3,000 UAH for a watering system, 8,500 UAH for seeds, and 3,500 for fertilizer.

Olga has had a great deal of grief in her life.  She lost her first husband, and remarried three years later.  She's been with her current husband for fourteen years, and he helps her out with her greenhouse business.

loans.use: to put in a watering system and buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 36 years old, married to Joshua and they have three children. She has been in the retail business for the last 3 years, from which she earns a monthly income of Kes10,000. She is applying for her first loan of Kes 30,000. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. She plans to use the funds to buy sugar, rice, beans, maize flour and kerosene to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, beans, maize flour, and kerosene for sale.

loans.name: Fariza's Group

texts.en:
Fariza has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband’s agriculture business. With the loan investment, he will buy seeds and fertilizers for growing different crops and he will earn more profits from his business.

Fariza is an embroidery and sewing expert and works for her neighboring clients. She is very artistic in her work and receives a good number of orders every month.

She has given birth to six children. Three of them work in a factory while the remaining three are studying.

She is also a very good housewife and performs her household duties very well.

Her husband has been operating his business for the past many years and Fariza is hopeful that an investment will help him make his business more profitable.

Note:"In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Fariza."

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for an agriculture business.

loans.name: Ilhomjon

texts.ru: Илхомджон женат и любящий отец двоих детей. Его дети еще маленькие и жена присматривает за ними. Ради содержания своих детей Илхомджон начал заниматься скотоводством 5 лет назад. С начало у него был один скот в обороте, со временем он расширил свой бизнес, а сейчас имеет 4 поголовье крупного рогатого скота. Данный момент он хочет еще  добавить несколько голов в оборот, с целью расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Ilhomjon is married and the loving father of two children.  His children are still small and his wife watches after them.   Five years ago Ilhomjon began raising cattle for the sake of supporting his children.  At the beginning, he only had one, but with time he expanded his business and now he has four head of cattle. Now, with the goal of expanding his business, he would like to add several head more.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Angel Jesus

texts.es:
Angel es un hombre muy trabajador, vive en la ciudad de Camaná, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo es una ciudad que se caracteriza por desarrollarse la agricultura en especial el cultivo de arroz, maíz, frejoles, entre otros. Día a día Angel trabaja como maestro constructor, el le dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 2 clientes diariamente, ya que depende del tamaño de la obra que realice, Angel cree que le está saliendo adelante con su trabajo porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Angel está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar madera para poder realizar sus trabajos de construcción, ya que actualmente tiene que alquilar las maderas y así el podrá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir trabajando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Comprar un trompo mezclador”.
texts.en:
Angel is a very hardworking man. He lives in the city of Camaná, which is characterized as having a warm and pleasing climate. It is also a city described as having agriculture, especially growing corn, beans and more. Day to day Angel works as a master builder. He works around 10 hours a day and can attend to up to 2 customers a day, depending on the size of the job he does. Angel believes that he is getting ahead with his job because he is very friendly to the customers and above all because he really wants to get ahead.

Angel is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help he will be able to do some construction work. RIght now he has to rent the lumber and this way he can improve his income and keep working to be able to make his biggest dream come true: buying a mixer.

loans.use: to buy lumber.

loans.name: Jean Batiste

texts.en:
Jean Batiste is 47 years old, married man with 5 children aged between 6 and 18 years. They all go to school. He has farmed for 8 years and will use the loan from kiva to buy fertilizers to use to pay who harvested maize and to sell the maize. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay who harvested maize and to sell the maize.

loans.name: Romana

texts.en: My name is Romana M. and I own a food stand that sells items such as fried bananas, bread with beans, tortillas, salads, hot dogs, and enchiladas.  I have had my business for three years, and my daughter helps me to prepare the food and wait on customers.  My clients are all very good people, and my stand is located near the bus terminal so there are always a lot of customers.  My goal is to increase my inventory so that I can save enough money to remodel my house, support my family, and pay for a good education for my daughter.

loans.use: To purchase bananas, beans, butter, cheese, tortillas, plates, cups, salt, sugar, meat, bread and coffee for my food stand.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en: Small community retail outlets are quite a vibrant activity  in Angie's community, Madina, in Ghana. Angie is a client of Kraban Support Foundation and has been trained in the TEACH lending model. Angie is now able to keep simple records of her business. She requires a loan of $800 from KIVA to support her retail outlet operations.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Choa

texts.en:
Mrs. Choa S. M., 28 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She operates a laundry business and typically makes around $3/day. Her husband (pictured here with her mother who lives with her) runs a hair salon and makes around $4/day, which helps in financing the entire family. Her children, meanwhile, attend school and assist her whenever they are free.

Choa S. M. is asking for $500 loan to facilitate her husband's business by purchasing some tools to supply in his shop and another part of the money is to repair their house. In the future, S. M. is thinking about being able to expand the hair salon as well as keep sponsoring her children to have a better quality of education.

loans.use: To purchase some tools for a hair salon and part of money is to repair house.

loans.name: Marisela

texts.es:
Marisela lives in Creel, Chihuahua located north of Mexico. She is married and her husband lives in the United States. Her husband sends her money whenever he can. Marisela started her own business selling used clothes to take care of her monthly bills whenever her husband is unable to send her money. She started selling a few items of clothing at first, but due to her friendly nature and her motivation, her business has grown. Now she has a bigger inventory and her sales have increased substantially.

Marisela would like for her business to continue to grow so that her husband can one day return home and they can be together. She needs a loan in the amount of $1,200 USD which she will use to purchase more inventory to offer a variety of products to her clients and increase sales. She commits to repay this amount within 6 months. Be part of this business by helping this family be reunited! They greatly appreciate it!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Al norte de México, en la localidad de Creel, Chihuahua vive Marisela, ella es casada y su esposo trabaja en Estados Unidos, en ocasiones le es muy difícil enviarle dinero a Marisela y para poder cubrir sus gastos ella inició su propio negocio vendiendo ropa usada, inició con muy poca mercancía pero sus ganas de salir adelante y su carácter que le facilita relacionarse con los demás le han ayudado a hacer crecer su negocio, ahora cuenta con un mejor surtido y sus ventas han crecido considerablemente.

Marisela quiere hacer crecer su negocio para que su esposo pueda regresar y estar juntos, ahora necesita de un préstamo de $ 1,200 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes e incrementar sus ventas, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte del crecimiento de este negocio y ayuda a que esta familia pueda estar unida, ellos agradecen mucho tu apoyo.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Amado

texts.en:
Amado is 54 years old, is married and has 5 children, 3 of whom live with him. All of his children are either studying or working in various jobs. The youngest is still in high school, another studying accounting in university, and the other three work as an accountant, a dressmaker, and in sales. 
He owns his own contracting business and has been working in construction his whole life, learning everything he knows from working with his father. He has been working hard his whole life to make sure that all of his children would have the opportunity to get an education and become professionals.
He is a very active member of the community as well, acting as the president of a cooperative, and a secretary on two parents school boards. He is very happy that through his business, and through the loans that he receives, he is able to employ people in the community who might not otherwise have work. He realizes that opportunities in his country is limited and is thankful that this foundation has helped give opportunities to many people in his community. He will use this loan as operative capital and purchase of cement, sand and bricks. 
His dream for the future is to leave his contracting business and open a dressmaking business with his daughter as it is currently a very lucrative industry in Paraguay.

loans.use: Purchase of cement, sand and bricks

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
HALIMA, a widow in her early forties, lives with her 4-year-old orphaned niece and supports her teenage son who is currently attending boarding school. A year ago, Halima opened a diner called “Mama Lishe Halima” (Swahili for Mama Halima’s Café), where she serves breakfast, lunch, and dinner from 7a.m. onward. Before this business, her income was dependent on selling clothes, but she found this business to be an unreliable source of income since her customers often did not pay her the full amount on the spot. As a result, she took out a loan and found the confidence in herself to start a new trade.

Halima’s diner now makes a profit of around $20 a day. The diner holds about 10 customers at a time, but people can eat outside as well. As business is currently going well, and she was able to pay back her first loan successfully, her hope is to take out another loan in order to begin serving French fry dishes. Halima currently hires a helper for half the day and has plans to hire another helper to be in charge of cooking the French fries. She also has plans of setting up umbrella booths in front of her diner where people can eat them.

Halima belongs to the group Dhahabu (Swahili for “gold”), which consists of 36 other members who keep each other accountable and insure one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To hire an additional helper and to set up outdoor umbrella booths for customers

loans.name: Saturday

texts.en: Mr. Saturday Ulehor is 32 years old, married and has one child.  He hails from Benin City.  He operates a drug store and has been in this business since 1999.  He is requesting a the loan of $525 to enable him buy more drugs to stock his store.  He promises to pay back this loan within 8 months.

loans.use: To buy additional stock for his drug store

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Mrs. Pov N. and her husband have been married since 1985. They have three children—two sons and one daughter. Pov and her family live in a fertile farming area along the Tonle Bassac (river), a tributary of the Mekong, several kilometers south of Phnom Penh. She has been in the business of selling bananas and guavas since 2003. She buys bananas and guavas from farms in her village for reselling at a market in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a construction worker. 

She is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the second time in the amount of $300. She will use this loan to purchase bananas and guavas from farms in her village for reselling at a market in Phnom Penh.

loans.use: For buying flowers and guavas for reselling

loans.name: Narirurwe West C Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Aisha N.. She currently has a business selling clothing. She is requesting a loan to increase the inventory of clothes to sell. Aisha is 33 years old and is married. Her husband has a butcher shop. She has 4 children ranging from ages 6 to 18 and her children go to school.

Each week, Aisha makes approximately 350000 UGX (about $205) profit. With the extra profit gained from increasing the clothing sales, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for the children. Aisha has had a loan for 100000 UGX (about $60) from BRAC Uganda in the past in order to invest in her business, and the loan was paid back on time.

Aisha is joined in her small group by Habiba N., Zawija Biriabwa, Rose K., Lukia N., and Harriet N.. Habiba N. has a talioring business and wants to set up a shop selling clothes. Zawija Biriabwa has a butcher shop and sells the meat, and wants a loan to buy more animals for slaughtering. Rose K. has a retail shop and wants to increase the stock. Lukia N. currently has a tailoring business and is requesting a loan to buy more sewing machines. Harriet N. sells charcoal and intends to purchase more sacks of charcoal from villages.

loans.use: To increase clothing sales

loans.name: Israel

texts.en:
Israel, aged 38 years, has been a fisherman and fish seller to customers for seven years. He is looking for a loan to enable him to buy maize, rice and flour to expand his existing fishing trade by selling grain to shops.

He is hardworking and determined, as he has six of his own children to support, along with five orphans who live with him and his wife.

loans.use: Israel isseeking a loan to enable him to buy maize, rice and flour to expand his existing fishing trade by selling grain to shops.

loans.name: Griselda Guadalupe

texts.es:
Griselda works selling jewellery. She started this business five years ago with some money which she had saved because she had always liked sales and it was an activity in which she had done well: she also needed extra income to help her husband with the household expenses and those of their small two children. Currently the business is doing very well.

She is asking for a loan of $775 USD which she will repay in 6 months to make renovations to her business site. With your help, Griselda will continue moving forward.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Griselda se dedica a la venta de joyería inicio su negocio hace 5 años con algo de dinero que tenia ahorrado porque siempre le han gustado las ventas y era una actividad en la que le había ido bien, además que necesitaba un ingreso extra para apoyar a su marido con los gastos del hogar y de sus 2 pequeños hijos. Actualmente le va muy bien con este negocio.

Ella solicita un crédito por US $775 que pagara en 6 meses para hacer remodelaciones a su negocio. Con tu apoyo Griselda seguirá adelante.

loans.use: To make renovations

loans.name: Milly

texts.en: Milly is a young and promising entrepreneur who is working hard to earn a living and to fend for her newborn daughter.  Milly operates a small business, which she started just one and a half years ago, where she sells silver jewels. Milly’s big dream is to own a big establishment where she can sell a great deal of jewels and other women’s clothing.  Meanwhile, she’ll keep working hard to offer new products to her customers and to attract new customers. With this loan, Milly would like to buy more goods to add to her stock.

loans.use: To puchase additional silver jewels to retail in her community.

loans.name: Jose Fabian

texts.es:
Mr. Fabian R. is a 29-year-old hard-working young man, he sells soft drinks, stuffed tortillas, tacos and cheese in order to obtain the income to be able to support his partner and his 2 children, 4 and 2 years old respectively. He lives in the city of Juigalpa of the department of Chontales. Mr. R. works hard to improve the condition of his house and the loan money will be use to improve his home. He will be changing the roof in order to avoid the disadvantages of the winter arrival.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Fabian R. es un joven trabajador de 29 años de edad, el se dedica a la venta de refrescos, enchiladas, tacos y quesillos con el fin de obtener ingresos que le ayudan a alimentar a su compañera de vida y a sus 2 hijos, uno de 4 y 2 años respectivamente. Habita en la ciudad de Juigalpa del departamento de Chontales. El Sr. R. lucha por acondicionar su casa y el dinero que reciba lo utilizará para mejorar su vivienda cambiando el techo de la misma y asi evitar inconvenientes con la llegada del invierno.

loans.use: Change the roof of her house.

loans.name: Chrek

texts.en: Chrek O. lives in the Kampong Cham province with her husband, Daoy Nat, her elderly mother, and her two younger sisters. She goes to the market each day and sells her handicrafts, making US$1.50 each day, while her husband works in construction. Her husband typically makes US$1.50 each day as well, but feels that he could increase his income and improve his business through the purchase of some new construction tools. Chrek O. has asked for a loan of US$700 to purchase these construction tools for her husband and to expand his business. She believes that this will be a good investment for her family, and it provides an opportunity for her to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase construction tools

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. L. Thi Nguyen is 30 years old. Currently she and her husband are running a refreshment beverage café out of their home. She has two children who are going to school. With a favorable storefront position and high quality customer service, the café is always able to attract a large number of customers. The family’s income is increasing day by day. Besides the main business at the café, the couple also raise pigs to supplement their income and invest in the children’s schooling. In this round of funding she is requesting 15,000,000 VND to buy more types of beers and beverages to sell. Their average monthly income is 3,000,000 VND.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Liên năm nay 30 tuổi, hiện nay hai vợ chồng chị đang kinh doanh cửa hàng giải khát tại gia đình.Gia đình chị hiện có hai con đang tuổi đi học. Với vị trí kinh doanh thuận lợi và thái độ phục vụ khách hàng chu đáo cửa hàng của gia đình chị luôn thu hút được số lượng khách hàng rất đông. Thu nhập của gia đình chị ngày càng được cải thiện. Ngoài thời gian làm việc tại cửa hàng vợ chồng chị còn kết hợp chăn nuôi thêm lợn để tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình và đầu tư cho các con ăn học. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.0000.000 đ để đầu tư mua thêm các loại bia, nước uống giải khát để bán cho khách hàng. Thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Buy more beers, beverages

loans.name: Oem

texts.en:
Mrs. Oem L. was born in 1949, and she lives in Preak Ta Ong Ti Pie Village in Kandal Province. She makes mats for a living. Meanwhile, her husband, Mr. Pich Pov (pictured on the left of the photograph), is a wedding chef. Notably, her husband earns less money between June and September than he does during the balance of the year because there are fewer wedding ceremonies during those particular months; then again, her husband can earn more income from January to May and from October to December.

In Mrs. Oem L.'s business, she does not have enough raw materials to make mats, so she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. As such, with the requested loan proceeds, she will address her shortage of raw materials by purchasing inputs to make mats. Mrs. Oem L. notes that she has two children who assist her with the business.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials to make mats.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.es: Pamela es una mujer muy trabajadora, dedicada a su tienda de abarrotes que con mucho esfuerzo logró adquirir junto a su esposo, gracias a la venta de artesanía, juntos elaborar collares y diversos adornos de decoración con semillas e hilos muy costosos y muy solicitados por los artesanos.Pamela desea contribuir con su pareja, quien desea viajar a la selva amazónica y traer estas singulares semillas, venderlas a los artesanos de su zona, además de los materiales que ellos necesitan para la producción de sus diversos adornos.Por ello, requieren de una suma de dinero que será invertida primeramente en adquirir algunos productos para su bodega y también para la actividad de artesano de su esposo, y así pueda viajar a la selva amazónica y traer gran cantidad de materia prima y artículos novedosos para ser ofrecidos a los turistas.
texts.en:
Pamela is a very hard-working woman dedicated to her grocery store, which she managed to acquire with great effort along with her husband, thanks to the sale of handicrafts. Together they embellish necklaces and various ornaments decorated with seeds and wires that are very expensive and highly sought after by artisans. Pamela wants to contribute with her partner, who wants to travel to the Amazon jungle and bring back these unique seeds, selling them to artisans in their area, in addition to the materials they need to produce the various adornments. For this they require a sum of money to be invested primarily in purchasing some products for their store and also for the handicraft activity of her husband, and thus they can travel to the Amazon jungle and bring back large quantities of raw materials and innovative items to be offered to tourists .

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the merchandise in their store in addition to paying for travel expenses of her husband to get materials to make his handicrafts

loans.name: Time's Group

texts.en:
